loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Koffi A. is a 42 year-old married craftsman and father of four children. To provide for the needs of his family, he carves wood with a reel-based machine in Avétonou, a village located approximately 95 kilometers from Lome, the Togolese capital. With his first credit from FECECAV, Koffi would like to increase the capacity of his company. Specifically, he hopes to arrange his workshop (which was damaged in a storm) and to equip it with new equipment. Thanks to Kiva for the opportunity to improve his life.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Koffi A. est un artisan âgé de 42 ans, marié et père de quatre enfants. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, il tourne les bois grâce à une machine qui fonctionne à base des bobines à Avétonou un village situé à environ 95 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Avec son premier crédit de FECECAV, Koffi veut augmenter la capacité de son entreprise. Spécifiquement, il espère aménager son atelier (qui avait subi un dégât causé par une tempête,) et doter son atelier de nouveaux équipements. Merci à Kiva pour l’opportunité d’améliorer sa vie.

loans.use: To arrange his workshop and to equip it with a new machine

loans.name: Kudirat

texts.en:
Kudirat Y. sells drinks in wholesale and retail. Her drinks business is thriving. She has a deep freezer where she cools these drinks for her customers and this has helped her to attract more customers. She needs an additional fund to keep her business thriving, so she is requesting a loan amount of $450 to buy more crates of drinks in order to meet the demands of her customers.

Kudirat is married and has five children; she is 42 years old and she and her family live in Lagos state. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: Purchase more drinks for sale.

loans.name: Javanshir

texts.en:
Javanshir B. is 57 years old. He is married and has six children. Due to the lack of employment options in his country, it was difficult for Javanshir to find work and support his family. Therefore, six years ago, he decided to start his own business selling men's shoes. Step by step he has been able to expand his inventory and, thanks to the good service he offers, his business is now growing rapidly.

Currently Javanshir needs a loan of $1200 which he will use to buy additional merchandise to meet the demand of his clients and to continue expanding his sales business. Let's support him!

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to meet the demand of his clients.

loans.name: Ma

texts.en: Mrs. Ma S. is a villager in Ampil Village in Kandal Province. She owns a 1.2 hectare field where she plants rice to earn her living. On her plantation, she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile and this is having a negative affect on her crop. To deal with this issue, Mrs. Ma S. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to improve her soil. She will use the rest of the loan to buy fuel to run her pump to water her crop. Mrs. Ma S. is 51 years old and the mother of three children. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory and the youngest one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to improve her soil, and fuel to run her pump to water her crop

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Mrs. Rose R., who has just married Jules, is 18 years of age and a resident of Looc Mansabay, Bajo Lopez, Jaena. Before they decided to tie the knot, they already had a little fishing business from which to earn a meager income. With the challenges of living as a young couple, they have a pump boat for an easier catch. However, they have realized that it is better to have a small sailboat so that they can fish even if it's low tide.

Both of them manage their business well and they work in tandem to sell their catch at the nearest market. Sometimes wholesale buyers from other towns and cities come to buy their fish. Out of their savings, they welcome the idea of building a small concrete house as their humble home. They are assured of Paglaum’s help, should there be a need for working capital.

Full of hope, Rose wants to own numbers of pump boats and sailboats for fishing and smiles at the thought of seeing their children waving their diplomas one day.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish nets and finance a small sailboat

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Chhun N., 47, is married and lives with four of her children in Kampong Cham Province. She works as a farmer, making $1 US each day, while her husband also does some farming and works as construction worker, making about $3 US each day as well. The family is also supported by two of their children who work in the local garment factories. There are times though, and during the rainy season, the couple will both go fishing and work together by catching and selling the fish. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians. In light of these difficult times, Chhun is asking for a loan of $800 US to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. This will reduce the cost that her husband spends everyday on public transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty O. is 39 years old and she is married with 6 children. Beauty lives in Benin City, Edo State. She sells drinks. She has lots of customers and she hopes to meet the demand of her customers. She needs a Kiva loan  to expand her business. She needs the loan amount of N 70,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Sandra Mercedes

texts.es:
Sandra L. es una dama que se ha caracterizado por ser una muy buena comerciante de venta de ropa y mochilas de todo tipo atendiendo en su tramo en el Mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega.

El negocio ha venido desarrollándose satisfactoriamente gracias a sus esfuerzos múltiples. Hoy en dia ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para la compra de las mochilas debido a que es inicio de año y por esto las ventas se incrementan por iniciar las clases escolares y es importante tener bastante mercadería para ofrecer y de esta forma satisfacer la necesidad de los clientes.
texts.en:
Sandra L. is a woman known for being a very good shopkeeper who sells clothing and backpacks of all types in her section of the Central Market in the city of Chinandega. Her business has been developing in a satisfactory way thanks to her many efforts. She is now looking for support from Kiva partner Ceprodel in order to purchase backpacks. As it is the beginning of the year her sales will increase because school classes are starting, and it is important to have enough merchandise to offer in order to satisfy her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing backpacks

loans.name: Felimon

texts.en:
One of the active members under the Individual Membership of Paglaum is Mr. Felimon B.. He lives in Mapang Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte. He has four children. One of his children is still studying.

His project is called peddling. He sells his commodities to neighboring barrios, especially on scheduled barangay “tabo” or market day of each barangay or town. He also transports other peddlers commodities for display at their target sites.

Their business is now slowly growing and they are so thankful for Paglaum’s credit services where his last loan amounting to PHP 5,000 was granted as additional capital for the purchase of additional goods for his peddling business.

Felimon hopes that one day, their business would grow big and that they will be able to help all their children finish college.

The couple said, it is because of Paglaum's teachings that they have learned to value the importance of savings and insurance, too.

loans.use: additional capital for grocery store and peddling activity

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Mme Akou S. est née le 31/12/1944 à  Dalavé. Mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants avec cinq (05) autres personnes en charge, elle a toujours fait preuve de bravoure et de bonne gestion. Son mari menuisier n'arrive plus à couvrir toutes les charges du ménage. C'est avec la vente de shampoing, basam et démêlants que Mme S. assiste son mari dans les charges du ménage. Afin de préserver cette tranquillité, elle sollicite un financement pour agrandir son étalage. De la vente de ses produits, elle tirera profit et veillera à la bonne marche de la famille.
texts.en:
Akou S. was born on December 31, 1944 in Dalavé. Married and the mother of five children and with five other dependents, she has proven time and again her spirit and her good management. Her husband, a carpenter, is no longer able to pay for all the household expenses. Mrs. S. helps her husband pay the family's expenses by selling balsam shampoo and conditioner. In order to maintain her peace of mind, she is asking for a loan to expand her display area. From the sale of her products she will make a profit and ensure all goes well with her family.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy balsam shampoo and conditioner for retail

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel O. sells poultry supplies like plastic and paper egg trays, poultry feeders, etc. He is 44 years old and married with two children. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 Nairas to purchase more merchandise. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry supplies to sell

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina es socia del Banco Comunal Renacer.
Catalina es casada, tiene 34 años y 3 hijos, Catalina viaja a las ferias de la región en donde vende pan, ropa variada y de las ferias compra cereales que luego los comercializa en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Catalina tiene una llantería junto a su esposo.
Catalina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa y neumáticos usados.
Los sueños de Catalina son educar a sus hijos y comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Catalina is a member of the Renacer Community Bank. She is married, 34 years old and has three children. Catalina travels to fairs throughout the region to sell bread and articles of clothing. She also purchases grains at the fairs, which she then sells in the food market in the city of Ayacucho. Catalina and her husband also own a tire shop. Catalina needs a loan of 2,000 soles [about US $675] which she will invest in the purchase of clothing and used tires. Catalina's dreams are to provide an education for her children and purchase a car.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and used tires

loans.name: H/maneno Group

texts.en:
Halima A. has been cooking and selling food in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for ten years. She belongs to H'maneno group loan (Group code 2007). She currently earns an average monthly profit approximately $185. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items for her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Halima A. is 45 years old, married, and has given birth to two children, now aged 22 and 13. She also cares for two additional dependents.

She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Halima H., Fatma, Mwajuma and Sauda. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Tarcila

texts.es:
Tarcila es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Tarcila es casada, tiene 62 años y 4 hijos, Tarcila tiene una vidriería en su casa llamada San Cristóbal, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo, además D. los vidrios venden vitrinas, para lo cual cuenta con 1 empleado.
Tarcila necesita un préstamo D. 2600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. aluminios.
Los sueños D. Tarcila son aumentar sus productos.
texts.en:
Tarcila is a member of Obreras ('Workers') community bank. She is 62-years old, married, and has four children. Tarcila has a glass shop called San Cristóbal in her house; she runs the business with her husband. In addition to glass they sell glass display cases, for which they have hired an employee to help with. Tarcila needs a loan of 2,600 PEN that will be invested in the purchase of aluminum. She dreams of increasing the products she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of aluminum

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita C. is an active member of Paglaum MPC. She is 44 years old and lives in Camanga Village, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is married with two children.

Pacita has been involved in vegetable gardening for almost thirty years with a monthly income of PHP 3,000. She is asking for a loan to be used to expand her gardening business. She hopes to yield a very good harvest for an added income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to expand her gardening business

loans.name: Amarzaya

texts.en:
Amarzaya C. is 31 years old and single. She lives with her 9-year-old daughter and younger sister in Ovorhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her daughter is a 4th grade student in a local secondary school.

Amarzaya has a small-scale convenience store situated in front of the local high school. She sells various food items, including snacks, chewing gums, soft-drinks, etc., at her store. Most of her customers are high school students. She started this small-scale food retail business in early 2008 and she has been doing well since then.

In the future, Amarzaya hopes to expand her retail business by offering more variety of food products that students like to buy. She says that she aims to save some money for her daughter from the business profits. Her dream is to see her daughter graduate successfully from a good university and pursue her dream. She requests a loan to purchase more food products for her food retail business.

loans.use: To purchase more food products to sell

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: “Leaf for shelter”…This is the main source of income for Mrs. Eva S., 49, a widow, and a resident of Dupol, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is blessed with 2 children: one is single and works in Manila City, and second is married and cares for his own family. Mrs. Eva S. is presently engaged in buying and selling of “Nipa”, a leaf of a tree from the palm family which is used for shelter, particularly for making roofs, and is sometimes used in making walls of houses. She started this business 18 years ago with an initial capital of PHP 20,000 from PMPC. Although she receives a monthly pension from her late husband, she is eager to continue with this business as it generates additional income for the family and as she can employ her neighbors in her “nipa” forming (paod) business. She joined PMPC in February 2009 and has had a good credit record. She is now applying for a loan of PHP 50,000 as additional capital for her existing business. She plans to expand her business to other municipalities and cities near Misamis Occidental and Zamboanga Del Sur.

loans.use: Additional capital for her "Nipa" buying and selling business

loans.name: Yudit Nelida

texts.es:
La señora Yudit es socia del Banco Comunal “Chijuyo Copapujo”, ubicado en el Centro Poblado de Chijuyo Copapujo del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 25 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 2 hijos, tiene estudios segundaria incompleta (1er grado), vive en la Comunidad de Chijuyo Copapujo.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le lo utilizara como capital para la fabricación de sogas.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella va adquirir cabuya en Desaguadero para luego fabricar sogas, también este capital lo va a invertir en el taller de mecánica que  tiene con su esposo.

Su deseo es comprarse su casa y un carrito.

A ella le gusta el ahorro y las facilidades de los préstamos.
texts.en:
Yudit is a member of the Community Bank, “Chijuyo Copapujo”, located in the centre of Chijuyo Copapujo in the district of Llave, province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 25 years old, and is married with tow kids. She did not finish high school, studying until first grade, and she lives in the community of Chijuyo Copapujo.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for two years, and her first loan was of 500.00 soles, an amount that she used as capital to make rope.

She currently needs an additional loan, and this is why she is asking for the sum of 300.00 soles. With this amount she will buy cabuya (a type of natural fibre also known as fique) in Desaguadero to make rope with. She will also invest this capital in the mechanics shop she has with her husband.

Her dream is to buy a house and a small car.

She likes the ease of these loans and the savings she makes.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de Cabuya para la fabricacionde sogas.

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en:
Zubeda is a member of the pangani borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 36 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children,Her children are aged 20,18,12 years.

Zubeda started her own  fishing  business selling fish 12years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 240,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Zubeda`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 250,000 Tsh in order to buy more fish for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Zubeda hopes to save money,pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Zurgaanjin

texts.en: M. Zurgaanjin lives with his wife and daughter in Uvurkhangai province in central Mongolia. His daughter is currently enrolled at the University of Science and Technology in Ulaanbatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife is unemployed. Zurgaanjin operates a transportation service in his town using a small transport truck. On average, he makes 10 daily trips helping to haul and deliver things for people. Zurgaanjin has found much success as a transport driver. He owns his truck and turns a daily average profit of 50,000 tugrugs. In the future, he has big plans to expand his business by buying new trucks and hiring more drivers. The success of his business is very important to him as he is paying to put his daughter through college. Zurgaanjin is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (~1050 USD) loan to purchase spare parts for his truck.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his truck.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de tomate, de piments verts, des légumes, des oberginesetc.

loans.name: Bernice

texts.en: Bernice A. sells charcoal in Abotoase. Bernice did not receive any formal education. She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is an Agric technical officer. Bernice helps her husband with the housekeeping expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more charcoal to sell. She hopes to save the new profits from her business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Hilda Maria

texts.en:
Hilda, a 45-year-old single woman with one child, cooks and sells meals out of her home on the weekends. This began three years ago when she was raising and fattening pigs; she began making and selling chicharron (pork sausage) on the weekends. Now she sells food from Friday to Monday and also runs a small general store where she sells soft drinks and a variety of groceries. These two businesses are run out of her home in the Maica area outside the city of Cochabamba.

Because things became a bit crowded, Hilda began constructing an additional room so that her small general store could be relocated there. It still needs a roof, so with this loan Hilda will purchase the construction materials she needs to finish it. Then she will move her shop to the room which will allow her to then begin providing more goods for sale through the shop.

Hilda looks forward to the future and the opportunity to improve her quality of life once the relocation of her shop is complete.

loans.use: The purchase of construction materials for relocating store

loans.name: Veth

texts.en:
Mrs. Veth E. is 38 years old and she lives in Trapaing Thmor village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns small piece of land on which she cultivates rice.

Mrs. Veth E.’s husband, Mr. Tong Se El, is a motorbike repairer. He is shown in the photo in front of a store. Now he wants to expand his business by purchasing a machine to clean his customers’ motorbikes. Thus, Mrs. Veth E. decided to request a loan for this purpose. She hopes to increase their income and improve her husband’s business.

This couple has two childrE., one of whom is attending the local school while the other stays at home to do housework.

loans.use: To purchase a machine for her husband to clean his customerss motorbikes

loans.name: Twekembe Nagawa Margaret Group

texts.en:
N. Margaret is a 30-year-old married woman who is blessed with two school-aged children, one of whom is in grade six and the other in grade two.
For the last eight years, Margaret has run a small business selling foodstuffs. This business enables her to pay her children's school fees. As she has only a small amount of capital and has to pay transport costs, she is requesting a loan to purchase bananas from villages to supply them in town markets.
Margaret is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to purchase a plot of land and construct a house so that she can earn a living by renting it out.

loans.use: To purchase bananas from villages to supply them in town markets

loans.name: Shirley Adriana

texts.es:
Shirley R. de 25 años, vive en la zona Perimetral de Guayaquil,vive en uno de los pocos sectores que tiene la facilidad de contar con agua, luz y alcantarillado,  el negocio de la vulcanizadora lo comenzó su papa y sus hermanos quienes con esfuerzo y dedicación pudieron sacarlo adelante, ahora Shirley lo administra.

Shirley hace las compras de las llantas grandes a $ 25.00 y las vende a  $ 40.00 y las llantas pequeñas a $ 6.00 y las vende a $ 12.00 las dificultades que tiene es en la transportación de las llantas por los ladrones y el arrendador ya que le molesta la bulla de las maquinas, el esposo la ayuda en los gastos de la casa realizando la actividad de pegar mármol en ciudadelas, no tienen hijos pero para poder tener mas grande su familia Shirley desea estar estable en una casa y no alquilarla.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar más llantas y tubos unos 950 para agrandar el negocio, en el futuro quiere poner otra vulcanizadota y en mucho mas tiempo poner un estudio fotográfico ya que Shirley sabe de esta actividad pero no ha podido por la situación económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Shirley R., 25, lives in the Perimetral area of Guayaquil. She lives in one of the few areas that has water, light, and sewage services. Her father started the tire repair shop, and through much effort her siblings have been able to succeed with it. Now, Shirley manages it. Shirley buys large tires for $25.00, and sells them for $40.00. She buys small tires for $6.00, and sells them for $12.00. The difficulties she has are thieves when she transports the tires, and the landlord is bothered by the noise from the machines. Her husband helps her with the household expenses. He works installing marble in gated communities. They do not have children. But, in order to be able to have a larger family Shirley wants to be stable in a house and not rent one. She wants to use the loan to buy more tires and pipes, 950, in order to expand her business. In the future she would like to set up another tire repair shop. In the distant future she would like to have a photography studio because Shirley knows this work. She has not been able to do it because of the economic situation of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tires and pipes for cars

loans.name: Komushana

texts.en:
Mrs. Komushana M. is a courageous lady aged forty-nine years. She has two children schooling. She owns a boutique located in the town of Bushenyi along Liberation Road.

Komushana is using the loan to purchase used clothes (skirts, shirts, dresses, trousers, and so forth) to sell. Her future hope is to educate her children and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn O. is from the village of Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Evelyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling clothing & shoes in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Evelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Evelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Munhzul

texts.en:
Munhzul is an agronomist and lives with her husband and two children. So far, she is very happy with the product because of it's affordable price, high efficiency and eco advantages. She promoted eco fuel to her surrounding community including neighbors, relatives and co-workers. Her brother has already bought fuel from her recommendation. 

About XacBank Eco Products Program
Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital in the world.  Winter temperatures can average -20 Celsius.  60% of the city population live in tents called gers, with wooden frames covered by layers of wool felt. On average, households located in the Ger Districts use 5 tons of coal and 1.5 tons of wood per year. 60% of the pollution in the city during the heating season is attributed to coal burned in the Ger Districts. The bottom fifth quintile spend as much as 40% of their monthly winter income on heating fuels.

XacBank has worked with MicroEnergy Credits to launch a line of eco-products consisting of energy efficient stoves and ger blankets, which will reduce energy consumption.

loans.use: To buy supplies of clean and energy efficient heating fuel

loans.name: Assitan

texts.fr:
Madame  Assitan G. est âgée de 31 ans, mariée  et mère  de 2 enfants. Elle  vit chez son mari  au camp militaire de  Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté  l’école pour des raisons sociales (adoptée par ses grands parents qui voyaient en l’école une porte de déperdition des jeunes filles), elle ne s’intéressa alors qu’au commerce qu’elle appris sur le tas, toute seule. Aujourd’hui, elle jouit d’une grande expérience dans le domaine.  
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est en relation depuis 48 mois. Après 8 prêts solidaires  tous bien remboursés, elle est à son 1er  prêt individuel. 
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 6 tonnes de mils. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des producteurs et  sur place. Madame  Assitan G.  vend toujours  au comptant à des revendeurs de la place et venant d’autres grandes villes.
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100. 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de satisfaire ses propres besoins et de participer à des événements sociaux (mariages, baptêmes etc.). 
Son ambition est d’acheter un terrain  à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mrs. Assitan G. is 31 years old, married and the mother of two children. She lives with her husband in the military camp in Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Never having been to school for social reasons (she was adopted by her grandparents who viewed school as a road to perdition for girls), she then only occupied herself with business, which she learned on the job, on her own. Today, she has a great deal of experience in this area. With the idea to increase her working capital, in order to make more profits, she approached Soro Yiriwaso, with whom she has worked for 48 months. After eight group loans, all fully repaid, she is on her first individual loan. She plans to use the loan to buy six tons of millet. She gets her stock from farmers and locally. Mrs. Assitan G. always sells for cash to local resellers and those from other large cities. With this loan, she plans to make a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA. These profits will allow her to satisfy her own needs and participate in social events (weddings, baptisms, etc.). Her goal is to buy a plot of land to live on.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grain

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella.
Maria es soltera, tiene 60 años y 1 hijo, Maria viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende abarrotes y de las ferias compra papa, cereales que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y fideos.
El sueño de Maria es tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank "Anabella." She is single, 60 years old, and has a son. Maria travels to the different markets in the region where she sells groceries and buys potatoes and cereals, which she later sells in the markets in the city of Ayacucho. Maria needs a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles, which she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar and noodles. Maria dreams of having a store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and noodles.

loans.name: Kamu Kamu B Nampewo Edith Group

texts.en:
Edith N. is 31 years old and a businesswoman. She is married with two children schooling and has two additional dependents staying with her. 

She has had a retail shop for over 10 years. She is using the loan to purchase retail items such as sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, and so forth, for resale as well increasing her business stock. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, and so forth for sale as well increasing her business stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Asomoah

texts.en:
Asamoah describes himself as cheerful and prides himself on his patience and strong customer relations. He is 55 years old and runs a stationery shop. He has been operating his stationery shop for ten years and is eager to be taking out this loan. He plans to use this loan to purchase variety of stationery: note pads, pens, cards, books, etc., to serve his customers. 

Asamoah’s shop is strategically located near both offices and schools. This enables him to sell his stationery to the targeted market. He hopes the extra profits he will generate will enable him to expand into a bigger bookshop. 

Asamoah is married and his wife is a primary school teacher. Together they have four children, ranging in age from 11 – 18 years. Their common dream is to be financially self-sustaining and to be able to support their children through quality education.

loans.use: To purchase assorted stationery in bulk

loans.name: Miramar Feminina 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Nery is the coordinator of her group Miramar Feminina, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the lush, rugged Samana peninsula, an area with a nascent tourism industry where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and three children.

Nery is excited to be taK. her 10th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running an ambulatory food stand in which she sells basic staples of the Dominican diet such as chicken, yuca, lentils, fish, and salad. Additionally, she will invest in a freezer to store her goods in her home.  She will use the profits to purchase clothing and medicine for her children, investing in her education as well as the education of her children and saving towards finishing construction on her home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy chicken, yuca, lentils, fish, salad and a freezer

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita S. is a 48 year old married woman who supports her family with her general store business. She lives in Hda. Bubog, Talisay City, Negros Occidental with her husband and their 4 school-aged children.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP4,000.

Rita is now borrowing PHP23,000 to use as additional working capital. This will be her 15th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP23,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Rita aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María, D. 29 años, es viuda y tiene una hija. Juntas residen en L. hermosa selva cusqueña, ubicada en L. localidad D. Quimbiri, donD. tienen su propia casa. María es una persona estratégica cuando se lo propone, desD. luego, que inició con una pequeña tienda, como todo primer negocio, tuvo sus primeras caídas, pero supo salir adelante. Es así que su tienda empezó a crecer D. manera ostentosa, asimismo abrió una fuente D. soda, todo ello con L. finalidad ganar a L. competencia y por enD. le genera ingresos extras. A pesar D. que tiene mucha demanda, por L. buena atención que lo ofrece hacia sus clientes, elL. aspira ampliar su negocio, insertando nuevos productos que estén al alcance D. sus clientes, así como tener un espacio propio para su fuente D. soda. Generalmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe L. ayuda D. su hija. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus respectivos pagos, además esta conforme con su grupo comunal por L. transparencia y honestidad  a L. hora D. tomar decisiones. Con el crédito que solicita, lo piensa invertir en L. compra D. productos para abastecer su tienda y poder cumplir con L. demanda D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
María is 29 years old. She is a widow, and she has a daughter. Together they resiD. in their own house in the town of Quimbiri, which is located in the beautiful Cusco jungle. María is a determined person when she sets her mind on something. After a while she started a small store. Like all first businesses, she had her defeats, but she knew how to get ahead. Her store started to grow a lot. She also opened a soda fountain. She did this to beat the competition and generate extra income. In spite of having a lot of demand because of the good service she offers her customers, she wants to expand her business. She wants to carry new products for her customers, and she wants the soda fountain to have its own space. She generally works by herself, but her daughter occasionally helps her. This is her ninth loan with MFP, and she pledges to continue making her payments on time. Also, she is satisfied with her communal bank because of their transparency and honesty when making decisions. She will use the requested loan to buy products to stock her store and be able to satisfy her customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to stock her store

loans.name: Benkadi Vii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI VII  est composé  de femmes mariées du village de Sokan dans la préfecture de San, région de Ségou. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 32 ans, au moins 6 enfants et  cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe Benkadi VII ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
SALIMATA S. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture,  au grand marché de Kimparana. Après l’hivernage, sa récolte est  stockée pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elle ait de la valeur avant d’être vendue  au grand marché de  M’Pèrèsso en détail (souvent en gros) au comptant à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI VII comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 20 000 à 25 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi VII group is composed of married women from the village of Sokan in the San prefecture, in the Segou Region (the fourth administrative region of Mali). The women live in traditional families. They are on the average 32 years old , have at least six children, and cultivate peanuts. In order to make their agricultural work profitable, three years ago they have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program. After having duly repaid previous loans, they are now on their third agricultural loan. Salimata S. plans to use her loan to purchase a sufficient supply of peanut seeds, small tools and agricultural inputs, at the big market in Kimparana. After the winter season, the harvest is stored for a while as its price increases, before being sold at the big market of M’Pèrèsso, retail (often wholesale) for cash to a customer base composed of resellers mostly coming from big towns. After selling their produce, members of the Benkadi VII group plan to earn between 20,000 and 25,000 West African francs each, which will be used to pay off the loan interest and cover ongoing family expenses.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing agricultural inputs, seeds and small tools

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La señora Celia vive en casa propia en la zona de san Martín de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casada tiene tres hijos en edad escolar de 10,7 y 3 años , el esposo trabaja como chofer asalariado y ella vende almuerzos para generar sus ingresos y poder ayudar a su familia, primera ves que saca crédito en Impro y es Kiva también por primera vez.
El crédito lo destinará a la compra de arroz, papa, fideo y otros insumos para su  negocio de venta de comida.
Por el carácter social puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Celia lives in her own house in the San Martín area of the city of La Paz. She is married and has three school age children; ten, seven, and three years old. Her husband works as a salaried drive. She sells lunches to generate income and to be able to help her family. This is her first loan with Impro, and it is also her first with Kiva. She will use the loan to buy rice, potatoes, noodles, and other supplies for her business of selling food. Her character and reputation qualify her for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for her business of selling food

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna T. is a 46-year-old, married woman who supports her family by operating two businesses: a general store and a pig fattening business. She lives in the village of Batuan in the municipality of Valladolid in Negros Occidental Province.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1984 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and pig fattening business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 13,000 PHP.

Edna is now borrowing 19,500 PHP to use as additional working capital for her businesses. This will be her fourteenth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Edna aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than 1 USD a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To add working capital to her businesses

loans.name: Mrs. Chhun Roatha Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank group is made up of fourteen people who live in the Pou Roung village in the Takeo province. 

Chhun R., 40, is the village bank president. She was selected by the other members of the group who will use their portion of the loan in various ways to support their businesses this year. She owns a general store in the local village where she sells groceries to earn large profits to support her family. Her husband, Ne Morn Thorng, is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land where he grows crops to support his family. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand. She is asking for a loan to buy groceries as well as two piglets to raise for a new business, and to hire a plow machine for her field. She is the mother of three children who are students in school and also help their parents' businesses.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Irshad's Group

texts.en:
Irshad is 44 years old and lives in an industrial city called Gujranwala, Pakistan. She owns a house with three rooms and has lived in it with her family for the last twenty-six years. Her husband works in a gas station, her elder son runs a grocery shop in the market, and her youngest son does laboring work.

Irshad supports her family by doing sewing work. She receives orders from her neighborhood clients and completes them on time to earn an income for her family. She is good at her job and receives regular orders. 

Irshad has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her son’s grocery shop. With the loan, he will buy groceries for his shop to offer more variety to his customers. Irshad hopes that her son will be able to expand his business by making proper use of the loan money.

Irshad is a regular loan user and this is her 4th loan. She has maintained a good credit behavior in previous years and has never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To enable her son to buy more groceries for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gasoline

loans.name: Remelita

texts.en:
Remelita M. is from the village of Anakan, Gingoog City. She is 55 years old. Remelita is widowed and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Remelita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, instant noodles, junk food, and detergents in the local community. Remelita has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Remelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Remelita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Remelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Rosa Matilde

texts.es: Rosa Matilde tiene 62 años. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pues han sido de gran ayuda para su negocio. Ella se dedica a un bazar trabajo que realiza desde hace mas de 13 años pues ha demostrado ser una mujer muy responsable   con el paso del tiempo es que ha mejorado su actividad. Este crédito es para la compra de botones, hilos, cintas, zipper entre otras cosas que son útiles para su negocio. Su meta es seguir apoyando a sus hijos en lo que pueda.
texts.en: Rosa Matilde is 62 years old.  This is not the first time that she has taken a loan.  They have been a great help to her business.  She has a store where she sells sewing supplies which she has had for more than 13 years.  She has shown herself to be a very responsible woman who, over time, has improved her business.  This loan will be used to buy buttons, thread, ribbons, zips, etc.  Her goal is to continue supporting her children as best she can.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Tabitha Wairimu

texts.en:
Tabitha has practiced farming in the town of Ndunyu Njeru for the last 10 years. She also practices dairy farming. She is 66 years old, married to I. Chege and they have four children.

Tabitha was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her fourth loan. She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time. She is planning to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow. In the future, Tabitha hopes to practice large scale farming.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is a married man with two children both of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

He has operated a retail shop for the past four months; neighbours and passersby are his potential customers. Antony faces a major challenge of theft in his business. He hopes to establish a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to open a soft drinks shop and purchase crates of sodas. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To open a soft drinks shop and purchase crates of sodas

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: El señor Carlos Alberto G. A. tiene 37 años y vive en compañía de su esposa y tres hijos en el barrio Ciudadela 20 de Julio de Barranquilla. El tiene un puesto estacionario en las afueras del centro comercial Metrocentro, al sur de la ciudad, en el cual vende estuches para teléfonos celular, control remoto de televisores y CD de música y videos. El negocio comenzó en el año 2006 por sugerencia de un amigo quien le prestó un pequeño capital para comprar mercancía. Al principio tuvo dificultad para ubicar los pedidos de los clientes por la enorme cantidad de CD que tiene, pero hoy en día es un experto, e incluso, se atreve a recomendar canciones de artistas populares o películas. Este es el cuarto préstamo que tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en la compra de artículos de papelería como agendas, libretas y lapiceros para atender la próxima temporada escolar que comienza en Enero.  El promedio de ventas semanales es de $ 600.000 COP y el margen de utilidad es del 40%.Antes de estar vinculado a la Fundación, el microempresario se financiaba con créditos de particulares que debía cancelar en cuotas diarias y a unas elevadas tasas de interés. Por la experiencia positiva que ha tenido en la Fundación, ha recomendado a varios amigos comerciantes que también se vinculen. Recientemente  el señor Carlos se capacitó en contabilidad, mercadeo y endeudamiento. Esto le ha permitido llevar un mejor control de sus cuentas que se reflejan en la puntualidad de sus pagos y el mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de su familia. Su sueño en el futuro es comprar una casa propia y para lograrlo ya empezó a ahorrar.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto G. A. is 37 years old and lives with his wife and three children in 'Ciudadela 20 de Julio' neighborhood of Barranquilla.  He has a stationary stall just outside the Metrocentro shopping mall, in the south of the city, where he sells cell phone cases, television remote controls, music CDs and videos.  He started his business in 2006.  It was his friend who suggested he start his business and this friend also loaned him a small amount of capital with which to buy merchandise.

At the beginning, Carlos had trouble locating his customers' orders because of the enormous quantity of CDs but he is now an expert and he even dares to recommend songs by popular artists, or movies.

This is Carlos' fourth loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he plans to invest it in buying stationery items such as diaries, notebooks and pens for the upcoming back-to-school season which begins in January.  His average weekly sales are 600,000 Colombian pesos and his profit margin is 40%.  Before he came to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, this small businessman financed his business with personal loans that he had to pay back in daily instalments, paying very high interest rates.  As a result of his own positive experience with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, he has recommended us to several friends who are also salespeople and they have joined too.

Recently, Carlos received training in accountancy, marketing and debt management.  This has enabled him to take better control of his accounts and this has been reflected in the punctuality of his repayments and the improvement of his family's quality of life.  His dream for the future is to buy his own home and he has already started to save in order to achieve this goal.

loans.use: To buy stationery items

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden L. is from the village of Agoho, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 53 years old. Eden is married and has three adult children. 

To make a living, Eden owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling clothing and shoe products from NATASHA & AVON in the local community. She also makes and sells snacks such as chicken and pork kababs and hotdogs on a stick. Eden has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Eden joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eden has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Eden is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional ingredients for the kababs, such as pork and chicken meat. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Eden from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for kababs, such as pork and chicken meat

loans.name: Chamreun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chamreun H. is a widowed mother with two daughters. Both have full-time employment. The family lives in a village along national road number two about 12 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chamreun is a cleaner for a garment factory. She traveled to work by her bicycle very often. She already asked for a Kiva loan to purchase a motorbike. Unluckily, the motorbike was stolen; she is again commuting to work by bicycle.

Hence, she has applied for another loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike to get to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to get to work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase sacks of compost

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok Y., a sixty-eight year-old resident of Kompong Tom Province, possesses a plot of farmland upon which she grows rice. She is married to Mr. Ou Ken, age 72, who also earns his living as a local farmer. They are blessed with four children, one of whom is a blacksmith worker, another a sewing worker, while the other two are married.

Sok is concerned because one of her sons has encountered some financial problems in his business. She is therefore requesting a loan to purchase iron for her son to weld in his window construction and sales business.

loans.use: To purchase iron for her son's business

loans.name: Bulindo Development Group-Mukono

texts.en: 61-year-old Lawrence M. is a cheerful and happy-go-lucky father of eight kids who are all in school in Mukono Town. He has operated a general merchandise retail shop for the last two years in Bulindo. He says he began this shop immediately after he retired from his government Job. Profits from this business, which are to the tune of about $205 per month, have come in handy in his make-ends-meet endeavors.  He belongs to Bulindo Development Group-Mukono and he says he is requesting this loan to purchase more general merchandise and retail commodities to resell at his shop.

loans.use: to purchase more general merchandise and retail commodities to resell.

loans.name: Juliana Ndungu

texts.en:
Juliana  K. is 63 years old, married to John, who is a civil servant hence  contributes to the family income.  She has three children and has been a farmer for a period of 15 years, getting an income of approximately 15,000 Kenya shillings a month.


This is her fourth loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous ones. She wants to use the loan  a mount to buy seedlings and prepare the land for planting. 

She hopes to grow several varieties of crops in her land to increase the profit and to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and prepare the land for planting.

loans.name: Magrina

texts.en:
Magrina J. K. is a woman of 38 years, married and the mother of three children. They live in Leltot, in Eldoret. She does maize farming in the same area and has been in this business for 11 years. She gets a monthly income of 12,000 KES.

This will be Magrina's second loan with KADET Ltd. She repaid her other loan successfully. 

She plans to use the entire loan to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, maize seeds, etc. With the income she is going to get from selling the maize, she plans to pay school fees for her children. 

In the future, she wants to buy one more acre of land and also educate her children.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, maize seeds, etc.

loans.name: Munhbat

texts.en:
Munhbat is 28 years old and lives with his wife and only daughter in a house in Sansar of Bayanzurh district, Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife works at G-Mobile, Telecommunication Company. 

Munhbat manages a souvenir trading business at Sunday Plaza, one of the largest and crowded trading centers in Ulaanbaatar city. He has been managing his business for 3 years and has gained much experience. He is planning to expand his business in the future. He is a generous man who says, "I am planning to rent one more stall in order to increase my business sales." He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more souvenirs for his business inventory.

loans.use: To purchase more souvenirs for inventory.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua A. is married and has seven dependents. She has no educational background but sells bags of charcoal to make her living in Amoanda near Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. Her husband is a farmer. Ekua uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of her home. 

Ekua wants to expand her charcoal business and needs a loan so she can supply her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to build a shelter to protect the charcoal from rain.

loans.use: to expand her charcoal business so she can supply her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to invest in merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es: Mariluz, de 24 años reside en la comunidad del Palomar (selva central peruana), ahí formó su familia junto a Jesús, su esposo, desde hace 5 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Brayan y Lorena a los que cuidan y educan en su casa propia. Con sus manos trabajadoras que de niña aprendieron a vivir de la agricultura; ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas. Gracias a la experiencia y su intención de ahorra logró obtener 4 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, donde siembra, café, plátano y yuca, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender hasta el mercado de La Merced, donde las vende al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta La Merced, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Pero agradece el apoyo que le brinda su esposo, quien le ayuda en las labores agrícolas y coordinan su próxima siembra. “Juntos planeamos la próxima cosecha”, comenta con mucha alegría, “nuestro deseo es contar un capital propio”. Es por ello que para más adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar sus plantaciones y de esa manera brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Aroma de café” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Mariluz de obtener su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de un motor nuevo para su máquina despulpadora, que sirve para pelar el grano de café maduro.
texts.en:
Mariluz, 24, lives in her own home in the Palomar community (central Peruvian jungle), with her husband of five years, Jesús, and their two children, Brayan and Lorena.  Having learned farming as a child, Mariluz works the land and makes it productive.  Thanks to her experience and savings she has managed to own four acres of farmland where she grows coffee, bananas and yucca.  She sells them at the La Merced market, wholesale.  What she enjoys most about her work is caring for the crops.  She has been in this activity for four years and feels the hardest part is transporting her products to the market since the sacks are very heavy and this takes a lot of effort.

She is grateful for the support she receives from her husband who helps with the farm activity and coordinates the planting seasons.  "Together we plan out the next harvest.", she says cheerfully.  "Our goal is to have our own capital."  In the future she wants to buy more land to increase crop production so she can give her children a better future.  She belongs to the communal bank "AROMA DE CAFÉ" and this is her second loan through MFP.  She hopes this small loan can help her reach her goals.  She is committed to paying it back on time, as she has done previously.  She enjoys being a part of the communal bank because all of its members are responsible, supportive people.  If Mariluz receives your support she will invest the money in a new pulper to hull ripe coffee beans.

loans.use: To buy a coffee pulper.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en: Hamza (who appears in the picture) has a tailoring workshop. It is a small one that meets the demands of the village where he lives. Hamza hired a new employee as the demand is increasing, and he needs to purchase a sewing machine. Hamza took out a loan from FATEN to purchase the sewing machine and meet the demand. He makes children's clothes and distributes to stores of the village. He hopes to start working with the stores of the city of Jenin.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for the new employee of a tailoring workshop.

loans.name: Angela Lastenia

texts.es:
Angela Lastenia  tiene 27 años, es soltera vive con su familia, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo Jhair de 9 años.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALLE ALTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Voluntad de Dios en el Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra maíz y arroz.

Angela  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y soya,  Compra sus productos en el Comercial Salomón y vendes sus productos en los comisariatos y tiendas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría a superarse económicamente y  mejorar su producción. Su sueño es comprarse su propio terreno.  

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Angela Lastenia is 27 years old. She is single and lives with her family in the canton of Ventanas, in Los Rios province. She has 1 child, Jhair, who is 9 years old.

The VALLE ALTO communal bank is located in the Voluntad de Dios neighborhood in the canton of Ventanas. The members of this communal bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice. 

Angela works in agriculture, growing corn, rice and soybeans. She buys her supplies at the Salomón commercial center and sells her products at the markets and stores.

She is requesting this loan to plant corn and rice; she will buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops. The loan will help her get ahead economically and improve her production. Her dream is to buy her own plot of land. 

She enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa works hard to support 6 children. She is married and has a sugarcane farming business in the Philippines.

Elsa requested a PHP 3,500 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.  She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light-source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Elsa is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria is 51 years old and married with eight children. With two children in school, Apolinaria works very hard to provide for her family.

Apolinaria runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her store.

Apolinaria has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, snack foods and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future Apolinaria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anjelina

texts.en:
Anjelina is 54 years old and a single mother of three. She is able to raise her children with the income she gets from selling bags. In addition, she does outside catering for more income generation.  
Anjelina has been operating her businesses for three years and has employed two people to assist her.
Anjelina has benefited from Faulu Kenya, which has helped empower her economically. She hopes to own a business premise so as to save on rental fees. She has requested 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy utensils for her catering business and children's bags to sell.

loans.use: To buy utensils for her catering business and children's bags to sell.

loans.name: Ludah

texts.en: Ludah  is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. She has a pigpen in which she raises and then sells grown, matured pigs. She has had this business for 6 years, and has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a married woman who has no children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are electricity bills and food for the family.

For the past four years, she has been operating a poultry-selling business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Constance faces a major challenge of competition in her business. She dreams of expanding her poultry business in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is 53 years old and lives in Ibabao, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 8 children. 

Leonor has a furniture making business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month.  

She has a requested a loan to purchase equipment for making furniture.
 
Leonor has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. 

In the future, Leonor hopes to have a big furniture business.  She is a MIGS member of PMPC.  

She is a hardworking mother who takes good care of her family.  Leonor has a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase equipments for her furniture making business

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is a farmer, planting corn in the Philippines. He is 57 years old, married and blessed with four children. Among his children, only his youngest child went to college and is about to finish. His other three children are already working and help him financially to sustain their family necessities and his child's school fees.

Ricardo wanted to borrow a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy piglets and hog feed. He plans to develop his business, earn a higher income and save some of it for the future emergencies of the family, especially since he and his wife are getting older.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith  lives in Uganda.  She is married and has one child, who is in school. She also takes care of her brother. Faith has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for two years, and she works 6 days a week. Faith retails her products in the market. Faith has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. Seasonality and having to deal with defaulters are the main business challenges for Faith. Her goals and aspirations are to sell charcoal on wholesale and also to own a home. Faith lives in a house that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.ru: Дилфуза замужем имеет двоих детей. Муж находится на заработках в России. Она живет вместе c родителями мужа. У них свое дехканское хозяйство. Аграрное производство имеет свои риски и свои доходы, на протяжении нескольких лет из-за непогоды они не имели хорошей прибыли, чтобы наладить работу на земле, посев, приобретение крупного рогатого скота им пришлось много работать. Последние два года, получая займы, они наладили выращивание сельхоз культур в своем фермерском хозяйстве. Приобрели скот. Дилфуза хочет получить займ на покупку грубого корма и нескольких голов крупного рогатого скота, также постройку помещения для скота. Она заранее благодарна вам за помощь и надеется получить займ для намеченных целей.
texts.en: Dilfuza is married and has two children. Her husband does temporary work in Russia. She lives with her in-laws, and they have a small farm. Agricultural work has its risks. During the past few years, they have not been able to make much money, due to bad weather. They have had to work hard to prepare the land, sow crops and purchase cattle. With the help of borrowed money, over the past two years, they have successfully began cultivating crops on their farm and have acquired some cattle. Dilfuza would like a loan to purchase cattle feed and additional heads of cattle, and to construct a shed. She is grateful for your help and hopes to secure a loan for the listed items.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and repair the cow shed

loans.name: Odonchimeg

texts.en:
Odonchimeg is 45 years old and lives with her husband and son in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. Her husband is a head accountant in a local company and her son is a school student. She started her garment retailing business in 2008 by quitting her old job as a teacher in secondary school. Even though she is fairly new to the business, she is known for her high-quality and stylish clothes. 

Now that winter is approaching, she needs to sell warmer clothes. She is a bright and hardworking woman who says, "It is my mission to get my son educated." She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy more garments.

loans.use: To buy more garments for resale.

loans.name: Yadira Yessenia

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte (Portoviejo) se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Yadira, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 18, 10 y 4 años de edad, los mismos que  estudian Universidad, colegio y escuela. Su esposo trabaja en el Municipio de la ciudad.

Ella tiene una ferretería en la casa de sus padres, allí trabaja todos los días con su esposo y sus hijos cuando ellos están desocupados, en su negocio sus clientes pueden encontrar todo tipo de  material de construcción, sus productos los recibe en su local directamente de fabrica por lo cual recibe a muy buen precio, lleva 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien ya que poco a poco lo ha ido ampliando.
 
Este crédito es para comprar tubos, hierro, materiales para instalaciones de agua y eléctricas, entre otras cosas. Lleva tres años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos poco a poco ha ido creciendo en su negocio.

Su sueño es tener un local propio ya que donde tiene su negocio es de su papá.
texts.en:
In Rocafuerte Canton (Portoviejo) the members of the “Dulce Amistad” (Sweet Friendship) communal bank meet every two weeks.  This place is known for the delicious sweets the locals make that are renown throughout the country and for the warmth of its kind and hardworking people.

We met Yadira, 34, here.  She’s married and has three children who are 18, 10, and 4 years old and are going to university, secondary and elementary school.  Her husband works for the city administration.

She has a hardware store in her parents’ house.  She works there every day with her husband and children when they are not busy.  Customers can find all sorts of building materials and supplies in her business.   Her products are delivered directly to her store by the manufacturer so she gets them at very good prices.  She’s been in business 8 years and does very well since she’s gradually been expanding it.

This loan is to buy pipes, iron, and supplies for water and electrical installations, among other things.  She’s been in the communal bank three years and likes it because thanks to the loans her business has been growing little by little.  Her dream is to have her own locale since the place she currently has her business is her father’s.

loans.use: to buy pipes, iron, water and electrical installation supplies, etc.

loans.name: Milimani Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Milimani Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Salome is the facilitator of the Milimani Group. She takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund's best prices, to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Salome had a very good maize yield harvesting nine bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Salome was only able to harvest five bags of maize on half an acre of land. 
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Salome and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance. 
With income from maize sales, Salome will ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Milimani Group will each plant between half and one acre of maize. 
Salome is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 46 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for her cows.

Marilyn has been raising livestock  for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for her cows.

loans.name: Carmen Paula

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Carmen, tiene  51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aún viven en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en la pesca, él junto a dos  personas más a quienes les pagan un sueldo se van a alta mar y se desplazan a la par de un barco pesquero a cual les  entregan el pescado fruto de su trabajo diario, en este barco entregan sus productos  y reciben el pago por el mismo, ellos se van por 20 a 25 días seguidos y después de este tiempo regresan  a sus hogares para luego de una semana de descanso volver a alta mar. El se dedica a este negocio desde pequeño y siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que siempre obtienen buena pesca.

Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas, anzuelos, grapas, combustibles, alimentos, y otros materiales de pesca. Lleva 10 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con  los créditos puede ser útil y colaborar con algo en los gastos del hogar. 

Su sueño es comprar otra lancha.
texts.en:
The communal bank Honduras 2000 meets twice a month in the canton of Jaramijo (near Manta). This area is known for its beautiful beaches, which bathe the coasts of this beautiful place. Here the majority of the inhabitants are very hard-working and are dedicated to the tasks of the sea.

In this place we meet Señora Carmen. She is 51 years old. She is married and from her marriage has five children, all of whom are adults. Two still live in her home. Her husband is a fisherman.

She is a very good spouse who is obtaining the loan so that her husband can use it in fishing. He, along with two other people to whom they pay a salary, go out on the high seas. They tie up next to another fishing boat to which they hand over their catch, the fruit of their daily labor. On this boat, they hand over their catch and receive payment for the same. They go out for 20 to 25 days at a time and after this time they come back to their homes. After a week of rest, they return to the high sea. He has been working at this business since he was young, and it has always gone well for him, since they always get a good catch.
