This loan is to buy nets, tethering ropes, fishing hooks, grappling hooks, fuel, food, and other materials for fishing. She has been in the communal bank for 10 years, and she likes it because with the loans she can be useful and contribute something to the household expenses.

Her dream is to buy another boat.

loans.use: to buy nets, tethering ropes, fish hooks, grappling hooks, fuel, food, and other materials for fishing.

loans.name: Hosiyat

texts.ru: Хосият 47 лет, она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Она сотрудничает с нашей организацией с 2002 года. С период нашего сотрудничества имеет хорошую кредитную историю Первый кредит получила для покупки сезонного товара детской обуви.  Продавала свой товар на раскладушке  на небольшом участке, платя за небольшой участок определенную сумму как за аренду. Со временем начала расширять свой товарооборот и увеличивать свой капитал. Сейчас она торгует не только детской обувью, но и мужской обувью и одеждой. Рынок который она раньше торговала закрыли и перенесли на новое место. Настоящий кредит получает для закупки теплых мужских курток и ботинок.
texts.en: Hosiyat is 47 years old, married and has four children.  She has been partnering with our organization since 2002 and has had a good credit history over this period of time.  Hosiyat obtained her first loan to purchase a seasonal inventory of children's shoes.  She used to sell her merchandise on a cot in a small space and had to pay a set amount for this space as a lease.  With time, she started to increase her goods turnover and capital.  Currently, Hosiyat sells not only children's shoes, but also men's shoes and clothing.  The market, where she previously worked, was closed and moved to a new location.  Hosiyat is requesting this loan to purchase warm men's jackets and boots.

loans.use: to purchase men's warm jackets and boots

loans.name: Segundo

texts.en:
Segundo has a shop where he sells animal feed, medicines and live poultry. He sells products for all types of animals ranging from pigs to ducks. Many people in his community raise these types of animals in their own backyards in order to resell them later for profits. He learned this business while being an assistant for his uncle for ten years. His uncle motivated him to start his own shop about 4 years ago and now he has a spot in his home where he makes his sales.

Segundo needs this loan in order to invest in products at wholesale prices and quantities. He also wants to help his wife set up a part of their business as a small food market. They have been experimenting with the idea with some sales and they see potential for increased profits.

Segundo and his wife are a young couple with one child. They have a humble home made out of cement and they want to continue making improvements to it.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Segundo needs this loan in order to invest in products at wholesale prices and quantities.

loans.name: Immaculate Nchang

texts.en:
Born in 1979, Immaculate is a single mother of four children. The death of her mother who was helping her and her children when her husband abandoned her for another woman was very hard for her, but it has ceased being anguishing and is now a good reason motivating her to forge ahead. GHAPE loans with affordable conditions are opportunities she must maximize. With her two previous loans, she succeeded in providing her community with puff-puffs for breakfast. She also provides roasted fish in the evenings for dinner for families and friends who want to have a meal out.

With a loan of $600, she plans to buy a refrigerator, fresh fish, beans, oil, flour, salt, sugar, and firewood. The location of her business site and increased capital which will enable her to buy in bulk are factors she believes will contribute to a successful business venture.

She plans to repay her loan in 18 months. The first installment shall be due in the fourth month from the date of disbursement of loan.

loans.use: Frying Accra beans and roasting fish

loans.name: Shem

texts.en: Shem O. operates a bicycle repair and shoe shining business in Kondele, Kisumu. He is married with 2 children. He also takes care of 3 children who were orphaned following the death of his elder brother and sister-in-law from HIV/AIDS. He has repaid his 1st loan of 25 USD, and would like to add a loan of 175 USD in order to buy more spare parts and expand his business.

loans.use: I intend to expand my bicycle repair shop

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia G. is 49 years old. She is married and has 5 children. When Sonia graduated from secondary school, she entered a copy-typist course and for many years worked as a copy-typist in an organization. Four years ago, she became interested in business. Sonia borrowed money from her sister and gradually started her own business selling men's clothes. Currently, she rents a stall in a market, where she sells various goods, mostly men's and kids' clothes. However, Sonia would like to buy a new range of clothes for sale and therefore needs a loan of US$1,000. Since Sonia sells summer clothes, for which there is currently a large demand, the loan will also help the village habitants in obtaining more diverse summer clothing. Sonia will repay the loan in 12 months.

loans.use: Purchase of various men’s and kids' clothes for sale

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is married and has 2 kids of 7 and 9 years of age. Her husband works as a messenger, and as he works on commission sometimes his wages are not enough to meet their household needs. Juana therefore decided to help out with their income, and 3 years ago she started to help someone to sell their products, earning commission. She then decided to go it alone and, with the financial help of her sister, started her own business selling bedclothes and towels. It has gone very well and she has a lot of clients which helps her earn more for her home.

Juana would like a loan of $325 to buy merchandise so that her business will continue to grow. She will repay it in 3 months. Her and her family thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Juana es una mujer casada y tiene dos hijos de 7y 9 años de edad respectivamente, su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa de mensajería, ella inició con su negocio, por que a su esposo le pagaban por comisiones y lo que ganaba era muy poco para mantener su hogar, así que ella decidió ayudarlo con los gastos del hogar y empezó hace 3 años ayudándole a una persona a vender sus productos y ganaba una comisión por la venta, así que decidió independizarse, una de sus hermanas le presto un pequeño capital para que empiece con su negocio de venta de blancos que son ropa de cama y toallas, y ahora con el tiempo ha ido mejorando con su negocio y a tener más clientes, lo que le permite obtener un mejor ingreso para su hogar.

Juana está solicitando un préstamo por US $ 325 para poder comprar mercadería y así poder continuar y crecer con su negocio, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses, ella y su familia te agradecen mucho por tu apoyo en su crecimiento.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Comprar mercaderia

loans.name: Brígida

texts.en:
Brigida and her husband have recently become empty-nesters, with two of their three children married and the other one now in college studying mechanical engineering. They are now devoting all their time to running their taxi-rental business in Lima. They own three taxis, one that her husband drives and the other two that they rent out daily for 50 Soles (about $16) each.

Brigida’s dream for her family is simply that they are happy, which she says is more important than anything else. Brigida is pleased to have been with her village bank for two years now and is very excited for this loan, with which she will fix the engine on one of the taxis.

loans.use: fix the engine on one of her taxis

loans.name: Thi Duyen

texts.vi:
Ms Duyên is 25 years old, married with 1 young child. She is a hard working woman. She sells bean curd at the market near her house. Not to waste the husk and the bran from bean curd production, she also raises pigs for meat and also sows for breeding. In her pigpen there's a few dozens pigs/piglets anytime. Her husband works in construction, his salary adds up to the family income. Ms Duyên wishes to receive the loan to buy pig mash.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Duyên 25 tuổi có chồng và có 1 con nhỏ. Chị là người phụ nữ khá năng động. Chị làm đậu bán ở chợ gần nhà, tận dụng bã đậu, chị chăn nuôi thêm. Chị nuôi lợn nái và cả lợn thịt. Chị không cần phải mua lợn giống vì lợn nái nhà chị đã có thể cung cấp đủ. Lúc nào trong chuồng cũng có vài chục con lợn. Chồng chị làm thợ xây cũng có thể phụ giúp thêm thu nhập trong gia đình cùng chị. Chị rất mong muốn được vay vốn và trả góp dần.

loans.use: Mua cám cho lợn

loans.name: Thi Tinh

texts.vi:
Her family has been in the furniture business for a long time. Now they would like to expand their business. Since she learned about Binh Minh cdc (SEDA), she has applied for a loan of 2006000 VNĐ (150 USD) to buy machinery.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Gia đình chị làm nghề mộc lâu năm, nay muốn mở rộng quy mô sản xuất, kinh doanh. Được biết tới những tiện ích mà Chương trình Tài chính vi mô Bình minh cdc đem lại, gia định chi vay 2006000 VNĐ để mua máy làm nghề mộc.

loans.use: To buy machinery

loans.name: Nangwe Madibira (Vii) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Saada N.. She is currently in the business of selling dry fish and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Saada is 49 years old and married. She has 2 children, aged 10 and 12, and they go to school. Each week, Saada makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to help her husband with the construction of their new house. Saada has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 600000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Saada is joined in her small group by Shamim N., Saida N., Kedi D., and Marita M.. Shamim N. has a business selling used clothes and wants to increase the stock of clothes. Saida N. is currently operating a used clothing business and wants a loan to expand the business. Kedi D. operates a hardware shop and wants to expand it by increasing stock. Marita M. also operates a hardware shop and is requesting a loan to increase stock.

loans.use: To expand fish business

loans.name: Hindu

texts.en:
Hindu is 32 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 18 and 12 years old. She and her husband also take care of one other child, age 15 years old. Hindu has been selling clothes since 1984. Every day, she works from 9am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

In the past, Hindu has taken out a successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Nosirat

texts.en: Nosirat A. Lives in Ijaniki,Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 35 years of age and  has four children. The youngest child she must bring to her shop everyday. she work 7 days in a week and from 7am until evvening. She sells drinks and provisions. Nosirat has being borrowing from LAPO Microfinance and repaying loans for the past 3 years and she has been in this business since 1996. She needs the sum of $450 to enable her buy more provisions and drinks for sale. This will help her serve her customers better. She say thanks to Kiva and their lenders.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Maria Cristio

texts.en:
Maria Cristio C. R. has a general store in the town of Carabamba high in the sierras of La Libertad Region. At the store, which she placed in a room in her home, she sells all the goods people buy on a regular basis including rice, noodles, oil, sodas, and more. Her business is located outside of town so her neighbors don’t need to travel to the center to buy their goods.

Maria is 50 years old, single, and has5 children. She has no one to support her so she is happy to have her business. She has 15 years of experience and many loyal customers. Her dream is to send her two youngest children to University.

A member of the community bank Alfa y Omega, Maria is requesting a loan of s/1200 to repay over 4 months. She will use the loan to restock her store with her best selling goods.

loans.use: She will use the loan to restock her store with her best selling goods.

loans.name: Adenike

texts.en: Adenike A. lives in the town of Issashi in Lagos State, Nigeria. She makes a living selling different types of plastic items, such as jugs, baskets, one-gallons containers and plate racks. She studied this business for a year before opening her shop in 1995. Adenike is 45 years old, married and has three children. She has been a client of LAPO Microfinance for the past three years. Adenike has applied for a new loan of $850 to buy more plastic items to sell, and wants to express her thanks to Kiva and her lenders.

loans.use: To buy more plastic items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Doña Alba has gradually been investing in the construction and improvement of her house. Through the efforts that she and her family members have made, they have been able to improve their living conditions. They now wish to change the floor of the house because it is currently made of cement and they want to put in ceramic tile.

Doña Alba sells food from the house and hopes to be able to increase her business and offer the best quality of services to customers by building a small restaurant. Doña Alba is 37 years old, lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood, is married, and has three children. One of them is financially independent and the other two are studying. Her husband is an auto mechanic and contributes to the household expenses.

She also hopes to help her children get ahead; she hopes that, like her oldest, she will be able to teach them the worth of work so that one day they will be able to make a living.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Alba poco a poco ha ido invirtiendo en la construcción y mejoras de su casa de habitación. Gracias al esfuerzo que ella y su familia realizan es como han podido ir mejorando las condiciones de vida. Ahora desean cambiarle el piso a su casa de habitación ya que actuelmente es embaldosado y quieren ponerle cerámica. Doña Alba se dedica a la venta de comida en su casa de habitación y espera en un futuro poder incrementar su negocio y llegar a ofrecer mejora calidad de servicios a sus clientes al llegar a poner un comedor. Doña Alba tiene 37 años de edad, habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, es casada y tiene tres hijos uno de ellos ya es independiente y los otros dos están estudiando, su esposo es mecánico automotriz y aporta a los gastos del hogar. También espera poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y así como al mayor de ellos poder enseñarle el valor del trabajo para que un día puedan valerse por si mismos.

loans.use: To buy ceramic tile for the floor of her house.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo has always had his business as a way of having his own source of employment, to cover the needs of his family, and to be able to educate his children and to buy his house. As he used to help one of his brothers in his repair shop when he was young, he learned to do this work, and this is why he started his own business. He started almost 20 years ago in his house, and he later started to save his profits and bought the land next to his house to locate his business. He could then give better service to his customers and generate more income.

He needs a loan of $1,200, which he will repay in 6 months, to purchase 2 machines for his repair shop. With your help, Guillermo will progress with his business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Guillermo siempre ha tenido su negocio como una manera de tener sui propia fuente de trabajo y cubrir las necesidades de su familia y asi poder darle estudios a sus hijos y comprar su casa. Como ayudaba a un hermano en su vulcanizadora cuando era pequeño ahí aprendi a trabajar la vulcanizadora asi que por eso emprendio su propio negocio. Comenzó desde hace ya mas de 20 años en su casa y posteriormente con las ganancias empezó a ahorrar asi que compró el terreno contiguo a su casa para poner su negocio y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y asi generar un mayor ingreso

El necesita un prestamo por US $ 1,200 que pagra en meses para comprar 2 maquinas para la vulcanizadora, con tu ayuda Guillermo seguira con su negoico.

loans.use: To purchase two machines

loans.name: Janeffer Christiana

texts.en: O. Christiana Janeffer is 49 years old married with eight children. She lives in Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. She owns a patent store for the sale of medicine. She is a LAPO client. She sells this medicine to people in her community. She needs the loan amount of $875 to buy more medicine for sale to her customers. This will help her to serve her customers better. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more medicine for sale

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen U. D. P. tiene casa propia y esta casda con Teofilo P.. La pareja tiene dos hijos y vive en la zona D. Agua D. la Vida (La Paz).
Carmen es ama D. casa y su esposo es rentista D. la administración pública.
La vivienda presenta deterioro producto D. su antigüedad. El crédito solicitado ira a la refacción D. dos habitaciones en revoque interior y pintura.
Esta es la primera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente.
texts.en:
Carmen U. D. P. has her own home and is married to Teofilo P.. The couple has two children and lives in the Agua D. la Vida neighborhood of La Paz city. Carmen is a housewife and her husband is a public housing manager. Their current home is deteriorating due to its age. The loan will be used to remodel two rooms, plastering and painting. This is the first time asking for a loan and the socioeconomic analysis qualifies her favorably.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodel her home

loans.name: Jero Putu Widiantari

texts.id:
Jero Putu Widiantari baru kali ini mendapat keksempatan untuk mendapatkan pinjaman modal yang diberikan oleh yaysan DINARI melalui tempek I Manistutu.
Dana trsebut dupergunakan untuk membeli bibit babi yang nantinya akan dipelihara secara penggemukan. Karena sudah mempunyai induk babi  jenis landrace jero Putu Widiantari tinggal mengembangkan usaha beternak babi dengan jalan menambah bibit babi yang nantinya akan dijual setelah dipelihara selama tiga sampai empat bulan dipelihara dan untuk persiapan pemberian pakan untuk ternaknya. 
      
     Pekerjaaan pemeliharaan ternaknya biasanya dilakukan setelah menyelesaikan tugas sebagai ibu rumah tangga yaitu mengurus keluarganya ,memasak untuk keperluan kedua anak-anaknya yang masih kecil.
Setelah selesai mengurus leluarganya barulah mulai mengurus ternak baibinya dengan membersihkan kandang dan memberika pakan babi-babinya.keuntungan bersih dalam kurun waktu empat bulan dapat mencapai Rp.500.000,-.dari hasil inilah Jero putu Widiantari dapat membantu suaminya untuk menambah pendapat suaminya.
texts.en:
Jero Putu Widiantari just had a chance to participate in the Dinari's foundation loan program called tempek I Manistutu. She used the loan fund to buy a piglet which she is raising now. She plans to raise the pig for 3-4 months before selling it to the market.

She is doing this activities on top of her daily house chores. She can earn a net profit of IDR 500 thousand (around USD 55) after 3-4 months. With this money she can help to add the family's income.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy piglet (Membeli anak babi)

loans.name: Guljahon

texts.ru: Якубова Гулчахон живет в Варзобском районе. Замужем , имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Работает в мясном ларьке. У них общий бизнес с мужем. В его задачи входит покупать бычков и резать их.А она торгует. Они хотят увеличить товарооборот и купить бычка. Таким образом они обеспечат население своего кишлака мясом. Погасить кредит смогут в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Guljahon Y. lives in the Varzob District. She is married and has three children. She completed secondary school. She and her husband run a butcher shop. He is in charge of buying and butchering steers and she does the sales. They would like to increase sales and buy a bull calf. This allows them to provide town residents with meat. The loan can be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull calf

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hiệp  năm nay 30 tuổi, gia đìnhchị có 3 con còn nhỏ. Năm 2005 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Sau 3 năm tham gia Quỹ hiện tại ngoài chăn nuôi gia đình chị Hiệp còn đầu tư vốn để mua xe  chở hàng thuê. Công việc kinh doanh,  chăn nuôi của gia đình chị Hiệp đang phát triển tốt và cho thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 13.000.000đ để  đầu tư mua thêm một chiếc xe mới phục vụ ngày càng tốt hơn nhu cầu của người dân địa phương
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H. is 30 years old. Her family has three young children. She joined TYM Fund in 2005 to borrow funds for investing in raising livestock. After three years with TYM Fund, in addition to raising livestock, she also invests in a vehicle for her delivery service. Her family's livestock and delivery service are expanding, and give her an income of 4,000,000 per month. She wishes to borrow 13,000,000 VND to invest in a new vehicle in order to meet the needs of her local customers.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new car

loans.name: Glacida Herlinda

texts.es:
Desde hace cinco años Glacida Q. se dedica al a venta de ropa. No tiene una tienda, por lo que ella debe salir a ofrecer puerta por puerta. Felizmente, con el tiempo, se ha hecho concocida entre sus amigos y eventualmente recibe visitas de algunos cleintes en su propio domicilio.

Antes ella trabajaba como niñera, sin embargo, una vez que tugvo a sus dos hijos ya no tenia quienlos cuidara mientras ella se ausentaba, es asi quele nace la idea de vender ropa cerca de su casa. Gracias a su trabajo ella no solo mantiene a sus doshijos si no tambien a su papá, que vive con ellos.

Poco a poco ella cree ensu negocio, pero aun le faltamuchopor crecer, es por ello que ella requierede un préstamo, para poder comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería.
texts.en:
Glacida Q. has worked selling clothes for five years. She doesn't have a store, so she has to go selling them door-to-door. Happily, over time she has become known among her friends and eventually has come to receive visits from some clients in her own home. Previously she worked as a nanny, but once she gave birth to her two children she didn't have anyone to take care of them while she was away. That's how the idea of selling clothing near her house came to her. Thanks to her work she is able to support not only her two children but also her father, who lives with them. Little by little her business is growing, but it still has a lot of growing to do. That's why she needs a loan, to be able to buy a larger quantity of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and open a store in her house

loans.name: Lai

texts.en:
Mrs. Lai K. is 57 years old, and her husband, Mr. Toun Kong, is 60 years old. They live along national road number one, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They married in 1973, and they have eight children (five sons and three daughters). Three of their children are married and do not live in their famiy's home; in addition, they note that one of their sons is a Police of Military, another son is a full-time employee at an NGO, while the other children are in school.

Lai and her husband have been selling fruit for five years. More specifically, they buy fruit from the Chroy Ampil commune, which is approximately 12 kilometers from her village, and they resell such fruit at markets in Phnom Penh. Lai is now requesting her first loan in the amount of $1,100 to purchase additional fruit as well as clothing for resale purposes.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruit and clothing for resale

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Ngozi is 43 years old and married with 3 children. He sells drinks like palm wine. He also sells pepper soup. He has been in this business for a long time. Ngozi hopes for the loan amount of N 80,000 to purchase more drinks (palm wine) to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks (palm wine) to sell

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El Sr. José es viviente de la comunidad de la planchada el cual vive hace aproximadamente unos quince años por esta zona.
Su actividad principal es la agricultura actualmente se encuentra en plena siembra de papa, además de esto siembra también maíz, maní y poroto de acuerdo a la época de siembra, también cuenta con 15 cabezas de ganado vacuno.
Su esposa la Sra. Isabel Rojas Toledo le ayuda en los quehaceres de la casa con la cual tienen tres hijos, los cuales estan en edad escolar, pero que colaboran en la agricultura como en el cuidado del ganado.
texts.en:
Mr. José C. S. has been living in the La Planchada community for the last 15 years. His main economic activity is agriculture and he is currently in the middle of potato planting season. In addition to potatoes he plants corn, peanuts and kidney beans depending on the season. He also has 15 head of cattle. His wife, Mrs. Isabel Rojas Teledo helps with household chores and their three school-age children, who help with the farming and cattle

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plant Potatoes

loans.name: Marachi B Group

texts.en: Mrs. Nanyasi Magret is 25 years old. She has three children, two of whom are in school, and she also cares for three orphans. She is using this loan to purchase more used clothes. She has been selling clothes for over 5 years. She encourages the community to wake up and work. She is courageous and she is determined to buy a plot of land and construct a house.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Xiomara Soveida

texts.es: la Sra. Xiomara U. se dedica desde hace 4 años a la venta de produtos de uso personal y quiere invertir en comprar topa tambien, estos dos negocios le ayudaran a traer ingresos para el hogar y asi contribuir con los gastos del mismo, ella se siente muy motivada por su trabajo ya que siente que todo le esta saliendo bien, ella tiene muchas ganas de superarse, ella es madre de una niña de 4 años la cual esta en el kinder de la colonia en la que vive y su esposo trabaja de albañil lo que le permite a los dos reunir el dinero para salir adelante con su hogar,
texts.en:
Mrs. Xiomara U. has worked selling personal products for four years and wants to buy clothing as well. These two businesses will help her bring incoming into her home and contribute to the household expenses. She feels very motivated to work because everything is working out well. She has a great desire to better herself. She is the mother of a 4-year old girl who is in kindergarten in the neighborhood where she lives, and her husband works as a bricklayer which allows them to combine their money to help their household get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy creams, deodorants, lotions, shampoos, and air fresheners

loans.name: Allahverdi

texts.en: Allahverdi Q. is 46 years old, married, and has 2 sons. He earns income selling different kinds of food products, including candy, butter, and beverages. He has more than 15 years of experience in this business, and is currently the only bread winner in his family with his store as the only source of income. Allahverdi has applied for a loan of US$ 1,500 to purchase more food products for re-sale to be able to increase his income.

loans.use: Purchase of food products for re-sale

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad D. Queñuani, distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chuchito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 55 años edad estado civil casada y es madre D. 07 hijos (todos ya casados e independientes solo 01 esta a su lado), y tiene estudios D. primaria incompleta (3ro D. primaria), y vive en el Barrio Central D. Queñuani.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. la fundación del Banco Comunal,  con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  pudo comenzar su negocio D. compra y venta D. sacos D. polietileno (plástico).  

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su actual negocio y vender sus productos en las ferias D. yunguyo.

Su deseo es poder comprar ganado para mejorarlo y que tengas crías para luego venderlos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros,  y las reuniones D. su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Francisca belongs to the "Virgen del Rosario" Community Bank, in Queñuani Community, Yunguyo district, Chuchito province, Puno department. She is 55 years old, married and the mother of 7 children (all of them are married and independent, only one of them still with her). She attended elementary school but did not finish (3rd graD.) and she lives in the central neighborhood of Queñuani. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement since the Community Bank was started. With an initial loan of 300 PEN she was able to start her business buying and selling plastic bags. She now needs to borrow 500 PEN to invest in her current business and sell her products in Yunguyo's markets. She wants to be able to purchase cattle to raise and then be able to sell the calves. She enjoys the savings and the meetings of her Community Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of plastic bags

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario works as a farmer. He supports his family with his income from farming. He would like a loan of 20,000 PHP from Kiva lenders to purchase some fertilizers, insecticides and hybrid seed needed for his planting and farming maintenance. 

Mario is 39 years old. He is married to Ludivina, a housewife. They are blessed with four children. Lovely, 10 years old, and Mark Jay, 8 years old, are both studying in the primary level. Christian, 5 years old, is now in daycare and Gian Carlo is just 1 year old. 

Mario believes that a hardworking man can become a successful one. Thus, he is trying his best to become a hardworking man for his family who are the inspiration in his life.

He is shown in the photo (holding a hat) with the ASKI Loan Officer who visited him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, insecticides and hybrid seed

loans.name: Sarswati

texts.en:
Sarswati K. has one son and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in grade 7 and her son is in grade 3. Her husband, Mr. Shiva Ram K., is an electrician.

Mrs. Sarswoti has already taken her first loan from Kiva and has repaid the loan. She used her first loan for her goat-raising work. Now she has applied for another loan of Rs 30,000 to invest in a cow-raising business. She ready owns one cow and she has been selling milk in her area. In Nepal pure, fresh cow’s milk is highly valued for human nutrition.

Sarswati K. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati and in that area the demand for milk is constantly increasing. She carries her milk in containers and sells door-to-door daily, in the morning and in the evening. Because of the rising demand for milk, she wants to buy another cow to increase her production. Sarswoti plans to use her loan to purchase a Jersey cow which produces more milk than other cows.

loans.use: To buy a young milk-giving Jersey cow

loans.name: Ma. Cynthia

texts.en: Ma. Cynthia R. grows rice for a living. She is a widow already and now it’s only her two children helping her to manage and run their business. Cynthia needs additional capital to buy the fertilizers and chemicals needed to grow their harvest. The two-hectare (5-acre) farm that she tills is what has kept their family sustained up until now. CEVI helps small businesses grow. It provides its clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Rubi

texts.es:
La señora Rubí, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Doradinas en Acción”, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín, tiene 36 años y 04 hijos, 03 que aun dependen de ella.

Su impulso y empeño de ver a sus hijos profesionales, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, un local muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. 

Las ganancias que genera hace posible  el ingreso económico que su familia necesita, ya que es una madre soltera  que aprendió a seguir adelante. 
En la actualidad, es muy querida por sus clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque ella cuenta con todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es ella misma quien les brinda su atención con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Rubí, como le dicen de cariño, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, día a día agradece a la vida, por brindarle una gran oportunidad de salir adelante como mujer, igualmente a Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por   iniciarla a convertirse en una mujer empresaria.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rubí is a member of the Community Bank “Doradinas en Acción”, which is located in the district of San José de Sisa in the province of El Dorado, department of San Martín. She is 36 years old and has four children; three of the children still depend on her.

Her desire and determination to see her children as professionals, motivated her to start her own business selling groceries. She turned a room in her home into a grocery store where she takes care of her customers.

The revenues generated by her business cover her family’s expenses. She is a single mother who has learned to get ahead. She is well liked by her current customers who shop at her store on a daily basis. She has all the products that a housewife needs and takes care of her customers with her charismatic personality.

With this loan of $350 (1,000 soles) she will buy bags of rice and sugar, noodles, milk, fish preserves, eggs and personal hygiene products. This will allow her to continue to provide a better service to her customers.

Rubí, as she’s affectionately called, has a lot of strength to continue working. Each day she thanks life for giving her - a woman - the opportunity to get ahead. She also thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for getting her started in becoming an entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries to increase her products.

loans.name: Christine Adhiambo

texts.en:
Christine Adhiambo is a twenty-eight year old, single mother. She has been selling second hand clothes for the last nine years. Christine thinks her business has great potential due to its location, passion and experience.

She learned of KADET Ltd through her mother, an existing client. This is her first loan from KADET Ltd. She hopes to purchase extra stock, since after studying business patterns, she feels the demand is high in September, October, November and December.

She has a long term goal to own a boutique.

-----------------
About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: María Ángela

texts.es: María Ángela Q. R. de 34 años de edad reside Mejicanos en el departamento de San Salvador. María es madre soltera vive con su hija Jenny de 12 años de edad estudiante de básica. María se dedica a la confección de ropa hace diez años, con su experiencia ahora María confecciona ropa de bebé en grandes cantidades para ser vendida con sus vecinos y otras exportadas al país de Guatemala, el crédito que María solicita es para comprar tela que le permita aumentar la producción de ropa.
texts.en:
María Ángela Q. R. is 34 years old and lives in Mejicanos, which is located in the department of San Salvador. She is a single mother who lives with her 12 year old daughter Jenny, who is currently a student. María has been making clothes for 10 years. She currently makes baby clothes in large quantities in order to sell to her neighbors and for export to Guatemala.

María is requesting a loan to buy fabric so that she can increase her production of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Caminantes Group

texts.es: En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer Juan Pablo II se encuentra la Asociación Comunal Caminantes, con tres años de antigüedad, se organizaron por la necesidad de contar con un capital para hacer crecer sus negocios. Una de las integrantes es Yola G. de 48 años, ella tiene dos negocios pequeños  uno es la venta de comida y otra la venta de masitas, en esta oportunidad requiere del préstamo para comprar  insumos como la harina y manteca. Yola vende las masitas que elabora en la puerta de su casa y le va bien. Sus compañeras también tienen sus propios negocios como la venta  de verduras, rieles, alimento seco, fruta, api, ropa, cosméticos y comida. Necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería, materia prima e insumos y seguir haciendo crecer su negocio consiguiendo siempre nuevas clientas.
texts.en:
In one of the main centers of Pro Mujer Juan Pablo II you will find the "Caminantes" Communal Bank. The group is three years old and organized around their reliance on capital in growing their businesses. One of the members is Yola G. who is 48 years old. She has two small businesses. For one she sells food and for the other she sells cookies. For both of these she needs to borrow money in order to buy ingredients such as flour and butter. Yola sells the cookies she makes from the door of her house and she does well. Her friends also have their own businesses where they sell vegetables, rails, dried food, fruit, clothes, cosmetics and food. The need a loan to buy merchandise, raw materials and ingredients and continue growing their business and finding new clients.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise, raw materials and ingredients

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer dinámica y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 37 años y es madre de tres hijos, de los cuales uno es mayor de edad, ella  tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes que funciona en su casa y además trabaja junto a su esposo vendiendo arena y ripio (material de construcción). Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Flores de los Próceres” desde hace tres años, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles que utilizó en la compra de algunos artículos para su bodega.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1400 soles que será utilizado una parte para comprar productos para su bodega y otra parte invertirá en la compra de arena y ripio. La meta de Rosa es surgir en su bodega y tener una gran variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a dynamic and hardworking woman who lives in Pucallpa city, in the region of Ucayali. She is 37 years old, the mother of 2 younger children and 1 adolescent. Rosa has a small grocery store in her house and also works with her husband selling sand and cobblestones (construction materials). She has been a member of "Las Flores de los Próceres” community bank for 3 years. Her first loan for 300 PEN was used to purchase items for her store. She now needs a loan of 1,400 PEN that will be used to stock her store inventory as well as to buy sand and cobblestones. Rosa's goal is to develop her grocery store and to offer a better variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for her grocery store and purchase of sand and cobblestones for resale.

loans.name: Eat

texts.en:
Mrs. Eat D. is a villager in Sam Chort village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice. She also raises pigs.

Since her pigs have grown bigger and bigger, Mrs. Eat D. does not have enough money to buy pig feed for her pig business. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy pig feed and she will use the rest of loan to buy fertilizers to support her rice field.

Mrs. Eat D. is 63 years old and is a widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a bread shop while the other stays at home to do housework.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and to buy fertilizers to support her rice field

loans.name: Aminat

texts.en: Aminat is 45 years old, married with 4 children. Her youngest child is 5 years old. Her husband sells clothes to support the household. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She sells kerosene and eggs at retail prices to her customers. With these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her family members. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more kerosene and eggs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene and eggs to sell

loans.name: Vidjrakou

texts.fr: Cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de condiments plus précisément des  tomates et de piments verts, une partie de son stock de marchandises est avariée ; elle doit vite se réapprovisionner au risque de tomber en rupture de stock, elle demande donc à WAGES  un crédit pour se réapprovisionner avec  10 paniers de tomates et 6 sacs de piments verts.
texts.en:
This lady has a business selling condiments, that is, tomatoes and green chili peppers to be exact.  Part of her stock of goods is damaged;  she must quickly stock up again or run the risk of shortages.  She's therefore asking WAGES for a loan to resupply herself with 10 baskets of tomatoes and 6 sacks of green chilis.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying tomatoes and green chili peppers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Supplies to build a chicken coop

loans.name: Okwir

texts.en:
S. Okwir is 29 years old and is married.  Her husbanc is a taxi driver. They have 1 child who does yet go to school. S. is currently in the business of selling cassava flour in the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of cassava flour to sell.   With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a beauty saloon.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock bags of posho and cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Patricia Marisela

texts.es: Patricia Marisela A. R. de 34 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos menores de edad. Patricia posee un taller de corte y confección, en el cual se encarga de elaborar prendas de vestir para mujeres, hombres y niños. Ella se encarga de trabajar por pedidos previos por parte de sus clientes y así mismo elaborar cortinas las cuales comercializa en su casa. Patricia solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar tela por mayor, esto con el deseo de poder elaborar más ropa y cortinas, así mismo con el fin de atender mayor cantidad de clientes, lo cual es de mucho beneficio para ella. Patricia es una persona trabajadora y muy humilde quien desea darles una mejor vida a sus hijos, ayudándole a su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar y de esta manera tener una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Patricia Marisela is 34 years old and lives in the city of Soyapango, located in the San Salvador Department. She lives with her husband and their two young children. Patricia has a tailor shop where she manufactures articles of clothing for women, men, and children. She is in charge of filling customer orders and also makes curtains which she sells from her home. Patricia is asking for a loan so that she can buy cloth in bulk so that she can make more clothing and curtains and be able to service more customers. This will be of great benefit to her. Patricia is a very humble and hard working woman who wants to give her children a better life by helping her husband make ends meet.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cloth in bulk

loans.name: Bintou's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sinignèssigui est composé de six  femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames  avec en moyenne 40 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent le village de Chiola dans la préfecture de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et font le commerce d’articles divers.
 Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce et de diversifier leurs marchandises à vendre, elles ont  adhéré au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel elles sont à leur 4ème prêt solidaire.  Tous les trois précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté.
Ce nouveau prêt sera utilisé pour acheter,  60 sacs de charbon de bois, 10 pièces de pagnes wax et 2 sacs de riz.  Elles s’approvisionnent dans les foires de Ségou et de Konodimini en céréales et en pagnes wax, en charbon de bois dans les villages environnants. La revente des marchandises se fait à domicile, dans les foires de Konodimini et à Ségou au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt de Soro Yiriwaso et faire de l’épargne. 
Elles ont pour ambition de  diversifier les sources de revenus en embrassant  l’embouche des petits ruminants.
texts.en:
The Sinignèssigui group is made up of six married women, for the most part from monogamous families, on average 40 years old with four children. They live in the village of Chiola in the Ségou prefecture (4th administrative region of Mali). They know each other through family links and as neighbors, and retail various products. To increase their inventory and diversify the products they sell, they have joined the Soro Yiriwaso credit program, where they are now requesting a fourth group loan. All three previous loans were reimbursed without problems. This new loan will be used to buy: 60 bags of charcoal, 10 pieces of pagne wax fabric, and two bags of rice. They get cereal and pagne wax from the Segou and Konodimini markets, and charcoal from villages in the area. They resell their products either from their home, or in the Ségou and Konodimini markets, for cash or on credit, to a customer base of both men and women. They hope to reach average monthly earnings of 20,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay the Soro Yiriwaso loan and put into savings. Their ambition is to diversify their sources of revenue and invest in the fattening of small ruminants.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products

loans.name: El Esfuerzo De San Felipe Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama El Esfuerzo de San Felipe, porque es el nombre del lugar donde fue constituido y comentan las integrantes, será la unión de esfuerzos. Está ubicado en la comunidad de San Felipe Coamango, Municipio de Chapa de Mota, en el Estado de México, en México.  El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes y es la primera vez que solicita un crédito a CrediComún. 

Zenaida L. González es el la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 26 años, estudió hasta el sexto año de primaria, es ama de casa y comerciante, tiene en total 4 hijos.  Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos que inició hace 2 años y a la crianza de pollos y guajolotes. Solicita el préstamo para surtirse de cosméticos y perfumes que pondrá a la venta.

Zenaida C. E. es integrante del grupo. Tiene 47 años, estudió hasta el sexto año de primaria, es campesina y ama de casa, tiene en total 7 hijos 3 mujeres y 4 varones, todos casados.  Ella se dedica a la engorda de becerros que inició hace 8 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar alimento y pastura para engordar los becerros que actualmente tiene y una vez que estos estén listos, venderlos y comprar mas para seguirlos engordando y continuar con el negocio. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente motivada y apoyada porque para ella es una nueva puerta abierta.   Quiere este crédito para engordar sus becerros y hacer crecer su negocio, ella siempre se ha dedicado a la crianza de animales y considera ha sido muy buen negocio ya que las ganancias de unos le han dado para otros pues ha podido comprar pollos y guajolotes que la han sacado de apuros y además siempre hay algo disponible para que no falte la comida en su hogar, asimismo ha comprado algunos burros que utiliza para la carga ya que sin ellos sería un trabajo pesado. También ha tenido la oportunidad de invertir en su casita y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Espera 	que su patrimonio siga creciendo para que llegada una edad, en la que ella y su esposo ya no puedan trabajar tengan un guardadito con el cual puedan vivir dignamente.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
-	Ana Rosario López C. (Venta de servilletas y bordados)
-	Rigoberta López C. (Crianza de pollos)
-	Josefina García Alcántara (Venta de zapato por catalogo)
-	Asunción Alcántara C. (Venta de comida)
-	Rosalba Velázquez C. (Veta de Ropa)
-	Ysidra Z.  M. (Venta de Ropa)
-	Ana Cristina C. B. (Venta de trastes)
-	Adriana López C. (Venta de Manualidades)
texts.en:
This group is called “El Esfuerzo de San Felipe” (San Felipe’s Effort) because that’s the name of the place it was formed and the members state that it will be their union of efforts. It is located in the Felipe Coamango community, Chapa de Mota municipality, Estado de México, México. It has 10 members and this is their first loan request to CrediComún. Zenaida L. González, 26, is group president. She finished 6th grade and is a housewife and a merchant. She has 4 children. She has sold cosmetics for the last 2 years; she also raises chickens and turkeys. She is asking for funds to stock up on cosmetics and perfumes to sell. Zenaida C. E., 47, is a group member. She finished 6th grade, is a housewife and farmer. She has 7 children; 3 girls and 4 boys, all of whom are married. She has raised calves for the last 8 years. She is asking for funds to buy feed and pasturage for the calves she already has and, once they reach proper weight, sell them and buy new ones to raise and continue with the business. At the moment of asking for this loan, she feels motivated and supported because she’s a new open door. She wants this loan to fatten up her calves and help her business to grow. She has always raised animals and considers this to be a profitable business because she has made profits from them that have made it possible for her to buy chickens and turkeys, which have been life savers sometimes and they have always been a sure source of nourishment for her family so that food has never been lacking. Similarly, she has bought donkeys that she uses to transport cargo because, without them, the work would be much too heavy. In addition, she has been able to invest in home improvements thus improving her quality of life. She hopes that her equity will continue to grow so that someday, when she and her husband are no longer able to work, they will have a bit of savings put away to live with dignity. The other members of the group are: - Ana Rosario López C. (Sale of napkins and embroidery) - Rigoberta López C. (Raises chickens) - Josefina García Alcántara (Catalogue shoe sales) - Asunción Alcántara C. (Sells prepared meals) - Rosalba Velázquez C. (Clothing sales) - Ysidra Z. M. (Clothing sales) - Ana Cristina C. B. (Sale of cooking utensils) - Adriana López C. (Handicrafts sales)

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise calves.

loans.name: Oluwakemi

texts.en:
Oluwakemi, 30 years old, owns a boutique. She sells shoes, clothes, bags and more. She uses the profit made from her sales to help her husband keep their home. She is happily married with three children. She has been a member of LAPO microfinance for some years with a good record.

Oluwakemi wants to buy more of her goods to sell. This will attract discount that will generate more profit for the growth of the business. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 nairas to purchase more shoes, clothes and bags to sell. Her dream is to order her goods on time and meet her customers' demands. She says thanks to all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes, clothes and bags to sell

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea O. is a 44-year-old humble villager living in Kompong Tom province. She became a widow woman by divorcing from her husband when her kids were very young. She has three children: one works in the garment factory and other two attend the local public school.

To create a daily profit Chea O. built a stall next to her house where she raises a few pigs for slaughtering. She is able to sell her pigs twice a year. She has done this business for years.

Chea O. relys much on this business which is a significant source of family proceeds. She has goals to improve her pig trade for years but she doesn’t have any sponsor. Thus, she asks for a loan from Kiva in order to purchase pig food and a piglet for her stall.

loans.use: To purchase pig food and a piglet for her stall.

loans.name: Cerina

texts.en: Cerina Z. owns and operates a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 34 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Macapari, Damulog, Bukidnon. Cerina has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Cerina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Cerina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase products to sell. Cerina is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El señor Pedro Q. vive en casa propia en la zona de Villa de la Cruz, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa.
El señor Pedro es rentista de la administración pública y su esposa realiza labores de casa.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de un Baño en su vivienda para el mejoramiento de las condiciones de vida de su familia.
Esta es la cuarta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Pedro Q. lives with his wife in his own house in the Villa de la Cruz area. It is on the west side of the city of La Paz. Pedro is a renter for the Public Administration. His wife does housework. The requested loan is to build a bathroom in their house. This is to improve the family’s living conditions. This is the fourth time that he has requested a loan. The completed socioeconomic analysis qualifies him for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of building a bathroom in his house

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
Maria es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos que están estudiando, de profesión Bióloga, Maria dejo de ejercer su profesión para dedicarse al cuidado de sus hijos, en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogos, que ofrece a amigos y familiares, con lo cual obtiene un ingreso para su familia. Hace 4 meses ingreso al Banco Comunal y ahora esta ahorrando con el objetivo de implementar su laboratorio. Los sueños de Maria es que sus hijos sigan estudiando y sean buenos profesionales.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de perfumes, cremas y para una puerta ya que recientemente culmino con la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
40-year old Maria is married and has three children who are students. Maria is a biologist by profession, but she stopped this line of work to bring up her children. In her free time she sells cosmetics to her friends and relatives from a catalog, and in this way she earns money for her family. Four months ago she contacted the Community Bank and is now saving money to start up a laboratory. Her greatest wish is for her children to continue their studies and get good jobs. Maria needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy perfumes, lotions, and a door for her recently-constructed house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, and a door

loans.name: Rubilyn's Group

texts.en: Rubilyn M. is from the village of Magcamiguing, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Rubilyn is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tulips. Rubilyn is married and has an infant child. To make a living, Rubilyn operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products, such as sugar, milo (milk beverage), biscuits, shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Rubilyn has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month from it. In 2009, Rubilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rubilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Rubilyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Rubilyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Severo

texts.es: Severo U. R. se dedica a la reparación de lavadoras y refrigeradores profesión que realiza desde hace 8 años. Este ingreso que percibe es para sostener los gastos de su familia, solo que en este momento el no cuenta con un automóvil para dar mejor servicio a su negocio es por ello que el desea comprar una camioneta para no tener que pedir a otra gente que le preste un carro para llevar alguna maquina descompuesta. En este momento una persona le esta ofreciendo una camioneta a un bajo precio; por lo que el quiere aprovechar la oferta para no tener que dar molestias.
texts.en:
Severo U. R. has been repairing washing machines and refrigerators for the past eight years. The income he earns goes toward covering his family’s expenses. At the moment, he does not have a vehicle that will allow his business to provide better service. For this reason, he is would like to buy a truck because he has to ask other people if he can borrower their vehicle for transporting broken machines.

At the moment he has one person who is offering him a truck at a low price, so he wants to take advantage of this offer so that he does not have to bother anybody.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a truck for his repair business

loans.name: Jiguiseme Iv Group

texts.fr:
JIGUISEME IV  est regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Kampogosso Kafonon dans la préfecture de San, région de Ségou, qui  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans, au moins 7 enfants et cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne. 
 TANTIO C., la présidente du groupe, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants, au grand marché de Kimparana. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana. Les ventes se fond aussi dans les  marchés  environnants en détail (souvent en gros) au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 25 000 à 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
JIGUISEME IV is a group of married women from the village of Kampogosso Kafonon in the prefecture of San, in the region of Ségou. They live in traditional families. They are, on average, 37 years old and have at least seven children. They cultivate peanuts. In hopes of increasing profits from their agricultural work, the members of the group decided three years ago to participate in the loan program through Soro Yiriwaso. After having properly repaid their previous loans, they are now on their third business loan. Tantio C., the leader of the group, plans to use her loan to buy an adequate quantity of peanut seeds, small tools, and fertilizer at the main market of Kimparana. After the winter season, the crops are stored for a length of time so that their value will increase before being sold at the main market of Kimparana. They also make their sales in neighboring markets at retail (and often at wholesale), in cash, to customers who generally come from large cities. The members of the group each plan to earn, after the sale of their agricultural products, a profit of 25,000 to 30,000 FCFA which will be used to pay the interest on the loan and to meet daily family expenses.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fertilizer, seeds and small equipment

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es:
Braulio vive en la zona central de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor es viudo, y tiene tres hijos que son independientes y casados.
Braulio tiene un vehiculo que trabaja como taxi, y contrata una persona para que pueda manejar su vehiculo.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en impro, con este crédito el señor podrá hacer arreglar su vehiculo y poner en buenas condiciones para que, genere mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Braulio lives in the central area of La Paz. He is a widower, and he has three children who are independent and married. Braulio has a vehicle, which is used as a taxi. He hires someone to drive the vehicle. This is the first time he has requested a loan from Impro. He will use the loan to fix his vehicle and get it into good condition. He will do this to generate greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance on his taxi

loans.name: Khat

texts.en: Mr. Khat M. is a 36-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Tom Province. He has a life partner in his wife (appearing in the photograph), who works selling a few cooking ingredients. This couple, who works together in the farming business, has four children, almost all of whom attend school. For the coming farming season, Khat M. requires some supplies but lacks the money to meet his needs. Therefore, he has decided to request a loan from Kiva to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and seed for growing.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, and seed

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn B. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 41 years old. Merlyn is widowed and has seven adult children. To make a living, Merlyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for more than 11 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Merlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Santos Ancelma

texts.es:
la sra. Santos Ancelma C. M. tiene 58 años de edad, vive en las Delicias Trojes El Paraiso.
Santos tiene una pequeña pulperia ubbicada en su casa de habitacion, tiene poco tiempo de tener su negocio.
nos comento que en estos momentos desea comprar mas productos para poder surtirla y tener mas inventario ya que tiene el problema de que los carros repartidores pasan solo una vez por semana y esto le ocaciona perdidas en sus ventas.
el credito lo va a utilizar para comprar mercaderia.
las ganancias las necesita para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Santos Ancelma C. Martínez, 58, lives in Las Delicias Trojes, El Paraíso. She has a small grocery store in her home. She has had it for a short time. She told us that she wants to buy more items to stock the store and have more inventory available because she has the problem that delivery trucks only come by once a week and this leads to lost sales. She will use the loan to buy merchandise. She needs profits to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bread, cookies, lard, rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, margarine, toilet paper, salt, corn and wheat flour, bags, beverages, milk, cheese, butter, soap, sardines, juices, matches, candles, batteries.

loans.name: God Bless Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “God Bless” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Salamatu D. is the leader of this group. Born in Kamakwie town, Salamatu is twenty-eight years old, single, with three children – two in primary school and one in secondary school. She sells slippers and has been doing this business for eight years now. Salamatu will use her share of the loan to buy slippers/flip-flops in large quantity to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: Buy slippers/flip-flops in large quantity

loans.name: Be Honest Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Be Honest” group. They are small-scale businesspeople, farmers and a building contractor. They are residents of the village of Masorie in northern Sierra Leone. They are asking for a loan of SLL 700,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses or invest in their farms. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is John P. K.. John is age 39 and was born in Massorie village.  He is married and has six children. Three  of the children are in primary school and three are in secondary school.  

John P. K. is a professional building contractor and has been in this profession for eight years now. However, John is going to invest this loan in farming and in business. In business, he will buy rice and palm oil to sell.

loans.use: To buy rice and palm oil to sell

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.es: El señor Leopoldo trabaja en MATECSA desde hace 5 años ha tenido de CEPRODEL 3 créditos los cual e son para mejorar poco a poco su vivienda compra de cin y Madera para reparar el techo.
texts.en: Sr Leopoldo has worked for MATESCA for 5 years and has had 3 CEPRODEL loans to gradually improve his home by purchasing zinc and wood to repair the roof.

loans.use: Home improvements.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew, age 56, is married to Shiprah Wangeci, and together they have three children. He is a photographer within the Nairobi business center.

Andrew was introduced to Kadet by a friend who was already a member. This is his first loan with KADET. He intends to use it to buy a digital camera for his business since the one he has been using is an older model.

From the returns of this loan, Andrew intends to expand his business and be able to open another outlet. In the future, he hopes that he will be able to open his own studio.

loans.use: To buy a digital camera

loans.name: Rayito De Sol Group

texts.es:
La banca comunal “Rayito de Sol” es parte del centro focal de Collpani. Cuenta con  once integrantes este es su primer ciclo, diez son mujeres y un varón.  Cuando se conversó con el grupo ellas comentaron que tenían la esperanza de que este dinero, al ser invertido en su negocio les iría muy bien, en particular por que se aproxima la navidad y en estas fechas hay bastante movimiento económico.
Entre los negocios de las señoras, se cuentan con los referentes a la venta de lana de Vicuña, costura y trenzado de mantas,venta de zapatos, taller electrónico, venta de medias, venta de frutas, carpintería, venta de ropa, venta de deportivos.
La presidenta, la señora Janeth Mónica es una mujer joven de 25 años, que ya tiene un hogar conformado con su pareja y dos hijos.  El negocio de la señora Janeth es la venta de ropa en la Ceja de La ciudad de El Alto, realiza este negocio desde hace tres años.  Este ciclo ella ha planificado comprar pantalones para surtir el puesto de venta.
Cuando se le consulta sobre lo que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención del Consultorio de Salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Rayito de Sol" meets in the central offices of Pro Mujer in Collpani.  The group has 11 members and this is its first loan cycle; the group contains 10 women and one man.  When we met with this group they commented that they hoped that they would do very well with this money being invested in their businesses, particularly with Christmas approaching, which is a season when there is a lot of economic activity.

The businesses run by the men and women in this group include: the sale of vicuña wool, dressmaking, rug weaving, the sale of shoes, an electronics workshop, the sale of hosiery, the sale of fruit, carpentry, clothing sales and the sales of sporting goods.

The president, Janeth Monica, is a young woman who is 25 years old, who already has a household comprised of her partner and two children.  Janeth sells clothing in the La Ceja neighborhood of the city of El Alto.  She has had this business for 3 years.  This cycle, she is planning on buying pants to stock her sales post.

When asked about what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the care provided in the health clinic.

loans.use: to purchase pants

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a married woman with six children, five of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a fish selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. Rosemary faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to establish a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation from the community.

loans.use: To  purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jose Luis; el tiene 32 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de relojes,el vende en forma ambulatoria llevando a las diferentes tiendas que vende relojes,el socio quiere tener otra tienda para vender los relojes. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar relojes.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member belongs to the "Buena Esperanza" Community Bank; the bank is located in the Cusco district, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. The member is Mr Jose Luis; he is 32, single and has 3 children. He alternates his daily activities with his watch sales business. He sells on the go, bringing his watches to different stores that sell watches. He wants to have another store to sell his watches. He is requesting this loan to purchase watches. He is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of his quotas.

loans.use: The member is requesting this loan to purchase watches.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam is a 26-year-old married man with a child, who lives in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He dreams of building his own house. He works in the transportation sector, riding a motorcycle, and has been in business for three years. The business is still profitable. His major challenge is having to remit part of his daily income to the owner of the motorcycle, and his desire is to own one. Sam needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Samorn

texts.en:
Mr. Samorn L., 30 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Samorn Khoem, 29 years old, have been married since 2003 and have two daughters. They live along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Mr. Samorn L. sells firewood. He buys trees from fellow villagers and cuts them up for firewood. His wife was hired by her villagers to farm (growing mushrooms) to earn money to support her family. Samorn is applying for a loan of $1,200 to buy firewood for resale and to purchase a trailer to carry the firewood.

loans.use: to buy firewood and to purchase a trailer

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene es socia del  Banco Comunal “Tupac Amaru”, ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 50 años de edad.  Está casada y tiene 4 hijos.  Irene no cuenta con estudios.
La señora se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado ovino, dicha actividad la realiza en las diferentes ferias de Yunguyo. Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cuatro años.  Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevo soles, con lo que podrá comprar unas cinco unidades de ganado ovino para el engorde y la  venta del mismo.
Su sueño es  seguir con el mismo negocio. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es trabajar y conversar en grupo con las demás socias.
texts.en:
Irene is a member of the community bank “Tupac Amaru,” located in the district of Yunguyo, province of Yunguyo, department of Puno.  She is 50 years old.  She is married and has 4 children.  Irene did not go to school.

She works buying and selling sheep.  She does this activity in different markets of Yunguyo.  She has worked with the Movement of Manuala Ramos for the past 4 years.  Her first loan was 300.00 nuevo soles, money that she invested in her business.

Currently, she is asking for a loan of 1500.00 nuevo soles, with which she will be able to buy 5 units of sheep to fatten and resell.

Her dream is to continue on with her business.  What she likes about the community bank is to work and talk in a group with the other members.

loans.use: To buy 5 units of sheep to fatten and resell

loans.name: Nut

texts.en: Nut P. has been in the farming business with her husband since 2005. They have a plot of farmland which comes from their grandparents. In addition, Nut P. sells many products in her community, Kompong Cham province. The items which she always sells are meat, vegetables, fresh fish, and cooking ingredients. This couple typically generates an income of $5 each day to manage their family and especially to meet the hunger of their two children.
