However, the family recently is facing difficulty with their living conditions due to their house needing repair. To solve the problem, Nut P. would like a loan to buy some planks to repair a part of her broken house. Nut P. and her husband appear in the photo.

loans.use: To buy some planks to repair a part of her broken house

loans.name: Elita

texts.en:
Elita L. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Elita is married and has three adult children. 

To make a living, Elita raises crops and sells fruits and vegetables. Elita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Elita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. 

Elita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fruits and vegetables for sale. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Elita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Kyarutanga Twetungura Group

texts.en:
A. John Baptist is a hardworking and ever-optimistic 37-year-old married father with five children. He is the leader of the Kyarutanga Twetungura group of Ibanda. A. operates a produce and retail shop business in Bwera, Ibanda, where he sells general merchandise such as soap, soft drinks, beer, salt, sugar and other items. He has run his business for over 13 years and has managed to sustain and significantly improve his family’s welfare. A. makes close to 300,000 UGX monthly. 

A. is requesting a new loan to buy more merchandise for his shop. This will enable him to expand his business and earn more revenue.

loans.use: to purchase general store merchandise

loans.name: Suzy

texts.en:
Suzy F. is currently in the business of selling greens. 

She is 22 years old, married, and has three children. Two of them go to school. 

Suzy borrowed a loan to stock more greens to sell. 

In the future, she hopes to build a concrete house with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more greens to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. (Abaca, a strong fiber from the leafstalk of the banana plant, is also called Manila hemp and is used in textiles and papermaking.)  She has been in this business for ten years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy raw materials for her abaca weaving business. Anita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for abaca weaving.

loans.name: Bintia

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Bintia.  She is married and has 2 children, 14 and 5 years old. She has 1 additional dependent, her younger sister who lives with her.  In 2008, Bintia established her medical drugstore business, after completing her medical course and deciding, through that experience, to sell medicine. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from the business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000 in order to buy additional pharmaceutical drugs. In the future, Bintia plans to pursue a higher level of education and take good care of her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy different types of  pharmaceutical drugs for her business.

loans.name: Chocaculeu Group

texts.es:
Doña Lidia Anacelia, es soltera, tiene 24 años D. edad, cursó los 5 años D. educación primaria, se dedica al amarre D. hijo típico y a la crianza D. animales vacunos, en este caso a la crianza D. toros, lleva 10 años D. experiencia en el amarre D. hilo y 4 años en la crianza D. animales. 

DeciD. organizar un grupo para ampliar su capital D. trabajo para la crianza D. animales, para esta vez va a comprar toros, ya que quiere tener una granja; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a diversas actvidades: tejidos D. cortes típìco, crianza D. animales, venta D. tacos, y al amarre D. hilo típico. Espera alcanzar su objetivo D. mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Lidia Anacelia is single and 24 years old. She did the 5 years of elementary school. She makes the traditional baby slings and raises cattle, in thia case bulls. She has 10 years experience with the slings and 4 years raising animals.  

She decided to organize a group to grow her work capital to raise animals. This time she is going to buy bulls, since she wants to have a barn. The rest of the group members do different activities: traditional weaving, raising animals, selling tacos, and traditional baby slings. She hopes to reach her goal of improving her income.

loans.use: to buy bulls.

loans.name: Silvia Eugenia

texts.es: La Sra. Silvia, es una cliente que esta sacando crédito por tercera vez, en el momento de la evaluación del crédito la Sra. demostró una actitud buena, Cortez y amable, razón por la cual se la escogió para crédito Kiva.  La Sra. Silvia vive en la zona cotahuma, de la ciudad de La Paz Bolivia, ella en la actualidad vive con sus dos pequeños niños, el esposo trabaja  en una empresa,  La Sra. Silvia saco este crédito para el incremento de capital comprando mercadería para su tienda y surtirla, su negocio es grande y esta en plena avenida, con el tiempo ella  quiere llegar a tener su propia casa, con esmero, voluntad y trabajo.
texts.en:
Silvia is a client who is taking out her third loan.  During her loan evaluation meeting, she showed a good attitude.  She was polite and kind.  For this reason, she was chosen to receive a Kiva loan.

Silvia lives in Cotahuma district, in the city of La Paz, Bolivia.  She currently lives with her two young children.  Her husband works for a company.  Silvia took out this loan to increase her capital by purchasing merchandise with which to stock her store.  Her business is large and located right in the middle of an avenue.  Over time, Silvia would like to own her own home.  She will achieve this with care, will and hard work.

loans.use: to buy merchandise with which to stock her store

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. Rose has a small hotel business, which she has run for four years.
To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase chairs and food for the hotel. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Rose hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to open another hotel business.
Rose is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has aided her prospects for the future by helping improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chairs and food for her hotel.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Las Natividades” de la Asociación Arariwa.
La socia nació en la ciudad de Huarocondo  (provincia de Anta, departamento del Cusco, Perú) y tiene 44 años de edad, ella está casada y fruto de esta unión cinco hijos de las cuales cuatro son independientes y uno todavía está a su lado. 

Actualmente, la socia vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades comerciales. La socia tiene varias actividades como por ejemplo se dedica a la venta de comestibles y venta de lechones. Ella tiene un péquela tienda donde expende sus productos a sus vecinos. Ella también tiene un pequeño hornos donde hace azar la carne de chancho. (Este plato típico de la zona es conocido como lechonada). Ya son 15 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad, la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar chanchos para preparar lechonada pues se está acercando la fiesta patronal de la ciudad de Huarocondo.
texts.en:
This member is a very responsible, hard-working person who, because of these traits, was invited by her friends to become a member of the communal bank "Las Natividades" which belongs to the Arariwa Association.

She was born in the city of Huarocondo (province of Anta, department of Cusco, Perú), is 44 and married.  She has five children, four of whom are independent and another one still lives at home.

The member currently lives in the same city where she was born and there she carries out her commercial activities, for example selling groceries and suckling pigs.  She has a small store where she sells her products to her neighbors, and a small oven where she roasts pork.  (This typical dish is known in the area as "lechonada").  She has been in business for 15 years and it is going well thanks to her hard work.

The member is requesting a loan to buy pigs for her "lechonada" preparation because the patron saint festivities of the city of Huarocondo will soon be underway.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam, aged 33, is a single mother of two children. She has been selling clothes for five years. The business earns her a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). 

This is her first loan with KADET Ltd. She will use the funds to buy shoes for resale. She intends to use the expected profits to pay school fees for her children and hopes to import new shoes in the future.

loans.use: To buy second-hand shoes for resale

loans.name: Jannelyn

texts.en:
Jannelyn is 31 years old and married. She has four children, and two are in school, Jannelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jannelyn runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. Jannelyn has been in this business for a year and sells a variety of items such as sugar, shampoo, canned goods and other groceries. 

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her store.

In the future, Jannelyn would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Niakh  Diarignou Group

texts.fr: « Niakh Diarignou » qui signifie « vivre à la sueur de son front » est le nom que porte ce groupe constitué de cinq femmes  mariées qui s'activent dans le commerce de produits alimentaires.Très tôt le matin, elles sont déjà sur pied.Les unes se rendent au marché central pour s’approvisionner en denrées et les autres dans leurs cantines situées devant leurs domiciles.Elles parviennent ainsi à satisfaire leurs propres besoins mais aussi à améliorer sensiblement l’alimentation de leurs familles.Le chef de groupe (qui tient le tissu teint) a une cantine devant son domicile pratique en plus la teinture.Elle est mère de 4 enfants et vit avec son mari.Le groupe sollicite un crédit de 250000F pour acheter des sacs de légumes et d'autres produits de consommation courantes (riz, huile...).Le chef de groupe ambitionne de faire des voyages de commerce dans le célèbre marché sous- régional de Diaobé, situé à l’est du pays, afin de diversifier ses produits.
texts.en:
« Niakh Diarignou » which means "living by the sweat of your brow" is the name given to this group of five married women. Very earL. in the morning, they are already up and about. Some go to the central market to buy staples and others to their little stores situated in front of their homes. They thus manage to satisfy their own needs but also to make considerable improvements in the nutrition of their families. 

The head of the group (who is holding the dyed cloth) has a shop in front of her home and she also dyes fabric. She is the mother of four children and lives together with her husband. 

The group is asking for a loan of 250,000 francs to buy sacks of vegetables, packages of soap, packages of perfumes, and "thioub" (localL. dyed) cloth. The leader of the group would like to travel to the famous sub-regional market of Diaobé, situated in the east of the country, so that she can diversify her products.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en: Clarita is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. Clarita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 4,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Clarita has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Clarita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Mampatim 02 Group

texts.fr:
Créer en Juillet 2008 le groupe Mampatim 02 a plus de cinq cycles dans le programme des bancs villageois. Il  est composé de 22 femmes qui vivent dans le même village. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Bobo debout à l’extrême droite est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 54 ans, est mariée et mère de sept enfants. Elle prendre en charge cinq autres proches parents.

Elle est vendeuse de patte d’arachide dans les différents marchés hebdomadaires des villages environnants, activité qu’elle pratique depuis plus de cinq ans. Son activité antérieure était la vente de légumes.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter de la patte d’arachide pour la revente.

Les profits tirés de son activité l’aiderons à acheter de chèvres ou moutons en parti et d’autre part soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
Created in July 2008, group Mampatim 02 has gone through more than five cycles in the “Banc Villageois” program. It is composed of 22 women who reside in the same village. Their main activity is retail.

Mrs. Bobo, who is standing all the way to the right, is the group’s leader. She is 54 years old, married and a mother of seven. She has five other close relatives in her care.

She retails groundnut paste at the various weekly markets of neighboring villages, and has been in this business for over five years. Her previous occupation was selling vegetables.

Her new loan will allow her to purchase groundnut paste to resell. Profit from this activity will help her to purchase goats or sheep on the one hand, and to help her husband provide for the family’s expenses on the other.

loans.use: to purchase ground nut paste for retail.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 50 years old and lives in Caluya, Sapang Dalaga. She is married with 4 children. 
To earn a living, Teresa has a business selling dried fish. She earns about PHP 5,100 each month doing this type of work. Teresa has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase dried fish to sell.
Teresa has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase 5 boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Vana

texts.en:
Vana (in the photo) sells fish in the village that her husband catches. Her husband, Vang, is a fisherman. They also grow peanuts and lotus. They have been married since 1992 and have four sons. One son is a security guard and the others are in school.

Vana is applying for a loan of $800 to purchase a motorcycle for her son who is a security guard to drive to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her son to drive to work

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more chicks and chicken feeds

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DIEU EST GRAND est formé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Cica Josephine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Cica Josephine est âgée de 44 ans et est une veuve ayant trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Cica Josephine vit seule avec ses enfants et assure leurs divers besoins. Cica Josephine a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Cica Josephine exerce comme activité, la vente de sacs de riz, de liqueurs et des conserves dans une ville du Bénin ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de ses enfants. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Cica Josephine désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Cica Josephine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DIEU EST GRAND, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The group Dieu est grand (God is great) consists of four people who reside in the same district in Benin. The representative of the group, Josephine Cica, is the one with a raised hand in this photo. This is the third time that this group is seeking financial support from ALIDé to improve their business. Josephine Cica is 44 years old and is a widow with three children, who are all attending school and under her responsability. Josephine lives alone with her children and takes care of all their needs. Josephine has a secondary school education. Her business is selling bags of rice, liquors and canned products in a city of Benin. This allows her to take care of her family. In order to better meet her customer demand, Josephine wants to increase her product inventory and improve the level of her business. To do this, Josephine, together with other members of her group, has requested a third loan from Alidé.

loans.use: to purchase rice bags, boxes of liquors and canned products.

loans.name: Elyenita

texts.en:
Elyenita is a married woman with six children. She is 39 years old and resides at Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Elyenita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been three years in this business. Each month, she earns 4,500 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase products to resell. 

Elyenita is been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Elyenita wants to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase products to resell.

loans.name: Elizabeth Beatriz

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen María se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Ciudad de clima cálido y con una variada  gastronomía.

Aquí conocimos a Elizabeth, tiene 32 años, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres, ella es licenciada en  auditoria.  Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido ayudar a sus padres.
 
Ella realiza trabajos contables en una empresa pequeña en la ciudad pero solo por medio tiempo ya que la otra parte de su tiempo la dedica al negocio que tiene en sociedad con su mamá, ellas tienen desde hace cuatro años un local en un lugar turístico donde llegan muchos turistas, allí venden artesanías propias de la zona como Hamacas, sombreros de paja toquilla, bisuterías, entre otras cosas, ellas trabajan todos los días y  siempre realizan buenas ventas ya que sus productos son muy apreciados por los turistas locales y extranjeros que llegan al lugar.
 
Este crédito es para comprar  bisuterías, hamacas, sombreros entre otras cosas para surtir más el negocio.
 
Sus sueños son crecer más en su negocio y conseguir un buen trabajo para ejercer la profesión.
texts.en:
The members of the "Virgen María" communal bank meet every two weeks in Montecristi canton (Portoviejo). This is a place  known for its rich pre-colonial culture, and for its handicrafts, which are recognized at the national and international level.  The city has a warm climate and a varied cuisine. Here we met Elizabeth, who is 32, single, and lives in her parents' house. She has a degree in auditing.

She has been in the communal bank for three loan cycles, and likes it, because through the loans, she has been able to help her parents. She does accounting work in a small company in the city; but only half time, as she devotes the other part of her time to the business she has in partnership with her mother.  

For four years they have had a shop in a popular tourist site. There they sell crafts characteristic of the area, such as hammocks, toquilla straw hats (also known as Panama hats), costume jewellery, and other things. They work every day, and always have good sales, as their products are highly prized by the local and foreign tourists who come there.

This loan is to buy costume jewellery. hammocks, hats, and other things to stock the business. Her dream is to see her business grow, and to get a good job, so she can practice her profession.

loans.use: To buy costume jewellery, hammocks, and hats.

loans.name: Misemwa Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Misemwa Group in Western Kenya! Wycliffe is the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Wycliffe takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, he had a very good maize yield harvesting nine bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest five bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Wycliffe and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, he will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Misemwa group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is fifty-four years old and has six children.  She is a widow and has three children who are in school.

Rosita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosita has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosita has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lieu

texts.en: Ms. Lieu is 42 years old with gso children who are school age. Being a farmer, she focuses on raising pigs and chickens for meat. This activity started 6 years ago. She has considerable income from this to manage her family life. Joining in our credit program, she hopes to have a loan of 5,152,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) to buy food for poultry.

loans.use: to buy food for poultry.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Adjo est une femme âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée å un pasteur. Elle a 5 enfants.
Adjo travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2008. Elle vend des gâteaux( des beignets faits à base de farine de blé cuit dans de l'huile végétale) pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, n’a pas de difficultés.
Adjo a requis son 2nd crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de la farine de blé. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Adjo voudrait ouvrir boutique pour vendre d'autres marchandises. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en: Adjo is a 43-year-old woman. She is married to a pastor. She has 5 children. Adjo has been selling things since 2008. She sells cakes (donuts made from wheat flour cooked in vegetable oil) to customers at her house. She buys the products from Lomé. She works alone. At the moment, she doesn’t have any difficulties. Adjo has requested a second loan from WAGES in order to buy wheat flour. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Adjo would like to open a shop to sell other items. She says that with her profits, she will take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour

loans.name: Bernadate

texts.en:
Bernadate is 50 years old. She is married to Sospeter and supports a family of six members.  She runs a posho mill (a grinding machine to crush maize into maize flour). She has been in business for seven years and earns a monthly income of KES 25,000.

She is borrowing KES 80,000 which she will use to pay school fees. Her hopes are to educate her children to college level.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Benkagni I Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKAGNI I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TAGAN, un des villages de SELINGUE, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxieme prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide   avec  TONGO    MAKOUMBA       , 4eme debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,75 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de TAGAN, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a young woman to be admired. At a tender age she has set up a mixed farm.Five years ago she started practicing mixed farming on a small piece of inherited land in her rural town of Chuka. Today, she boasts of the great strides she has made in dairy farming. This ambitious mother earns her livelihood through selling milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops from her farm. She also does some 'side hustle' to make extra income. 

Although she makes profits from dairy farming, she is faced with challenges that might put him down. Cows on her farm are affected by harsh weather conditions, hence, they become sick. She also faces challenges of properly feeding and milking her cows. 

Nancy is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Cows require a proper resting place and proper food, so that they can produce the maximum amount of milk. Without a proper dairy unit, cows will be affected with diseases, and also, they will not have a good place to rest and feed, hence, they will experience low milk production. 

Nancy feels relief, knowing that there are partners such as Kiva lenders who assist smallholder women, such as her, to achieve their dreams. With your loan, Nancy is going to permanently change her life and the increased income from high milk production will be used to fully pay back the loan and improve her living standards.

Be inspired during this festive season and help him out!

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Aneta

texts.en:
Aneta is a Roma from Sliven, Bulgaria. The Roma, commonly known as Gypsies in the West, is a severely marginalized group in the Balkan Peninsula of Southeast Europe. Aneta is married with one child.

Aneta’s business is importing and selling clothing from Turkey. Every Sunday evening around 8pm, Aneta and several other Roma hop on a chartered microbus (closer to a minivan than a bus) and travel down to Istanbul. Among the group is “Baba Zeira”, (Grandmother Zeira), who has also received a loan from Kiva:

http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=392

This group, predominately comprised of women, arrive in Istanbul between 6 and 7am Monday morning, passing through the border crossing at Svelingrad in the middle of the night. They split up and spend the entire day shopping in the garment district (near the main bazaar) for the types of clothes they each sell in Sliven. They get back on their minibus with bags of merchandise for the next week that evening, and are back in Sliven Tuesday morning.

Aneta focuses on dresses, which are predominately worn at Roma weddings and other major events. Her gross margin is good – 45% - but the constant travel back and forth to Istanbul is taxing, both financially and mentally. This loan will give her the working capital to purchase more inventory on individual trips and make that trip less often. In addition, she’ll be able to expand the breadth of her offerings and offer her clients more selection.

A short video clip taken inside Aneta’s house / warehouse can be found here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3rJ_iuSpi5Q

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en: Prisca lives in the Vingunguti area of Dar es Salaam. She has spent over four years in the food vending business. Different from other food vendors, Prisca’s business is mobile. She produces food at home, packs the food and distributes it to the various customers she has, especially office workers.  She plans to improve her business by adding a sufficient number of food serving dishes and packaging materials. Recently she has obtained orders to serve three more offices located at City Centre, so she needs more working capital. To facilitate her plan Prisca needs USD 400.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Jeneba

texts.en: Jeneba is 35 years old and the mother of two and she is expecting another baby soon. She has a small fish selling business in Kabala market. Before Jeneba got married she was managing a small grocery shop in Freetown. Her husband is employed as a driver with a low salary, hardly enough to sustain the family. Jeneba joined the SMT program a year ago, and she has seen progress in her business. She has increased her stock from 75 kg of fish to 150 kg and she would like to increase her stock more. Jeneba and her husband are very determined to see their children properly educated. Jeneba has begun to save a very small portion of her income for the future school expenses of her children.

loans.use: Jeneba would like to increase her stock of fish to sell from 150 kg to 250 kg.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam C. is forty years old and married with two children.  Her husband is also a petty trader in the same market but in a different location. The couples’ businesses are too small to make enough income for all the family's needs, so Mariam would like to diversify her business by including the selling of rice, palm oil and peanut butter.  She said if only she could access a loan of $175, she would improve her income. Then she and her husband would be able to purchase items from the villages for her to sell in the town.  Mariam is serious about providing her two children with a good education and a better future life.

loans.use: Diversify into selling of rice, plam oil, and peanut butter

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julian is married and his wife is a homemaker. Starting very young, he learned baking and pastry skills from the grandmother who raised him. He helped her in any way that he could and when she died, he took over her business and helped to support his 3 siblings. That was 10 years ago and, in that time, he has pulled the business forward and helped his siblings to get ahead. He's a very hard worker and now he wants to grow his business and clear his family's expenses. He's placing his hopes on your support.

Julian asks for a US$650 loan to buy basic ingredients that will help him to continue his business. He offers to repay the loan in 6 months. He and his family thank you for the support that you're giving them and he knows that with this help, he will be able to continue growing his business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Julian es un hombre casado y su esposa se dedica al hogar como ama de casa, él desde muy pequeño aprendió lo que es la panadería y repostería por su abuela con quien se crió, y la ayudaba en todo lo que el podía, cuando su abuela murió el se hizo cargo del negocio y ayudaba a mantener a sus 3 hermanos, esto sucedió hace 10 años atrás, así el ha sacado adelante el negocio y ayudado a sus hermanos a salir adelante, es muy trabajador y desea crecer con su negocio y poder solventar los gastos de su familia, y por ello tiene mucha esperanza en su apoyo.

Julian solicita un préstamo por US $ 650 para comprar materia prima y continuar con su negocio, ofreciendo pagar este préstamo en 6 meses. Él y su familia te agradecen por el apoyo que le das y sabe que con este apoyo podrá continuar creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: Buy basic ingredients for bakery business.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en: Dina A. is 50 years old and has eight children. She started selling cereal 11 years ago and, despite stiff competition, has seen her business grow over the years because of her hard work, experience and ability to attract a well-established client base. Dina sells a wide range of cereals, including beans, dry maize, rice, millet and sorghum. The profit from the sale of these food staples, which are easy to store and handle, help her pay school fees for her children and other household expenses, as well as set aside money she can use when business is slow.  Dina plans to use three quarters of her loan to purchase beans and rice to sell to her customers, and put the remainder aside as savings to use in case of unforeseen circumstances.

loans.use: Purchase stock of cereals

loans.name: Subgroup B Of Tegemeo

texts.en:
NURU, age 28, is the mother of two children (ages 13 and 6). She lives with her children, her husband, her late brother’s 14-year-old daughter, and another 2-year-old orphaned relative. While her husband has a job doing development work for the government, Nuru works from home doing embroidery, knitting, and tie & dye. She makes bed sheets, chair cushions, sweaters, and tie-dyed dresses and sells them door-to-door to schools, offices, and homes.

Nuru started her business over two years ago. Before this business, she fried fish, chapattis, and donuts to sell on the street. Because frying was a hot and tiring job, she finds that her new business suits her much better.

With a roll of fabric, costing about $24, Nuru is able to make a profit of about $20. A roll of fabric makes about 10 pieces of clothing, and it takes about a week to go through the roll. It takes her about a day to make a tie-dyed dress, 4 days to knit a baby’s outfit, and a week to embroider a bed sheet. She generally works from 4am to 4pm every day. Her sister assists her when she has free time. In a month, Nuru makes between $130 and $160.

Nuru spends the profits from her business on her children and toward school fees. She also sends money to her mother who is financially dependent on her. She puts what is remaining in savings with the hope of buying land one day.

Nuru is the leader of Subgroup B of Tegemeo (Swahili for “expectation”). She will be sharing this loan with her subgroup members: Asha A. (market seller), Litambo J. (shop owner), Hamida J. (sells clothing), and Asha I. (sells clothing). This subgroup has taken out 3 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to enhance their businesses, and they were able to pay each back successfully.

Nuru used the previous loans to buy more materials for her business. She now hopes for another loan for the same purpose.

In the picture, Nuru is wearing the bright blue outfit.

loans.use: To buy more knitting material and fabric

loans.name: Teddy's Group

texts.en: Teddy is a single mother of three children. Her current business is selling charcoal and firewood. With the extra profits, Teddy intends to open up a small bar.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 51 year old father of two, who lives with his wife and children in south Lebanon, in Tyre. Ali owns a grocery shop which is the main source of support for his family. In order to upgrade his family's living standards, Ali needs to expand his grocery business and thus requires a loan to buy new merchandise.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise

loans.name: Mukuba North C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Mariam B.. She is currently in the business of produce sales and is requesting a loan to add more capital. Maraim is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a driver for work. She has 4 children ranging from age 4 to 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Maraim makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children. Mariam has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Maraim is joined in her small group by Zabuwa B., Jesca N., Jamawa N., and Rehema N.. Zabuwa B. has a business selling potatoes and wants to increase her stock. Jesca N. is currently operating a beauty salon business and wants a loan to purchase more hair chemicals. Jamawa N. operates a business selling produce and wants to uplift her business. Rehema N. is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan to buy more cloth fabric and thread.

loans.use: To buy and sell more produce to expand business

loans.name: Maria Emperatriz

texts.es:
Mrs. M.’s business is located in the Libertador district. She has been offering regional dishes for about 15 years, and for the moment, it’s the biggest source of family income. Her partner works as a laborer in the region. In the 15 years she’s had her business, she’s raised two sons who are now adults and have their own families, and little by little, she’s been able to make home improvements. She began by paying off her land lot in one payment, and has since been able to build a house dignified to live in. Her credit record with this institution, as with other institutions, is excellent and she demonstrates punctuality and responsibility in her financial transactions. Currently, she needs to have a absorption well installed to be a part of the potable water project in that area.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. M. tiene su negocio ubicado en el departamento de la Libertad venta de comidas típicas el cual a mantenido al rededor de quince años y que por el momento sigue siendo la fuente de sus ingresos mayores en la familia el grupo familiar lo componen dos personas la solicitante y el compañero de vida quien trabaja como jornalero en la zona durante estos quince años de tener el negocio a podido sacar adelante a su grupo familiar sus dos hijos que ya crecieron y tienen su grupo familiar ya formado con estos esfuerzos además a podido ir mejorando poco a poco su vivienda comenzó pagando su lote en totalidad y hasta la fecha a podido construir una vivienda digna en la cual vivir, en su historial crediticio tanto con la institución como con otras instituciones es excelente ya que demuestra mucha puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus compromisos financieros, su necesidad actualmente es el poder efectuar un pozo de absorción que esta solicitando la empresa que efectuara el proyecto de instalación de Agua Potable en la zona

loans.use: To buy construction materials such as sand, gravel and cement to install an absorption well.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina is a young lady with high ideals for success, she knows that to reach them is not easy and has decided to set her goals accordingly and therefore she is breeding guinea pigs and growing hydroponics. Her knowledge and success are the result of having studied for 5 years at a prestigious university center. She wishes to continue with the project of breeding guinea pigs on a large scale and has decided to move to her native town of Huancavelica to fulfill her purpose and continue growing hydroponics on a larger scale to feed the guinea pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Marina, es una joven con grandes ideales de éxito, ella sabe que para lograrlo no es fácil y ha decidido fijar sus metas en torno a ellas, por esa razón se dedica a la crianza de cuyes y también a los cultivos hidropónicos. Los conocimientos que hoy pone en práctica son producto de los 5 años de estudio en las aulas universitarias de un prestigioso centro de estudios y hoy están dando sus frutos. Ella esta deseosa por continuar con su proyecto de crianza de cuyes a gran escala y ha decidido mudar su centro de crianza a su ciudad natal Huancavelica para alcanzar su propósito y continuar con sus cultivos hidropónicos en mayor cantidad para la alimentación de los mismos.

loans.use: Increase capital to make breeding business grow.

loans.name: Vali

texts.en: Vali A. is a 47-year-old farmer whose main activity for many years has been calf breeding for meat production. He is married and has three children. Vali lives in the southern region of Bilasuvar. Meat is very popular across Azerbaijan and people use it in their everyday cuisine. To expand his business, Vali has applied for a loan of $800 USD to purchase two calves for an estimated $400 USD each.

loans.use: Going to purchase two calves.

loans.name: Luis Marcos

texts.es:
Luis is the father of three children, one of them helps him take care of his motorcycle carts. Every morning they get up very early to offer services to the public. However, the last few months the motorcarts have needed maintenance and repair. Luis would like to fix them, But the economic situation prevents him from being able to get to a mechanic and he can't afford to make the repairs. Without the motorcart, he can't work, and his family suffers.

He is requesting the loan to repair his motorcarts and pay the mechanic fees which are very high. Let's help this father/daughter pair so they can continue their daily work.

Luis es padre de tres hijos, uno de ellos le ayuda en la atención de sus motocarros, trabajando padre e hijo juntos. Todas las mañanas salen muy temprano para brindar sus servicios de movilidad pública. Sin embargo, los últimos meses sus motocarros están teniendo ciertas fallas y don Luis desea poder repararlos, pero sus posibilidades económicas le impiden poder llevar su motocarro a un mecánico porque los repuestos son costosos. Sin su motocarro, don Luis no puede trabajar y deja de llevar el sostén diario a su hogar. El préstamo que ahora solicita es para comprar los repuestos de su motocarro malogrado, darle un necesario mantenimiento y también pagar los servicios mecánicos. Los repuestos para estas motos, son muy caros, y no están a su alcance. Colabora con este dúo de padre e hijo a continuar con su trabajo diario.

loans.use: TO MAKE THE NECESSARY REPAIRS ON HIS MOTORCART, SO HE CAN CONTINUE TO WORK.  WITHOUT THE MOTORCART, HIS FAMILY HAS NO INCOME.

loans.name: Rukayia

texts.en:
Rukayia is a 48-year-old married mother of four children who are currently in school. She is a food vendor and has been preparing and selling rice and beans for twenty years. With her excellent customer care and good taste, she has a large number of customers buying from her stand. She recognizes how profitable it would be to expand her market since she has already established so much customer goodwill.

Rukayia plans to use this loan to buy more bags of rice, vegetable oil, beans, spices and meat to scale up her production. She believes this will provide her with increased income to send her first son to medical school this year. She belongs to the community group called the Diamond Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy stocks of rice, vegetable oil, beans, spices and meat

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: Tahir has been in the concrete transportation business for 15 years. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Fuzuli region in Azerbaijan, and he settled in Baku city, in the settlement of Buzovna. Tahir is married, and has 4 children. He is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy spare parts for his truck.

loans.use: Buy the spare parts for his truck

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwo A. is a trader in used clothes. She is married and blessed with two kids who are currently in school. 
Adwo helps support her family through her trading business. She has been selling for the past eight years, but progress has persistently been low due to insufficient funds. She hopes the loan will enable her to revive the business and buy more viable used clothes. 
She wants to purchase bales of bulk used clothes to increase her inventory with the loan to be able to save more and provide her children with a quality education. She belongs to the group called "Nyame Mma" meaning God's children.
The group provides assistance and support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Mboja

texts.en:
Mboja sells charcoal in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar. Charcoal is a common household item in Tanzania, as it remains the primary fuel for cooking food. Few families own stoves or ovens. Mboja is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to increase the amount of charcoal she has to sell.

Mjoba is 29 years old, married, and has one two-month-old child.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Mrs. Sokpheng Pok Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank, which consists of 20 people, is located in Ta Reab Doun Sar Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. SokpH. P. was selected by the members to be the village bank president. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her household. Her husband, Mr. Don Narith, is a fisherman. In order to catch more fish, Mrs. SokpH. P. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets. Mrs. SokpH. P. is 38 years old and the mother of five children, four of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one stays home because he is too young for school.

loans.use: To buy fishnets

loans.name: Hen

texts.en:
Mrs. Hen T. lives in Kos Roka Krauv village in Kampong Cham province. She is a grocer who owns a small store in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her inventory.

Mrs. Hen T. is a widow and she has five children, one of whom is a lathe operator, while another is employed in a casino club. Another one is a pig breeder, while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods for her inventory.

loans.name: Mariaq

texts.es:
María es una persona muy emprendedora. Los negocios que la mantienen siempre activa Durante las mañanas ella prepara yogur natural para venderlo ya sea en su casa o por reparto a domicilio según los clientes que lo requieran. Por otro lado, en las tardes se encarga de atender desde hace veinte años su salón de belleza. 

Eventualmente, según la demanda de sus clientes, también elabora tejidos con macramé. Con ello vende productos para lámparas, bolsos, sandalias, etc. Asimismo, vende cosméticos por catálogo desde hace dos años.

Para María todo empezó con sus estudios en cosmetología. Al inicio trabajaba para clientes particulares. Pero cuando se enfermo una temporada empezó a recibir clientes en su propia casa. Es así, que se anima a abrir un salón de belleza. Ahora está contenta con los diversos negocios que maneja, aun así mas adelántele gustaría poner un puesto de juguería en el mercado para poder vender el yogur que produce.
texts.en:
Maria is a very hardworking person. Her businesses always keep her busy. During the morning she prepares natural yogurt to sell either in her home or delivering to her customer’s homes who have ordered it. And then, in the afternoons she works in a beauty salon, which she has done for 20 years. Then, according to customer demand, she also does macramé weavings. She sells weavings for lamps, purses, sandals, etc. In addition for the past two years she has sold cosmetics by catalog. Everything began with cosmetology for Maria. In the beginning she worked with private customers. But when she became ill she began to service clients in her own home. It was then she decided to open a beauty salon. Now she is content with the various businesses that she manages, and in the future she would like to open a juice stand in the market to be able to sell the yogurt that she produces.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make natural yogurt

loans.name: Anzhella

texts.en:
Anzhella is married with one child. She runs a small business that offers celebration services (birthdays, parties, etc.) for children. She has been in this business for 2 years. There is very little competition in this business in the city and high demand, so Anzhella has many clients. 

Anzhella would like to get a loan of 7500 UAH to purchase new costumes and equipment. This would allow her to implement new creative ideas and give her clients much happiness. Anzhella's business goal is to have more clients and make this business a stable source of income for her family.

loans.use: Purchase new costumes

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora M., 60, is a widow who lives in Salimpuno, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, Phillipines. She has 7 children, one of whom is still going to school. Some are married and some have already finished school and are now working and earning a living on their own.
 
Flora operates a sari-sari store (variety store) business. When she started her business, she got her capital from her coconut income. Her neighbors were her prime customers. For almost three years now, she has been a member of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, and she testifies to the worth of its programs and services. She is requesting a loan of PHP 14,000.00. This is her seventh loan, and she will use it to purchase additional grocery items, such as canned goods and noodles for her sari-sari store.

Flora’s future plans are to have a separate building for her business (which is presently in her house) and to save more for her daughter’s education.

loans.use: Purchase grocery items, such as canned goods and noodles

loans.name: Gabriela Del Carmen

texts.es: La Joven Gabriela vende frutas y verduras, granos básicos, gaseosa, golosinas y mucha variedad. Desde hace cinco años, empezó solo vendiendo golosina y leña. Tiene 22 años de edad, habita en el Edgar Mungia, en la ciudad de Managua. Tiene dos hijos de 4 y 5 años de edad, con este crédito va a comprar variedad de productos para ofertar a sus clientes. Sus planes es poder incrementar su negocio y poder terminar de construir su casa para dar a sus hijos una casa digna. Ya que su casa es humilde es hecha de tabla.
texts.en:
The young Gabriela sells fruits and vegetables, basic grains, sodas, candies and many other items. She began five years ago, selling only sodas and firewood. She is 22 years old and lives in the Edgar Mungia neighborhood of the city of Managua. She has two children who are 4 and 5 years old. With this loan she will buy a variety of products to offer her clients. Her plan is to increase her business and finish building her house so that she can provide her children with a proper home. Her current home is humble and made of planks.

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Afde 18 Group

texts.fr: Les cinq femmes du groupe Association Femme Développement Entreprise Numéro 18 ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Cité Lamy à Thiès, une ville de 70 kilomètres de Dakar, le capital de Sénégal.  Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles exercent presque la même activité de vente de.  Elles sont bien expérimentées et très sollicitées dans ces activités. Dans le cadre de l’amélioration de la qualité de leurs services et l’agrandissement de la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe confiance ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance l’IMCEC.  Elles ont déjà reçu un prêt de groupement auprès de l’IMCEC, et elles l’ont bien remboursé. Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour reconstituer leur stock de poissons qu’elles vont vendre en détail, au comptant au marché grand Thiès.  Les poissons font partie essentiel de la cuisine sénégalaise, donc il y a toujours beaucoup de demande.  Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30,000 CFA ($60) au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
“Association Femme Développement Entreprise AFDE Numéro 18” is composed of five women who average 40 years of age and who live in large traditional extended families in the Cité Lamy district in Thiès, a city located 70 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. These women know one another through ties of community and kinship. They do almost the same work, selling fish. They are very experienced and in high demand in this field.

With regard to improving the quality of their services and expanding their businesses, the members of this reliance group decided to join the micro-finance institution IMCEC. They received a group loan before from IMCEC, and they indeed repaid it.

The group members plan to use this loan to replenish their stock of fish, which they’re going to sell retail, cash accepted, at the Grand Thiès marketplace. Fish is an essential part of Senegalese cuisine, so there is always a lot of demand.

The group members hope to realize an average profit of 30,000 francs CFA in the course of this cycle. The profits will be used to make loan interest payments, to provide for family needs, and to invest the rest in business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Grupo Plaza Group

texts.es:
el grupo plaza es un grupo con integrantes jovenes y muy unidos que tienen muchas ganas de superarse, este grupo se conforma de la siguiente manera:
Christian Daniel M. de 23 años de edad que es el cordinador del grupo, este muchacho se dedica a la venta de ropa interior, camisas, blusas, zapatos y juguetes, el vende estos productos en la colonia que recide y tambien viaja los fines de semana junto con la mama al departamento de Olancho en la zona del mercado de campamento, el tiene mas de 5 años de dedicarse a las ventas con este proceso se ayuda a cubrir los gastos que tiene en la universidad. 
 La Sra. Norma Catalina R. de 36 años de edad quien es una muchacha emprendedora, es madre soltera con 4 hijos de los cuales 2 ya estan grandes y dos estudian, ella se a dedicado a la costura de ropa interior y sabanas, tiene mas de 6 años de dedicarse a este rubro, esta actividad le ha ayudado a salir adelante con su familia. 
El SR. Kany S. de 21 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de lociones, estuches de reloj, ropa interior y camisas para hombres ya sean formales o sports, el se dedica a esto para poder ayudar a su madre con los gastos, el tiene mas de tres años de dedicarse a las ventas , con el dinero piensa invertir mas para tener una mejor utilidad y crecer como comerciante. todos ellos son personas emprendedoras y muy colaboradoras.
texts.en:
The plaza group has young members who are very united and have the motivation to improve themselves. This group is comprised of the following members: Christian Daniel M. is 23 years old and is the coordinator of the group. He sells undergarments, shirts, blouses, shoes, and toys for a living. He sells these products in the town where he lives and he travels on the weekends with his mother to the Olancho district, where the central market is located. He has been doing this activity for more than 5 years in order to cover his bills for university education. Norma Catalina R. is 36 years old. She is an entreprenuer and a single mother of four children, two of whom are adults and two of whom are still in school. She has been making undergarments and sheets for more than 6 years. This job has allowed her family to improve their circumstances. Kany S. is 21 years old and sells lotions, watch boxes, undergarments, and men's shirts (formal or casual). He has this job in order to help his mother with the household bills. He has had this job for over 3 years. With this loan, he would like to invest in tools to help him grow as a business man. They are all entrepreneurs and team players.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase men's and women's clothing, watch boxes, and undergarments

loans.name: Zaman

texts.en:
Zaman Q. is a 38-year-old farmer who sells milk and milk products as well as breeding calves for meat production. He has been engaged in this business since 1995. He is married and lives in a house with his parents. He is the only breadwinner in his family.

Zaman would like to expand his business and purchase two more calves in order to increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase two more calves

loans.name: Krang

texts.en:
Krang C. is 54 years old and lives in Pursat Province, in Cambodia. She is a widowed mother who has given birth to seven children: six are married and have ready started new families, while the other one is single and employed as a motorcycle taxi driver.

At present, Krang C. has a job as a local farmer. As another income source, she is buying and selling natural fertilizers and rice for a profit. Krang C. will use the loan to purchase a motorbike in order to make transportation easier and to use as capital to make her business more successful.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for transportation

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Trinidad B. is from the village of Bagong Silang, Balangasan District, Pagadian City. She is 39 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. Trinidad owns and operates a business running a specialized retail store, primarily selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. Trinidad joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Pagadian - Balangasan District, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Cristinita

texts.en:
Cristinita M., 49, is the tireless community leader of their fellowship group. Her husband Ricardo, also 49 years old, has been her business partner for years. They have 3 children and live in Barangay 176, Bagong Silang, Caloocan City.

Cristinita has a home-based department store. She brings home items from big supermarkets and department stores and sells them to her neighbors at affordable prices. She regularly joins auctions organized by mall operators and buys items, ranging from designer clothes to household grocery items, at fairly low prices. She also owns a rice retail store and the newest addition to her business, a community pharmacy, where she sells purely generic medicines the poor can afford.

She earns PHP 20,000 monthly from the combined operations of all her business activities. Her newly opened community pharmacy is where a large portion of her latest loan, amounting to PHP 34,000, was invested.  She's currently allotting part of their savings towards the renovation of their house.

CCT is a Filipino family-oriented and Bible-centered development organization that provides and creates equal business opportunities for small-scale Filipino entrepreneurs through loans and social interventions.

loans.use: purchase supplies for her drugstore, the newest addition to her enterprise.

loans.name: Prom

texts.en:
Prom S., 37, has been working as a teacher in a local primary school in his village in Battambong Province since 2001. He earns a typical income of US$2 per day.

S. is married and lives with his wife, who is a farmer who plants corns and also a grocery seller. With her current jobs, she is typically able to generate US$6.50 per day. They are blessed with two young children who do not yet attend school.

S. wants to take a loan of US$1,000 for the first time from Kiva partner, CREDIT, for his wife to purchase more various kinds of groceries for sale. He wants to save his income for his children’s education and expanding his wife’s current business. (S.'s wife is presented in the picture)

loans.use: To purchasing more groceries for his wife to sell

loans.name: Maria Flor

texts.es:
María Flor es una madre D. familia D. 30 años D. edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus cinco hijos en el distrito D. Mórrope, ubicado a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

DesD. hace año y medio tiene una pequeña bodega en donD. venD. artículos D. primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc.), abarrotes y algunas verduras; este pequeño negocio se ha constituido como la principal fuente D. ingreso económico D. su hogar ya que su esposo trabaja eventualmente como chofer D. combi (vehículo utilizado para el transporte público D. pasajeros) y lo que el percibe no le alcanza para las necesidades económicas D. su hogar.

Teniendo en cuenta esta situación, ella trata D. sacar adelante a su negocio pero hace algún tiempo se ha venido desabasteciendo D. los productos que usualmente ofrece, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la ampliación D. su negocio con la compra D. mas artículos D. primera necesidad que son los productos que tienen más salida entre sus clientes.

María Flor desea seguir sacando adelante a su familia y, mediante el trabajo en su negocio, brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida así como asegurar la educación D. sus menores hijos; ella tiene buenas referencias entre sus vecinos que la consideran una persona muy activa y responsable.
texts.en:
Maria Flor is a 30 year-old mother who lives with her husband and 5 children in the Morrope district, located 30 minutes outsiD. of the city of Chiclayo. For the past year and a half she has run a small store where she sells groceries like rice, sugar, oil, and some vegetables. This small business has been the primary source of income for her family since her husband's job as a bus driver was not making enough to proviD. for the household necessities. To make up for this, she tries to push her business forward, but at a certain point she began running out of the products that she normally offers, and that is why she is asking for her first loan of 500 sols, which she plans to invest in the expansion of her business by purchasing more of the basic foods that sell out most quickly with her customers. Maria Flor would like to continue improving the situation of her family thorough her work with the hope of offering them a better quality of life, for example by securing the education of her younger children. Maria has good references from her neighbors who consider your a very active and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of groceries

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha is a member of the Kitanzini borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 36 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 20,15 years.she also cares for other 1 dependent.

Esha started her own fishing business selling Fish 8 years ago,she works 6 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Esha first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more fish for sale.


With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Esha hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a member of the Dodoma borrower group in Kihesa, Iringa. She is 20 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 1 child . Her child is 1 year old.

Mary has owned a food business selling vegetable for 2 years, she works 12 hours  a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 75,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Mary`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amoumt of 100,000 Tsh in order to cultivate more vegetable for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Mary hopes  to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To cultivate more vegetable

loans.name: Jeremías

texts.es: Jeremías F. Q. reside en Atiquizaya en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Jeremías tiene 31 años de edad vive con sus suegros, su esposa y su hija. La familia Q. es muy unida, Jeremías tiene una venta de de materiales de construcción donde recibe ayuda de su esposa en logística de ventas, también maneja un camión de su propiedad el cual transporta los materiales de construcción hasta la puerta de sus clientes, el crédito que solicita es para invertir en su negocio comprando mayor cantidad de materiales que le permitan aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Jeremías F. Q. resides in Atiquizaya in the department of Ahuachapán. Jeremías is 31 years old and lives with his in-laws, his wife, and his daughter. The Q. family is very close. Jeremías sells construction materials and receives help from his wife with logistics. He also drives a truck, which he owns, to transport the construction materials to the doors of his customers. The loan he is applying for is for investing in his business by purchasing a greater quantity of materials that will permit him to increase his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock his business

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La socia Ana María, pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU SAN JERONIMO”; nuestra socia es natural de la ciudad del  Cusco.

Nuestro socia  tiene 31 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 1 hijo, la socia  alterna sus  actividades del hogar con  el comercio minorista, nuestra socia tiene una pequeña tienda abarrotes, la cual la administra y trabaja a tiempo completo, la socia requiere el dinero para poder comprar al por mayor productos como son, arroz, aceite, azúcar y otros de esta manera sus ingresos serán mayores.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo que le brindan mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This is Ana María. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Kantu San Jeronimo” and a native of Cusco.

Ana María is 31 years old, married, and has one child. She divides her time between her household chores and her small business. Ana María has a grocery store that she manages full time. She is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise in bulk such as rice, oil, sugar, and other items so that she can improve her income.

Ana María appreciates and values the loan that has been provided to her. She agrees to make her payments on the established due dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock her store

loans.name: Sonia Del Socorro

texts.en: Sonia is 58 years old, and has three adult children. Her business is the sale of nacatamales and tamales relleno and other typical Nicaraguan foods.  She also makes and sells natural juices and a typical Nicaraguan drink called atol. These skills have been passed down from her mother and she has developed a strong reputation for her excellent products. This loan will go towards the purchase of ingredients for the tamales. She dreams of improving her business so that she is able to provide for her grandchildren. Sonia has a good credit history with Fundacion Leon 2000.

loans.use: Ingredients for food production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a big cow that is ready to butcher.

loans.name: Survivor Group

texts.en:
Annie D. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Survivor. She is 26 years old and a single mother with a 4-year-old child in kindergarten .She also cares for a nephew. Annie is a fifth grade drop-out due to lack of financial support. Annie and her child live in the Frog Island Community of Gbarnga, the capital city of Bong County, Liberia.

Her business is the sale of palm oil. She buys palm oil wholesale and sells at retail to residents of her community in Gbarnga. Annie has been running this business for two years, and is hoping to improve her business by building a storage room for goods in the near future.

The rainy season is a difficulty for Annie, because when it rains, farmers hardly come out to cut palms to produce the oil that she buys; it causes an oil shortage in the market. 

Annie talks to customers in a good manner and sells her oil for an affordable price in order to encourage them to always come to patronize her business. She needs this loan to purchase new oil to serve customers. Annie dreams of building a house for her and her child.

loans.use: To purchase new oil to serve customers

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Mrs Salamatu K. is a 37-year-old woman who is married with three children: two male and one female. She resides with her family in Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. She sells palm oil, firewood and bags of coal in Freetown.

With her previous loan from LAPOSL, Salamatu expanded her business by purchasing more rubbers (plastic bottles) of palm oil, firewood and bags of coal.

With this loan she will purchase more of the same goods, in the hope of further expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil, firewood and bags of coal

loans.name: María Elsa

texts.es:
La señora María Elsa S. de 48 años empezó a trabajar siendo muy joven junto con su madre la cual le enseño darle esa sazón que hace la diferencia entre una comida y otra. Ella poco a poco le tomo amor y aprecio al arte culinario ya que le encanta hacer una comida gustosa y el hecho de que sus clientes estén satisfechos la hace sentir feliz.

S. invertirá el crédito en la compra de ingredientes como granos básicos, carne, verduras, frutas y legumbres para realizar exquisitos platillos.
texts.en:
María Elsa S. is 48 years old. She started working with her mother when she was very young. It’s from her that she learned special techniques to flavor food the right way. Little by little she learned to love the art of cooking as she loves to make tasty food and please her customers. S. will invest this loan in the purchase of ingredients such as basic grain, meat, vegetables, fruit and legumes to make delicious dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grain, meat, vegetables, fruit and legumes

loans.name: Laziya

texts.en: N. Laziya is a successful businesswoman. She is 40 years-old and married with five children in school. She owns a retail shop which she has been running for over two years. She is using the loan to increase the stock of her business by purchasing items such as dishes, forks, knives, frying pans, sauce pans, flasks, basins, cups, plates, spoons, Jeri cans, etc. for sale. Her future plan is to construct a house.

loans.use: To increase her business stock.

loans.name: Yesenia Yaneth

texts.es: Yesenia Yaneth M. R. de 30 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Delgado, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive únicamente junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como comerciante. Yesenia posee una venta de frutas, la cual esta ubicada en el centro de Soyapango, un lugar con alta afluencia de personas y zona de mucho comercio. Así mismo posee una granja en la cual cría y vende pollos. Desde hace 5 años que ella posee este negocio, el cual le ha permitido brindarle la ayuda necesaria a su esposo para los gastos del hogar, así mismo le permite poder contar con una estabilidad económica. Yesenia solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad y variedad de fruta, ya que esta se vende mucho en el lugar y así mismo comprar el alimento de los pollos por mayor. Esto lo hace con la ilusión de poder crecer como comerciante y así mismo obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Yesenia Yaneth M. R. is 30 years old and lives in the city of Delgado, located in the San Salvador department. She lives with her husband, who works as a trader. Yesenia has a business selling fruit which is located in the center of Soyapango, a place with an abundance of people and a busy commercial zone. She also has a farm where she raises and sells chickens. She has had this business for 5 years, and it has allowed her to help her husband with paying the household expenses, and has provided her with greater economic stability. Yesenia requests a loan through which she will be able to buy a greater quantity and variety of fruit, since there is a large market for these products. She will also use the loan to buy feed for her chickens at wholesale. She does this with the hope of being able to grow as a trader, and in this way have better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fruit and chicken feed

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Bisheshe Kweterana Group, Ibanda

texts.en: A. Patience is a good person. She appears at the top left and in the group photo. She is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is 47 years old and married with two children aged 8 and 3 years. She also takes care of three other children. Patience has had a retail shop in Bisheshe Trading Centre for five years now. She sells general merchandise that helps to bring in an income for business growth and enables her to save. She works so hard to ensure that her children attain the best education so that they become self-sustaining in the future. She needs a loan to be able to recapitalize her shop with more goods for increased sales.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of corn

loans.name: Mrs. Yoeng Leab Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has 11 people who live in Boeng Kraom village in Kandal province. Mrs. Yoeng L. is the village bank president. She has been selected by all the members. They will use a loan to do something that can improve their living conditions. She and her husband, Mr. Saroeurn Mai, are farmers who own more than two hectares of land to grow rice and vegetable to sell in the market to support their family. They have a problem because their field is far from an irrigation system. Thus, in order to improve rice and vegetable production, Mrs. Yoeng L. decided to ask for a loan to buy gasoline for doing farming. She is a mother of three children. All her children are studying in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy gasoline for doing farming

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida V. wants to improve the life of her eight children, ranging in age from 8 to 18, while they are still under her care. Despite the family's poverty, Aida dreams of her children graduating from college and having good careers.

For now, Aida enjoys her role managing her small vegetable-selling business and the small profit it earns to support the family's primary needs every day. Instead of looking at the negative side of being poor, Aida tries to focus her thoughts on the events in her life which she considers a blessing, including having given birth to two sets of twins, now aged 8 and 16 years old. Another is being a member of ASHI, which provides her with many opportunities that she didn’t have before, most especially the opportunity to receive loans for financing a business.

Having run her business for a few years now, Aida realizes how worthwhile it is to request a loan and grow a business. She is now seeking a much larger loan from ASHI to purchase a larger stock of fruits and vegetables for sale. This will give her and her family not only a larger source of income for food and other basic needs, but also happiness for Aida having the opportunity to use her abilities in a productive way.

loans.use: To purchase a larger volume of fruits and vegetables for selling.

loans.name: Ana Fe

texts.en:
Ana Fe O. is from the village of Omonay, Damulog, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Ana Fe is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ana Fe owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling a variety of different products in the local community. Ana Fe has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ana Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ana Fe is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Ana Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El señor José vive en anticretico en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja y es accionista en una empresa que elabora tarjetas de crédito y debito.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar material y poder continuar con esta actividad, ya que es su única fuente de ingresos.

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
