texts.en:
Jose lives in an “antricretico,” (An anticrético is a contract to rent property whereby the renter pays the landlord a fixed sum at the start of the rental period in lieu of paying monthly rent.) in the Tembladerani zone of La Paz. He works in and is part owner of a factory that manufactures credit and debit cards. He is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies that will allow him to continue operating, as this is his only source of income. He is an Impro client, with a reputation for paying on time, so he has been approved for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Marimba

texts.fr: Madame Marimba D. est une femme  commerçante qui habite dans le quartier de Daroukhane  à Guediawaye. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Baye laye depuis mai 2006. Elle est mariée  sans enfants. Son activité  est orientée vers l’achat et la vente de produits venant du Mali et de la Cote d’Ivoire tels que savons, karité, etc. C’est une activité  qu’elle a choisi par passion,  aussi  elle  ne  voulait pas rester inactive. Ce qui fait son fort c’est que c’est une activité  qui marche toujours car ses produits sont sollicites tout le temps. Elle sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs dans le but de passer une nouvelle commande de produits et ainsi renforcer son stock et en même  temps son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marimba D. is a merchant who lives in the Daroukhane district in Guediawaye. She has been a member of the Baye Laye branch since May 2006. She is married but has no children. Her business involves buying and reselling products coming from Mali and Cote d’Ivoire such as soap, karité (shea butter), etc. She is passionate about this business, and of course she did not want to remain idle. Her great strength is that the business is successful since the products she sells are always in demand. She is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs to allow her to put in a new order for products and thus bolster her inventory and her sales.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Davaajargal

texts.en:
Davaajargal V., age 42, lives with her son in Uvurhangai province. They live in her own traditional housing tent called a ger. In 2003, she moved from Taragt sub province and purchased a container in which she kept food products. She is a teacher and her living conditions are good. Depending on sales, Davaajargal makes food-procurement trips two to four times a month. Bread, pastry and cookies are supplied by the manufacturers. 

Her personality is polite, and she seems to be good at calculating and estimating. She wants to have her own food store and work in her profession of teaching or accounting. 

She is requesting a 3,400,000 Mongolia tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase food products at wholesale prices from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie A. is from the village of Pinamulaan,Banisilan,Cotabato. She is 43 years old and married. To make a living, Josie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Josie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Josie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Josie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which also will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Josie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jiguiseme Vi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe JIGUISEME VI  est composé  de femmes mariées du village de Kampogosso Kafonon dans la préfecture  de San, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 36 ans et au moins 5 enfants. Elles cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les deux prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
TIANTIO C. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants,  au grand marché de Kimparana ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana. Les ventes se fond aussi dans les  marchés  environnants en détail (souvent en gros) au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
TIANTIO C. compte réaliser, après l’écoulement de sa production agricole, un bénéfice de 70.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The group JIGUISEME VI is made up of married women from the village of Kampogosso Kafonon in the prefecture of San, in the region of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They live in traditional families and are, on average, 36 years old and have at least five children. They cultivate peanuts. In hopes of increasing the profits from their agricultural work, the members of the group decided three years ago to participate in the loan program through Soro Yiriwaso. After having properly repaid their previous loans, they are now on their third business loan. Tiantio C. plans to use her loan to buy an adequate quantity of peanut seeds, small tools, and fertilizer at the main market of Kimparana. After the winter season, the crops are stored for a length of time so that their value will increase before being sold at the main market of Kimparana. They also make their sales in neighboring markets at retail (and often at wholesale), in cash, to customers who generally come from large cities. Tiantio C. plans to earn, after the sale of her agricultural products, a profit of 30,000 to 55,000 FCFA which will be used to pay the interest on the loan and to meet daily family expenses.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fertilizers, seeds and small equipment

loans.name: Women Of Progress Group

texts.en:
Josephine T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Women Of Progress.

Josephine is 40 years old, married, and has seven children who range from 3 to 22 years old. She was not privileged to attend school due to poverty. She cares for one sibling. 

For 8 years, she has been selling fish (fresh and dried) in Redlight Market, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 9,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 45,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more cartons of fish.

She describes herself as a hard-working woman. Her goal is to improve her business, and build a house.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Malda Z. is inset at the lower left because she was absent during the interview.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy E. is from the village of Rizal, Quirino, Isabela. She is 39 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. Daisy owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling vegetables, fruits and fish in the local community. Daisy has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Daisy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daisy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Daisy is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Daisy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ma. Cristy

texts.en:
Ma. Cristy D. is from the village of Kimanait, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Ma. Cristy is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Cristy owns & operates a business selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Ma. Cristy has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ma. Cristy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Cristy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Ma. Cristy is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Ma. Cristy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Campo Verde (Flat) Group

texts.es:
La  señora  María Antonia Gómez P., vive en coapilla estado de Chiapas México, fue casada en donde procreo dos hijos: elariceli  de diecisiete años y francisco Javier de veintidós años de edad y quien cada uno ya están casado.

     Ella  se dedica  a la elaboración de tamales y tostadas con crema , desde hace cuatro años, el cual comenta que le va muy bien desde que inicio con esta actividad ya que hay personas  que le compran sus tamales y tostadas por mayoreo, con lo que ha podido notar que obtiene buenos ingresos en su hogar.

     Cometa que ella decidió hacer este tipo de negocio, para aportar en los gastos de la casa y estar al pendiente de su familia, ya que durante unos años trabajo en casas como empleada domestica para sostener a sus hijos.

    Con la ganancia que obtiene de sus dos negocios compra ingredientes para los tamales, como son maíz, aceite, carne, pasas, y para la tostada la crema, en ello lo vuelve lo vuelve a invertir  para que siga trabajando sin ningún problema, así también pueda ahorrar para pagar el préstamo que fundación realidad a.c le ha otorgado.

     Su sueño de Antonia es que construya una concina de block para que pueda  elaborar su actividad ya que donde lo hace hasta ahora es de tablas y el viento no la deja avanzar. Lo que ella también quisiera es que con esta actividad cambie sus condiciones de vida y pueda salir adelante.
  
     Formo parte del grupo por una promoción que se izo en su pueblo, el cual la representante del grupo Rosaura se intereso y platico con ella para que se integrara a ellas. El grupo se llama campo verde la razón del nombre es porque el lugar donde se ubica el grupo son lomas y planadas de zacate verde.

Los integrantes del grupo campo verde (flat) son las siguientes:

   Antonia Gómez P.: invierte el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de tamales y tostadas.

   Rosaura M. S.: invierte el préstamo para la compra de catálogos de cosméticos como son: perfumes, cremas, esmaltes entre otros.

  Amelia P. T.: invierte el préstamo para la compra de maíz, para elaborar tortillas echas ámanos y venderlo en el mismo pueblo.
texts.en:
María Antonia Gómez P. lives in Coapila in the state of Chiapas, Mexico. She was married and has two children out of that marriage: Elariceli, age 17, and Francisco Javier, age 22. Both are married. Maria has made tamales and toast with cream in bulk for four years. She makes good income from her home. She says that she decided to do this type of business to help out with her household costs and tend to her family. Before, she worked in houses as a maid to support her children. With the earnings from her business she buys ingredients for the tamales, such as corn, oil, meat, and raisins; and for the toast she buys cream. Thus, she re-invests in order to keep working without any problems. This way she is also able to save to repay this loan from Fundacion Realidad A.C. Antonia's dream is to build a solid kitchen so that she can better do her job, since currently she just has planks and the wind does not allow her to progress. She would also like for this job to change her living conditions so that she can get ahead. They made this group because of a promotion in their village. Rosaura is the group representative. They were interested in her and asked her to join them. The group is called Campo Verde ["Green Field"] because in the area the group is located there are hills and spaces of green grass. The members of Campo Verde (flat) are the following: Antonia Gómez P.: will invest the loan in the purchase of ingredients for making tamales and toast Rosaura M. S.: will invest the loan in the purchase of cosmetics catalogues for items such as: perfumes, creams and nail polishes, among other items Amelia P. T.: will invest the loan in the purchase of corn, to make tortillas that she cooks and sells in the same village.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of ingredients to make tamales such as: dough, banana leaf, and dried chilli, among others

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria Cristina se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos, hace más de 9 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de salir adelante. Por lo que no es la primera vez que solicita financiamientos, pues ha sido muy gratificante para ella.  Sus dos hijos están a su cargo han sabido aprovechar los sacrificios que su madre realiza para ellos puedan estudiar.  El lugar donde está ubicada llegan muchos clientes y diariamente llega a ofrecer sus productos. Así con el financiamiento podrá comprar leche, crema, cuajada, queso y otros productos.
texts.en:
María Cristina has sold dairy products for over 9 years.  She is always seeking ways to get ahead and has had previous loans that have been quite gratifying for her.

Her two children who are in her care appreciate the sacrifices their mother does for them so that they can go to school.

The spot where she is located attracts lots of customers that come by daily to buy her products.

She will use the financing to buy milk, cream, cottage cheese, cheese and other items.

loans.use: To buy dairy products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Maria Danelia

texts.es: La señora Maria Danelia, tiene 31 años es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. La señora se dedica al negocio de venta de abarrotería y leña, el cual lo tiene ubicado en su vivienda que está localizado en un municipio llamado apanguera. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 6 años ella se considera una madre trabajadora y emprendedora. Este negocio fue iniciado por la necesidad de sufragar los gastos de su hogar, por lo que no es la primera vez que solicita créditos con Fundación pues han sido de gran ayuda.  El  sueño de Maria es llegar a tener una tienda grande y en la cual pueda vender ropa variada como  zapatos y cosmético todo desde un local bien establecido.
texts.en:
Maria Danelia, 31, is a single mother with two young children. Her business is the sale of groceries and firewood. The business is located in her home, which is a city called Apanguera.

Maria considers herself a hardworking and enterprising mother. She started her business six years ago out of the necessity of providing for the expenses of her household. She has had previous loans with Fundación Leon 2000, which have been a great help.

Maria’s dream is to have a large store where she can sell a variety of clothing, shoes, and cosmetics, all from a well-established location.

loans.use: Working capital for grocery/firewood business.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 53 years old. She is married and has five children between the ages of 16 and 30.  One of her children goes to school.  Her husband works as a farmer. Marie has a shop where she sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, lotions, and biscuits. She has had this business for six years. 

With this loan, Marie will buy more sugar and rice to sell. She will save money from the profit of this business.  Marie believes she has a successful because many people like what she sells. She would like to have a nice looking house in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Khat

texts.en: Khat C., 46, is married and resides with his wife and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. C. is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of about 5 USD per day. His wife produces rice wine, earning an income of 3 USD per day. C. has to spend 20 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity and water supplies, and 25 USD on other necessary expenses every month. C. is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to repair his house. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. C.'s wife appears in the photograph because C. was not available.

loans.use: House repairs

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a single woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

With the Kshs 50,000 loan she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. Priscilla faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to expand and prosper in the future.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions

loans.name: Brigida Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Brígida cuenta con la actividad D. venta D. comida en un kiosco ubicado en la zona D. Achachicala ya lleva varios años con esta actividad con lo que ayuda en los gastos familiares a su esposo,  el crédito que solicito es para la refacción D. su kiosco ya que sufrió un accidente y se quemo parte del mismo, así también su persona también sufrio D. quemaduras  muy leves en las manos, aun así no dejo D. cocinar y seguir con sus actividades para poder cumplir con sus responsabilidades, ella es una cliente antigua desD. la gestión 2007 trabaja con la institución, es una Sra. Muy trabajadora y responsable, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs. Brígida sells food in a kiosk in the Achachicala zone. She has been doing this for several years, and uses this work to help her husband with the household costs. The loan that she is requesting is for the refurbishment of her kiosk, since there was an accident and part of it was burned. She also suffered very slight burns on her hands, but she has not stopped cooking and working in order to fulfill her responsibilities. She is an old customer of this institution and has been working with them since 2007. She is a very hard-working and responsible woman. She is grateful to the institution for the support that they offer.

loans.use: the purchase of material to rebuild her kiosk

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie S. is from the village of Sorosoro, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 47 years old. Tessie is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Tessie owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling snacks and other delicacies like rice cakes and cheese cakes in the local community. Tessie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Tessie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Tessie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a 42 year old mother of three children.  Conchita and her husband have their children to think about and to have reason for living.  They work together for the future of their family.  Conchita is thankful to ASHI for the loans they have provided since 2001.  Conchita has been able to support the maintenance of her fishing operation by purchasing fishing nets and other raw materials for her business.  She is hoping to catch more fish to sell in the future through hard work and continuous assistance of the ASHI and Kiva partnership. 

Her membership in ASHI for a long time gave her a chance to have her own business and to keep her busy.  After starting with an initial loan of 5,000 PHP, she can now avail herself of 28,000 PHP and can even reach the peak amount in the future for she has maintained her excellent performance all though her membership in ASHI.  Therefore, Conchita's wish of growing her fishing business more, with the help of her supportive husband, Felicisimo, who is her business partner, is close to happening because it has grown now, though not yet to the extent she expects. 

Conchita will be glad when her loan request is granted and she utilizes the loan wisely by purchasing additional fishing nets and other fishing materials needed of her fishing ventures. 

When she reaches the highest amount ASHI could offer her to loan, she plans to rent a space in the market where she can sell their fish.  With the opportunity she can get out of her membership in ASHI, she can help send their 3 children to school until they complete a college degree. 

The couple believes that when they pass away, at least they have maD. their business successful and their children can have a business they can own someday.  The couple’s hard work and patience are the foundation for achieving a better life.  

Conchita’s hopes to maintain a long-term sustainable fishing business.  Conchita is very happy to be a Kiva borrower and says thank you for offering financial support to her business endeavor.  She prays that they should be blessed because of their good hearts for the poor people, like her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing nets and other fishing materials needed for her fishing ventures.

loans.name: Juan Alfonso

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Alfonso D. L. C.  T. es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y honesta que ha salido adelante con sacrificios  al lado D. su esposa y sus hijos han sabido invertir en una tienda D. abarrotes que actualmente esta atendiendo  su esposa Minerva mientras que el en su taller repara todo tipo D. lavadoras y refrigeradores, es conocido por mucha gente que lo frecuenta, en esta ocasión a ellos les esta haciendo falta el techo D. lado D. L.  tienda en donD. tienen el taller D. reparación y  así  poner L. losa para que puedan  trabajar en tiempos lluviosos y fríos  y D. esta manera obtener mas ganancias, así  como dar una  mejor calidad a sus clientes, ya que abarca una parte del techo D. L. tienda D. abarrotes, y cuando llueve, ellos temen que se les pueda echar a perder algunos productos D. los que tienen para venta al publico.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Alfonso D. L. C. T. is a very hard working, responsible, honest person who has gotten ahead thanks to sacrifices.  AlongsiD. his wife and children they have known how to invest in a grocery store that his wife, Minerva, currently tends to while he works in his workshop repairing all kinds of washing machines and refrigerators.  He is known by a lot of people who come to him.

They currently lack a roof on the store where they have the repair shop installed.  He will install roofing tiles so that they can work during rainy and cold times thus obtaining more profits as well as proviD. a better quality to their customers since it includes part of the grocery store’s roof and they fear when it rains some of the products they have on sale to the public could spoil.

loans.use: To install the roof.

loans.name: Elvira's Group

texts.en:
Elvira E. is from the village of San Isidro, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 56 years old and the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Elvira is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $206 a month for these activities.

In 2008, she joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Elvira is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 6th loan  from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: John Njoro

texts.en:
John has operated his bicycle-repairs shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.  He is 45 years old. His wife died and now he's left with four children.  

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his fourth loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy spare parts.

In the future, John hopes to grow his repairs shop and also start selling spare parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia M., age 39, earns a living by buying and selling clothing, plastic boots, plastic plates, and bed sheets in her local community. Letecia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. She lives with her husband and their one child in the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. 
 
Letecia has just recently joined HSPFI in order to gain access to financial services. She wants to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Letecia is requesting her first loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional plastic cups and plates to offer for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional plastic cups and plates to offer for sale

loans.name: Andrew S. Bangura Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a Kiva partner in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you the teachers of the RC Primary School from Binkolo village, near Makeni. RC Primary School was founded in September 1980 by the Catholic Mission to educate the pupils of the chiefdom. RC Primary School Binkolo has 33 teachers and 1,036 pupils. The group is applying for its first loan from SMT/Kiva lenders.

Andrew S. B. is the leader of this group of teachers. He is 50 years old and was born in the village of Marampa. Andrew is married and has five children, three of whom are in primary school and two who are in secondary school. With his share of this loan, Andrew will invest in agriculture and will buy rice and palm seeds to plant on his farm.

loans.use: to buy rice and palm seeds to plant

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa T. N. is 38 years old with 2 children. She lives in the hamlet of Dai bi and joined our credit program in 2007. When she received her first loan in the amount of 1,900,000 VND, she invested in opening a small restaurant  serving breakfast items such as noodles, bread and rice soup. Her business has continually grown and created a stable income for her to manage her family's living expenses. Throughout her participation in our credit program, Hoa T. N. has always repaid her loans well. She wants to take out a loan of 8,502,000 VND to buy some cooking appliances.

loans.use: to buy some cooking appliances.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George O. O. is forty years old, married, and has three children between the ages of eleven and one. He hopes to give them a good education to the university level. His business is located at Thika town. Thika is the region in Kenya known for the production of pineapples. 

He sells brake fluid, brake pads, clutches, corner lights and headlights to matatu (minibus) and car owners in Thika. He has been doing this business for two years now. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

George is using this loan of 20,000 KES to buy side mirrors, bumpers, etc. to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. In future, he sees himself owning a big auto parts shop. He dreams of financial comfort in his future. He describes himself as hardworking and responsible.

loans.use: to buy side mirrors, bumpers, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 23 años, es una mujer sociable y trabajadora, vive en su propia morada junto a su  pareja Rubén de 28 años y su querido hijo Jackson de 02 años de edad. Lo que más desea es brindarle una buena educación a su hijo, para lo cual está dispuesta a trabajar arduamente. Los verdes campos del poblado de Santa Rosa, ubicado en la selva tropical del departamento de Ayacucho, han sido en la vida de Gloria un lugar muy agradable para trabajar. Desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor y ahora ella tiene sus propias 03 hectáreas de terreno en las que trabaja con mucho esmero y sacrificio, ahí cultiva cacao, café, barbasco y plátano. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos, lleva 04 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos desde su comunidad hasta los centros de acopio situado en la ciudad de San Francisco. Ahora espera juntar dinero suficiente para comprar nuevas tierras. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. Agradece a los socios de su banco comunal por aunarle al grupo. Con el crédito solicitado comprará materiales para refaccionar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Gloria, 23, is a sociable and hardworking woman who lives in her own dwelling place along with her partner Rubén, 28, and her dear son Jackson who is two. What she wishes for most is to offer her son a good education, for which she is willing to work very hard. The green fields of the population center Santa Rosa, located in the tropical forest of the Ayacucho department, have been in Eulalia's life a very pleasant place to work. From a very early age her parents taught her this work. Now she has her own 3 hectares of land which she works with a great deal of dedication and sacrifice. There she grows cocoa, coffee, barbasco [a plant bearing natural poison used in fishing] and bananas. 

What she most enjoys about her work is the harvest, since it is then that she feels the months of arduous labor have been rewarded with the high quality of her crops. She has been in this business for four years and believes the most difficult aspect is transporting her crops from her community to the collection centers located in the city of San Francisco [Peru]. Now she hopes to put together enough money to buy some new land. This is her first loan with MFP. She knows she is responsible for making all her payments punctually and she is willing to do so. She thanks the members of her communal bank for adding her to the group. With the loan she is seeking she will buy materials for refurbishing her housing.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to refurbish her housing.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: Ramiro es un hombre de 42 años muy dedicado a  “ Taller de servicios Sincro C.” negocio  que por iniciativa de su hermano,  nació cuandodecidieron poner en marcha un taller de sincronizaciòn y arrendaron un local, donde  actualmente ubicados tambien venden  repuestos para vehiculos al mismo tiempo que ofrecen servicios de sincronizaciòn. Asi fuè como lo formalizaron en la Càmara de Comercio de Barranquilla , ellos ademàs de conocer el ofico debieron ubicar proveedores y fortalecer su promoción para lograr sostenerlo. Este es el segundo financiamiento al que aplica en la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, con él comprará repuestos de automoviles como pistones, bujias, anillos, bandas, platinos, zapatillas que le permitan tener un stock de mercancias y mientras genera ingresos por sincronización tambien venda los repuestos que se requieren para dar solución a la buena marcha de los vehiculos .  Su sueño mas adelante es tener un local propio y ampliar su oferta de productos, pero su mayor desafio el capital de trabajo que aun  no es suficiente para hacerlo y esta es la razòn por la cual estàn acudiendo a su credikiva y mientras construye su sueño, continua esforzandose en su trabajo sosteniendo una rotaciòn de sus inventarios de 17 dias.
texts.en:
Ramiro is a 42 year-old man who is very committed to "Taller de servicios Sincro C.", a business that came about through his brother's initiative.  The brothers decided to set up a repair shop and rented the premises in which they currently work.  In addition to carrying out repair work, they also sell vehicle parts.  They made their business official with Barranquilla's Chamber of Commerce.  In addition to knowing their trade well, they had to locate suppliers and strengthen their promotion work in order to support their business.

This is the second loan that Ramiro has applied for through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use it to buy vehicle parts such as pistons, spark plugs, rings, belts, points and brake shoes which will allow him to have merchandise in stock.  While he makes money repairing vehicles, he will also sell the spare parts that are needed to keep vehicles working well.

Ramiro's dream for the future is to own his own premises and expand his product offerings.  However, his biggest challenge is working capital as he doesn't have enough.  This is why he is applying for a Kiva loan.  While he works on achieving his dreams, he continues to work hard in his business, maintaining a stock turnover of 17 days.

loans.use: to buy vehicle parts such as pistons, spark plugs, rings, belts, points and brake shoes

loans.name: Rafia's Group

texts.en:
Rafia is 43 years old and has given birth to three children. Her son sells clothes while her two daughters are students. Her husband has a gram flour [chickpea flour] selling business. It is used in making traditional Punjabi foods called samosas and pakoras and it is also used in the making of sweet dishes. 

Rafia is a seamstress; sewing clothes for her neighbor clients to share the financial burden with her husband. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month. Besides her work, she also carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well. 

Rafia has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband who wants to buy gram flour in larger quantities to sell and increase his earnings. Rafia is very confident that an investment will help him improve the financial condition of his business. She is a regular user of Asasah loans, and this is her third loan application. In previous years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Rafia.

loans.use: to buy gram flour to sell.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es: La señora Florentina tiene 45 años de edad, es casada su esposo trabaja en la mina, y con los ingresos que genera ayuda en los gastos familiares, florentina tiene 7 hijos pero solo dos de ellos están en el colegio, florentina se dedica a vender golosinas por las zonas mas transitadas de la ciudad, viene realizando esta labor por mas de 4 años,el dinero que esta solicitando es para comprar un triciclo mas grande ya que el que tiene actualmente es demasiado pequeño,y con el dinero que le sobre comprar un poco mas de mercadería como gaseosas, galletas,chocolates, entre otros, florentina tiene muchos sueños uno de ellos es con el tiempo tener un kiosko o una bodega donde ofrecer sus productos, florentina esta muy agradecida con la confianza que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Florentina is 45 years old and married.  Her husband works in a mine.  With the income that she makes, Florentina helps cover their family expenses.  She has seven children but only two of them are in school.  

Florentina's business is selling candies in the busiest areas of the city.  She has been in this business for more than four years.  She is requesting this loan to buy a larger three-wheeled cart since the one she has right now is too small.  With the money that she has left, she will buy a little more merchandise such as soda, cookies, chocolates, etc.

Florentina has many dreams.  One of them is, in the future, to open a kiosk or a grocery store where she can sell her products.  She is very grateful for the trust that is being placed in her.

loans.use: to purchase a tricycle as well as cookies, sodas, and chocolates

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is rent.

For the past two years, he has operated a street food business, selling at the market to his neighbors and passersby. He faces the major challenges of seasonality and perishability in his business. His major goal is to establish a restaurant business in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, he wants to purchase more bundles of cereals and coconut for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase more bundles of cereals and coconut to sell

loans.name: Isaya

texts.en:
Isaya is 39 years old and married with eight children between the ages of one and 17. He lives his own permanent house in Hioma, Uganda. For the past five years, Isaiah has been dealing in the poultry business. He started his business with 50 birds but now has 300 birds. Isaya’s main business challenge is the expense of feeding his livestock. However, his business is promising and he wants to have at least 1,000 birds by end of the year.

Isaya is requesting a loan to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed

loans.name: Tomasa Maria

texts.es:
La señora Tomasa Maria es casada, tiene 24 años D. edad, curso el tercer años D. educación básica, tiene 2 hijos 1 D. los cuales está estudiando, se dedica a la producción D. pantalones D. lona,  inicio este negocio como operadora para el negocio D. sus padres y hasta el momento lleva 5 años D. experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se dedica al mismo trabajo.

DeciD. solicitar un préstamo para la ampliación D. capital D. trabajo, ya que va a comprar telas D. loba para poder confeccionar mas pantalones, espera en el futro contar con operarios para su negocio.
texts.en:
Tomasa Maria is 24 years old and married.  She has three years of basic education.  She has two children, and one of them goes to school.

She makes canvas pants.  She started this business as an operator for her parents’ business.  She has five years of experience so far.  She has her husband’s help; he does the same work.

She is requesting a loan to increase her working capital because she is going to buy canvas fabric to be able to make more pants.  She hopes that in the future she will have operators for her business.

loans.use: to buy canvas fabric.

loans.name: Oysamo

texts.ru: Ойсамо проживает в районе Дангары. Ей 35 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Уже два года как Ойсамо занимается торговлей. Она продает парфюмерию и женскую одежду. В основном она ходит по кишлакам и продает свой товар. Кредит берет для покупки тканей.
texts.en: Oysamo lives in the Dangara district.  She is 35 years old, married and has two children.  She has a secondary education and has been involved in retail sales for two years.  She sells perfumery and women's clothing.  She primarily travels to villages and sells her merchandise.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Desarrollo Para El Progreso 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Mauricia is the coordinator of her group "Desarrollo Para el Progreso" 1 & 2 (Development for progress). She is excited to be taking her 6th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for around 3 years, starting when she took her first loan with Esperanza Internacional. This group is taking loans to improve their businesses and their lives. They are located in the urban slums surrounding Samana.

Mauricia has 3 children. They live tranquilly in one of the rural villages around the city of Samana.   The children are studying, and one of the biggest challenges for Mauricia is to help her children to develop and be prepared for their future. She said her favorite activities are attending church and serving to the Lord.

Mauricia makes natural juices.  She will use this loan to buy pineapples, oranges, lemons, cherries, passion fruit, sugar and vanilla. She sells the juice in her house and by the gallon. She thanks all of you for such amazing support!!!

loans.use: to buy fruits.

loans.name: Saydjamol

texts.ru: Сайджамол проживает в районе Восеъ. Ему 53 года. Он женат. У него семеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается развозками. Кроме того он предоставляет услугу, такси. Этим видом деятельности он занимается шесть лет. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en: Saydjamol lives in the Vose district.  He is 53 years old, married and has seven children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Saydjamol is involved in transportation.  Besides this, he also provides a taxi service.  He has been in this business for six years.  Saydjamol is requesting this loan to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Sovoeun

texts.en: Sovoeun is 20 years old and single. She lives with her brothers, sister and widowed father in a village along National Road No. 5 about 20 kilometers outside of Phnom Penh City. Her father makes a living by buying and selling cows, getting them from remote districts and selling them to middlemen who come to buy them at his house. Sovoeun makes a living as a garment worker. She is applying for her first loan, for $1,200, to help expand her father's business by buying more cows to sell. She will also use part of the loan to pay her brother's school fees.

loans.use: to help her father's business and pay school fees.

loans.name: Drocella

texts.en: Drocella sells vegetables and meat. She is a 28-year-old mom. She is married to a charcoal salesman. One of her children goes to school. Drocella has spent eight years in the same business. She wants to renovate her house from the profits that will be obtained from her business. She would like to have a store where she can sell vegetables in bulk so that she can sell to other buyers in big volumes.

loans.use: To buy food products to expand her business.

loans.name: Insa

texts.fr: Monsieur Insa est âgé de 30 ans. C’est un célibataire marchant  ambulant qui pratique la vente d’habits et de divers autres produits. Il vit au Sénégal  depuis plus de 10 ans et a opté pour le petit commerce. Il est sociétaire d’un  guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis aout 2009. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’habits  a revendre. Son objectif est de  développer son activité de  commerce en  cette période de préparation  de la rentrée des classes.  L’augmentation de ses bénéfices lui permettra de mieux subvenir à ses besoins sociaux.
texts.en: Mr. Insa is 30 years old. He is an unmarried travelling salesman who sells clothing and various other products. He has lived in Senegal for more than 10 years and decided to start his small business. He has been a member of a local branch of U-IMCEC since August 2009. He is seeking a loan of 300,000 Frs in order to buy clothing for resale. His goal is to develop his business during the period when students are preparing to re-enter school. The increase in his profits will allow him to better provide for his societal needs.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
El Señor Santiago, tiene  47 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, tiene dos hijos (26 y 28 años) reside en la comunidad rural de Jardines en el Municipio de Taulabe, departamento de Comayagua.

Su actividad económica es la agricultura, específicamente a la producción de viveros de café para la venta en plantía.

Don Santiago ha solicitado su primer préstamo de L.10, 000.00 para la compra de bolsas para vivero y fertilizantes. 

Considera que es un buen negocio ya que sus clientes cada año le demandan mayores cantidades de plantas, sintiéndose motivado a seguir con esta actividad ya que le deja buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Santiago, 47, lives in a common law relationship with his wife and has two children (26 and 28 years old).  He lives in the rural community of Jardines in Taulabe Township, Comayagua Department.  His economic activity is farming, especially coffee nurseries to sell for planting.

Santiago is asking for his first, L10,000, loan to buy bags for the nursery and fertilizer.  He believes that this is a good business because his customers ask for larger numbers of plants each year which motivates him to continue with this activity because it leaves him with good profits.

loans.use: to buy bags and fertrilizer for his nursery.

loans.name: Risa

texts.en:
Risa is married with 2 children.  Risa is 48 years old and lives in Helen Village, Larena, Siquijor.
To earn a living, Risa sells food as a vendor in the market.  She has had this business for 2 years.  Each month, she earns approximately PHP 2,000.00 a month. She has requested a loan of 5000 to buy assorted ingredients for food vending. Risa has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpsose Cooperative for one month.  
In the future, Risa hopes to have money for the future education of her children.

loans.use: To buy assorted ingredients for food vending

loans.name: Wesakulila Group

texts.en:
Peter is the facilitator of the Wesakulila group. Peter and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Peter takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices, to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Peter had an excellent maize yield harvesting nine bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Peter was only able to harvest 1½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Peter and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Peter will repay the loan.

In 2012, the members of Wesakulila group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Peter is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is married with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Violeta is 58 years old and has one child who is in school.

Violeta has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets, paint, and other tools to repair her fishing boat.

Violeta has been in the fishing business for 12 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, paint, and other tools to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Bina

texts.en:
Bina is 44 years old. She is married and has 3 children ages 16, 13 and 10. In 2001, she established her cow's milk selling business. Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy a young milk-giving cow. In the future, Bina plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.  In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young milk-giving cow

loans.name: Peres

texts.en:
Peres is a 38-year-old single mother of two children. She owns a cereals store in her local trading centre. She has been in operation for a period of 10 years, earning a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). She is applying for her first loan with KADET of 30,000 KES. She plans to use the funds to purchase 12 bags of dry maize. With the anticipated profits, she will repay the loan and save. 
She hopes and dreams of improving the living conditions of her family and prospering in business.

loans.use: to purchase dry maize for resale

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva sells one of Ecuador’s most popular seafoods, crab or cangrejo in Spanish. She and her husband have been in this line of work for about 15 years. She learned from her grandfather who was an expert in catching these animals in the muddy waters along the Ecuador coast. In the picture, you can see Eva and her husband in their canoe along the waters surrounding La Isla Trinitaria, a very poor sector of on the outskirsts of Guayaquil.

The loan will be used in order to invest in a motor for the canoe that Eva uses to catch the crab. She will also invest in other seafood products to sell.

Eva and her husband have 4 children, 3 of which are still in school. The oldest son is already in college and works on his own in order to pay for the costs. She lives with her sister in a house she inherited from her mother.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: The loan will be used in order to invest in a motor for the canoe that Eva uses to catch the crab. She will also invest in other seafood products to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Madame Esther sells foodstuffs and vegetables. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She has gone through the TEACH Lending program and knows how to keep accounts for her business. She needs a loan of $650 to expand her business.

loans.use: Woking capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Catherine intends to purchase seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.es:
Osvaldo P. is a widower and the father of two young girls. He has worked from a very young age and once emigrated to Argentina in search of better opportunity. With money he saved up from several years of hard work there he was able to return to Paraguay and open his own business in the municipal market. Thanks to the wide variety of groceries and Osvaldo's close attention the store has grown little by little and now supplies several smaller business in the area. Osvaldo hopes to earn enough money to purchase a home, as he still shares a small, rented house with his two daughters. At this time he finds himself low on inventory so he is asking for a loan of $200 to stock up on popular dairy products like cheese, milk and yogurt.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

El señor Osvaldo P. es viudo y tiene dos hijas. Trabajo desde muy joven en diferentes lugares, viajo a Argentina para buscar mejores condiciones de vida, pero luego de unos años de arduo trabajo y ahorro el pudo volver a Paraguay para abrir su propio negocio. Con sus ahorros montó un almacén en el mercado municipal de la ciudad y nos cuenta que gracias a la variedad de sus productos y su buena atención, el ha logrado crecer de a poco. Hoy día es proveedor de varios negocios más pequeños de la zona; con las ganancias que obtiene planea comprarse una casa pues aún vive con sus hijas en una pequeña casa alquilada. Como la demanda va en aumento el necesita surtir más su negocio, por lo que desea obtener un préstamo de US$ 200 que los invertirá en la compra al por mayor de productos lácteos como queso, leche y yogurt que son los productos de mayor demanda.

loans.use: For wholesale purchase of dairy products.

loans.name: Tafaga

texts.en:
Tafaga F. is a woman of forty-six years of age, currently living at Fagalii-Uta with her kids. Unfortunately, her husband passed away. She is now putting herself together to start up a business to cater for her family's needs. She’s confident in what’s she’s doing even though she struggles a great deal but she’s putting an effort into it.

Tafaga decided to have a plantation because she believes she will earn more money from it. She plans to use her loan from S.P.B.D to buy equipment to use to make her work easier. She sells her goods, e.g., taro, bananas, breadfruits, yams and such at the market. She earns more than a hundred and fifty tala (about US$ 60) a day.

loans.use: To purchase planting equipment

loans.name: Dilbaroy

texts.ru:
Dilbaroy Aminochonova is 42, married and has 2 children. She has a high-school education. Her husband is currently in Russia earning money for the family. Her children help her out with the business after they are done with school for the day. She has been selling groceries for the past 3 years. Over this time she has extensive experience in the field and became a reliable client of MicroInvest. She used to not have a permanent point of sale and had to buy her goods for credit, which significantly reduced the profitability of her business. After becoming a client of MicroInvest her assets increased to $700. She was also able to increase turnover. In the future she is planing to secure a permanent sales location on the central market.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volnuteer

Аминчонова Дилбарой- 42 лет. Замужем, мать 2 детей. Образование среднее. Муж находится в РФ на заработках а дети помогают ей,после учебы в школе. Занимается продажей продуктами питания вот уже 3 года. Наработала достаточный опыт в этой сфере ,чего может показать ее дисциплинированность пред программой МЗФ Микроинвест. Раньше не имела постоянную точку и покупала товар в кредит, что сильно влияло уменьшению дохода. После постоянного кредитования в МЗФ ее активы достигли 700 $ и увеличился товарооборот. В будущем планирует приобрести постоянную точку торговли в центральном рынке.

loans.use: to open another activity place

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel is a selfless mother and since her husband abandoned her more than 10 years ago, has dedicated herself to selling prepared foods in the Túpac Amaru market. Thanks to the delicious stews she makes with the help of her adorable mother, this business has brought much happiness because day by day she obtains more regulars. Ysabel, the mother of 5 children, wishes to expand her business and sell breakfast, lunch, and dinner. She believes this expansion in services will offer better income and thus she asks for a loan to invest in this proposition. This enthusiastic mother is waiting anxiously for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva Volunteer.

Ysabel, es una abnegada madre y desde que su esposo la abandonó hace ya más de diez años se dedica a la venta de comida en el mercado Túpac Amaru, negocio que gracias a los deliciosos potajes que realiza con ayuda de su adorable madre viene generándole mucha alegría porque día a día va obteniendo asiduos clientes.El deseo de Isabel madre de cinco hijos es vender desayuno, almuerzo y cena, ella cree que con esta ampliación de ofertas podría obtener buenos ingresos económicos y solicita un préstamo de dinero a fin de invertirlos en este propósito.En estos momentos esta entusiasta madre espera ansiosa por tu ayuda.

loans.use: To by a larger quantity of products in order to also offer breakfast and dinner to the general public.

loans.name: Joy's Group

texts.en: Joy is a fish monger and seller. With the profits from her business, Joy will buy a fridge, and a bicycle to take the children to school.

loans.use: To buy a bicycle and a fridge

loans.name: Lilis

texts.en: Lilis is a 43-year-old widow whose husband passed away a long time ago. So to earn a living for herself and her 2 children, she sells veils on credit door-to-door, earning about $6 a week. Now, to add to her business capital, she is asking for a loan of $100 so she can expand her business. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: expansion of her little door-to-door sales business

loans.name: Aidee

texts.es:
Thanks to the support her parents provided her, Aidee was able to school and raise her daughters after her husband left them, he not wanting to support their little girls. She set up a small store near the central plaza in her town, and the business earned enough income to cover the household expenses. The room she rents to carry on her sales needs many upgrades and this would be detrimental to the family's finances, ultimately depriving her daughters. Aidee is requesting a loan so that she might invest the funds in the purchase of materials and needed products for her business and to relocate the business to her own house, avoiding the large rent payments.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Gracias al apoyo de sus padres quienes le brindaron los recursos necesarios para que Aidee pueda criar y educar a sus hijas después de sufrir el abandono de su pareja, quien no quiso responsabilizarse de sus pequeñas niñas, instaló una pequeña tienda cerca de la plaza de su localidad, negocio que le brinda ingresos necesarios para solventar los gastos de su hogar, pero el local es alquilado y para mantener sus ventas y ganancias tiene que realizar diversos ajustes económicos en su canasta familiar perjudicando el bienestar de sus hijas. Por ello Aidee solicita un préstamo con el objetivo de invertirlos en la compra de mercadería y productos necesarios para su negocio y la mudanza a su propio domicilio a fin de dejar de pagar las cuantiosas rentas del local.

loans.use: To move her place of business and increase her investments.

loans.name: Un Nuevo Dia 3 Group

texts.es:
Victoria Guadalupe is 30 years old and is married with one child. She belongs to the group “A New Day 3”. With her loan, she will invest in the purchase of basic foods such as rice, sugar, salt, pasta, etc., to supply the small store she runs from her house since in the area where she lives there are no nearby stores. With her business, she can help to meet the locals’ needs as well as help her husband with their living expenses. The other group members include Maria Dolores (clothing sales), Ricarda (food sales), Juliana (fruit and vegetable sales), Adelina Agustina and Maria Asuncion (general store).

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

VICTORIA GUADALUPE TIENE 30 AÑOS, CASADA, UN HIJO. PERTENECE AL GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO UN NUEVO DIA 3. CON SU PRESTAMO INVERTIRA EN LA COMPRA DE ALIMENTOS BASICOS: ARROZ, AZUCAR, SAL, PASTAS, ETC., PARA ABASTECER LA PEQUEÑA TIENDA QUE TIENE EN SU CASA, YA QUE POR DONDE VIVE NO HAY TIENDAS CERCANAS Y CON ESTE NEGOCIO AYUDARA A SATISFACER UNA NECESIDAD DE LA GENTE DE SU LOCALIDAD Y PARA SI MISMA YA QUE DE ESTA FORMA APOYARA A SU ESPOSO CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR. LAS DEMAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO: MARIA DOLORES (VENTA DE ROPA), RICARDA (VENTA DE ALIMENTOS), JULIANA (VENTA DE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS), ADELINA AGUSTINA Y MARIA ASUNCION (TIENDA DE ABARROTES).

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of basic foods.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene is a hardworking mother. Her desire to improve the quality of life for her family led her to start a business selling backpacks and suitcases to the people in her small town. She got the idea when somebody she knew who made the suitcases offered her a small number of them to offer to her friends. Now three years have passed and business is going well. In the future, she would like to produce her own backpacks and suitcases, so she is requesting a loan so that she can grow her small business and increase her earnings.

Doña Irene, es una mujer luchadora y esforzada, sus deseos de superación la han llevado a desempeñarse efectivamente en el negocio de venta de mochilas escolares y maletines para las personas que habitan su pequeño pueblito. Esta idea comenzó cuando uno de sus familiares que fabrica estos artículos le ofreció una pequeña cantidad de estos para ofertarlos entre sus amigos y hoy han transcurrido 3 años de satisfacción. A futuro piensa tener su propia fábrica de mochilas y maletines, mientras tanto seguirá abasteciéndose de mercadería para lo cual solicita un crédito a fin de seguir desarrollando su labor.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO INVEST IN MORE VARIETY OF BACKPACKS AND SUITCASES TO SELL TO HER CUSTOMERS.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en: Svetlana M. is a 40 year old woman who sells milk in the Bilasuvar Internally Displaced Persons Settlement. She has more than 10 years of experience selling milk. Svetlana is married and has 3 children. Beside this business, she is also working in one of the local stores as a salesperson. However, her main source of income is selling milk and her salary as a salesperson is very meager, approximately 30 USD per month. Svetlana is requesting a 700 USD loan to purchase one milk cow. Expanding her business will help Svetlana to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase one milk cow

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita belongs to the communal bank “Mujeres Valientes” (“Brave Women”), located in the Calleria district of Ucayali. She is 44 years old and the mother of three children, but her income is very low and not enough to support the family financially. It’s for this reason that Margarita, with her first loan of S/. 300 from Manuela Ramos, decided to invest in a business selling sweets.

Currently, she has a small store where she sells a variety of items. The business is located in her own home. She gets up at 7 am to make breakfast for her children. With this loan of S/. 2,000, to be repaid over a period of four months, she bought cookies, gum, candies and other snacks.

With her small earnings, Margarita helps with the household expenses and at the same time supports her children in their educations. She is glad to have the support that Manuela Ramos provides for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Margarita pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr Eduardo del Aguila 455, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 44 años y es madre de 3 hijos, pero sus ingresos económicos son muy bajos y no le alcanzan para sus gastos familiares, es así que Margarita con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de venta de golosinas. En la actualidad ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega donde vende diversas golosinas, negocio ubicado en su propia casa. Ella se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compro galletas, chicles, caramelos, y otras golosinas. Margarita con las pocas ganancias que obtiene de su negocio ayuda en los gastos de su hogar y a la vez a apoya a sus hijos en los estudios, se siente feliz con el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of candy/sweets at wholesale.

loans.name: Irma Yolanda

texts.en:
Irma Yolanda M. is a hardworking woman of 24 years old. She is married and has one son, but very soon will have a second. She used to work only raising chickens but now has a small business selling gold jewelry. She travels to sell her jewelry and her business has done well. Her desire is to buy more merchandise but she doesn’t have enough capital. Her husband works sewing sweaters and she helps him in that business in her free time. Irma Yolanda is very grateful to God and FAPE for granting her this business and the loan will help her expand it. She dreams of having a store in the market to sell from, as she cannot sell from her home because she lives in a remote area.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Montgomery, Kiva Fellow.

La señora Irma Yolanda M. es una mujer muy trabajadora de de 24 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo y muy pronto va a tener el segundo, se dedicaba solo a la crianza de pollos, ahora tiene un pequeño negocio de vender joyas de oro, es un negocio ambulante y le ha ido muy bien por lo que su deseo es comprar mas mercadería pero no tiene el capital suficiente; su esposo se dedica a tejer suéteres y ella en su tiempo libre ayuda a su esposo a la elaboración de suéteres esta muy agradecida con Dios y con FAPE por concederle ese negocio y un préstamo que le ayudará a ampliar su negocio de joyería su sueño es tener un local en el mercado y poner una tienda para vender porque en su casa no puede ella vive muy retirado del centro del pueblo.

loans.use: To buy more gold jewelry to sell

loans.name: Maria Lorena

texts.es:
Maria Lorena lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood, is married, and has 2 beautiful children who are 12 and 16. They are studying, one in primary school and one in secondary school. Her husband works on a farm in a rural area. Maria Lorena sells food and works hard to provide her children with what they need so they don't lack anything. She has sold food for four years. She started with her own funds and with help from her husband. She has an established clientele who like the delicious dishes she prepares. She dedicates a lot of time to this since there is a variety of food and the dishes are different every day. The money she is requesting is to improve the infrastructure on her home by purchasing rafters and metal to replace her roof, which is in bad shape.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Maria Lorena habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, es casada y tiene dos hermosos hijos de 12 y 16 años de edad. Ellos están estudiando, uno en la primaria y el otro en secundaria, su esposo trabaja en una finca en una zona rural. Maria Lorena vende comida y trabaja duro para proveerles a sus hijos lo que necesiten y que no les falte nada, tiene cuatro años en las ventas de comida, e inicio con fondos propios y con ayuda de su esposo. Ya tiene su clientela establecida que gustan de los deliciosos platos que prepara, para eso dedica mucho tiempo ya que la comida es variada y son diferentes platillos todos los días. Con el dinero que esta solicitando es para mejoras de infraestructura en la compra de perlines y zinc para reparar el techo ya que esta en mal estado.

loans.use: To replace the roof on her house

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan Q. is 23 years old and he is already the young father of an adorable daughter. He says he loves her more than life and does all possible to make her future as happy as he can.

Ruslan's main business activity is selling mobile phones. He has four years of experience in this field. Ruslan is a very polite man and professional in selecting mobile phones for every taste of every client.

His income is just enough to cover family needs, but to expand his business he need more sources of income. As the mobile store is the only financial source for his family Ruslan has decided to expand the scope of his business and for this purpose he has applied for $US1,200. Ruslan thanks everyone who supports him and his family.

loans.use: To expand the scope of his mobile phone business.

loans.name: Mrs. Nay Yong Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nay Y. was selected by fellow members to be the group leader of five women in Tumnob Leu Village in Kampong Cham Province who are requesting a group loan. Mrs. Nay Y. is 34 years old, and the mother of two children: one is enrolled at the local school and the other is only three months old. Mrs. Nay Y. is a recycling collector who gathers or buys empty bottles, cans, and plastics and then resells them to a recycling factory. Her business is going well, and she would like to expand it. Her husband, Mr. Khen Khem, is a farmer.

All the members in her group loan have end-of-term loans (EoT), which means they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. This type of loan is AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term, and almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy bottles, cans, and plastics to resell to a recyling factory.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Mrs. Edna D., 32 years old and married, originally lived in Macalibre Alto, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. At present their family has moved to Miputak, Dipolog City and started up their "lechon" (roasted pig) business.  

As they are blessed with 5 children, their income can hardly meet the demands of everyday living. "Lechon" is well-known among Filipinos because of its delectable taste and can be served for all occasions. These are the very reasons why they took up the "lechon" business. Beating the odds like no existing clients and new to the community, the difficulty of obtaining capital is truly a mountain to survive.  And so, aside from "lechon" orders, they also cater "lechon" roasting where customers only pay for the labor.

Edna joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in 2005 at the Plaridel Branch and later on transferred her membership to the Dipolog Branch because of their desire to start up their own business in the city. They rented a space for PHP 3,000 monthly and crossed their fingers that their "lechon" business would be a success. Paglaum MPC serves to help them access additional capital.  Recently, they have requested PHP 14,000. 

Mrs. D. plans to acquire land for a business site and expand their "lechon" business into other areas. She also wants to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase 5 pigs and firewood

loans.name: Arina

texts.ru: Ким Арине  47 лет, живёт она одна. Арина  торгует на рынке  специями несколько лет. Арина решила расширить свой ассортимент и также решилась торговать парфюмерией.  В этом же магазине у нее есть партнер по бизнесу, который кроме торговли приправами  занимается также  скотоводством. Он рассказал Арине о выгодных условиях кредитования в Микроинвест и посоветовал получить кредит на скот. Она обратилась в Микроинвест и получила кредит, но  у нее негде держать скот, для этого Насим-ако (ее партнер по бизнесу) согласился держать и ее скот у себя в коровнике. Также он помогает  Арине  ухаживать за скотом, а она в своё время  оплачивает  его труд.
texts.en:
Arina K. is 47 years old, and she lives alone. She has been selling spices at a market for several years. She decided to increase the assortment of her inventory and start selling fragrances. In the same shop, Arina has a business partner, who in addition to selling spices, is also in a business of selling livestock. He was the one who told her about MicroInvest and suggested her to obtain a loan for new livestock business. She came to MicroInvest and got a loan; however, she doesn't have any space for livestock. For this reason, her partner, Nasim-aka, agreed to keep and take care of the livestock as long as Arina pays him a fee.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Ulices

texts.es:
Ulices es socio del Bancomunal Fuerza y Poder. 
Ulices es conviviente  tiene 42 años, tres hijos de 22, 15 y 9 su hijo mayor estudian en la universidad y  los menores en el colegio. Ulices comenzó vendiendo  pollo, por varios años, pero vio mucha competencia y decidió retirarse de ese negocio con el capital que había juntado se compro una couster se asocio con varios amigos y fundaron una empresa de trasporte “Unidad de Villa”  pusieron varias rutas, pero él trabaja en la ruta W, actualmente es chofer de su propia custer, le gusta su trabajo y piensa seguir hasta que las fuerzas le den. 
Necesita un préstamo de 800 soles para comprar los repuestos de su trasporte y hacerle mantenimiento a su custer. 
En Finca se siente respaldado, ante cualquier imprevisto con los ahorros que se hace en el Bancomunal y con los prestamos que dan, le gustan las reuniones a pesar que la mayoría son mujeres, aprende de las charlas que dan sobre como llevar una empresa y darle mejor atención al cliente.
El sueño de Ulices es comprar carros más moderno para la empresa, que sean a gas por que es más económico.
texts.en:
Ulices is a member of the Community Bank "Strength and Power". Ulices lives with his partner and is 42 years old. He has three children aged 22, 15 and 9: his eldest son is studying at University and the younger two are at school. Ulices began by selling chicken, for several years, but he saw that there was a lot of competition and so decided to retire from this business and with the capital he had managed to save he bought a minibus, joined with several friends and founded a transport company "Town Unity" running various routes, but he works on route W. He is now driver of his own minibus, he likes his work and wants to carry on as long as he has strength to do so. With Finca he feels protected from any unforeseen circumstance because of the savings which he puts in the Community Bank and with the loans which they give. He likes the meetings despite the fact that the majority of attendees are women, and he has learnt from the talks that they give how to improve a business and how to give better service to his customers. Ulices' dream is to buy more modern vehicles for the business, that run on cheaper gas.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He needs a loan of 800 soles in order to carry out repairs and maintence on his minibus

loans.name: Qaliba

texts.en:
Qaliba K. is 33 years old, married and has three children. For 8 years Qaliba has dedicated herself to raising and selling cattle, a job that brings economic stability to her family. It is for her family that she works and struggles day in and day out. Her son helps her with the business.
