She’s asking for a loan of $1200 to invest in her business and buy two more cattle. A successful business will allow her to save enough money so she can provide better life to her children. Qaliba is committed to responsibly repaying the loan within 15 months. With your help, Qaliba can accomplish her dream very soon.

loans.use: to purchase two calves

loans.name: Jura

texts.ru: Абдуллоев Джура проживает  вгороде Яван. Живет очень далеко от центра. Семья большая . Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Кроме того, он живет с родителями и братом. Для того, чтобы обеспеспечить свою семью, работает в сфере животноводства. Разводит крупно-рогатый скот. Обратился к нам за кредитом для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
Jura A. lives in Yavan. He lives very far from the city center. Jura has a large family. He is married with two children and also lives with his parents and brother. In order to provide for his large family, Jura works in livestock breeding. He is applying for a loan in order to purchase more livestock. He would be able to pay off the loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en:
Amanda B. is 54 years old and a widow with 6 children. Her two youngest children help her with household expenses since her husband died ten years ago. Her business is selling tortillas and selling firewood out of her home, but she also sells some on the street with the help of a few people. Amanda belongs to a solidarity group of women and has a small loan with the group, but is requesting an individual loan as well in order to invest more in her business and to increase her sales and earnings. Amanda’s dream is to see her business grow and to provide a better future for her children.  


***********************************************************************
Translated by Andrea Bouch, Kiva Fellow
***********************************************************************


Amanda B. es viuda tiene 54 años de edad y 6 hijos. Los dos hijos mas pequeños son los que le ayudan con los gastos de la casa ya que su esposo murio hace diez años. Su negocio es venta de tortillas y venta de leña en su casa, pero tambien sale a vender a la calle ya que tiene dos personas que le ayudan a tortiar y a vender la leña, ella pertenece a un banco de mujeres de confianza. El prestamo lo solicita porque necesita invertir mas en su negocio para poder vender mas y tener mas ganancia. Su sueño es ver su negocio mas grande y a sus hijos con un mejor futuro.

loans.use: Purchase of bulk ingredients for tortilla production

loans.name: Adeshola

texts.en: Adeshola is 43 years old and married with four children. She sells chewing sticks to her customers. The demand for chewing sticks is high, and she hopes to meet the demand of her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan of $350 to purchase more chewing sticks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more chewing sticks to sell

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en: Mrs. Eleonor T. has been an active member of Paglaum MPC for 2 years. She is married and blessed with two kids; one of them is studying. She is engaged in raising pigs. Her husband's economic activity is in driving a motorcycle for hire. She has already availed of several loans in the co-op and now has also availed of another loan to purchase additional piglets to raise, hoping that through this activity, she can help her husband to provide for the financial needs of their kids.

loans.use: The purchase of piglets

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia A. is 36 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters. She says all are currently in the senior high and primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a maize farmer. Patricia is a food vendor. She prepares and sells ‘banku’. Banku is a local dish from corn dough. It is served hot with soup. She sells the food on the street in the mornings. She procures bags of maize and other ingredients from nearby towns. Patricia also trades in palm oil. She has been in business for one year and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk. She is hoping to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize in bulk.

loans.name: Davron

texts.ru: Даврон - молодой мужчина 1979 года рождения. Женат и отец 1-го ребенка. Даврон занимается производством лепешки а его жена продает их на рынке "Панчшанбе". Даврон закупает муку у оптовиков в запас, чтобы застраховать себя, если завоз муки на время приостановится. У Даврона есть свои постоянные клиенты, которые берут лепешки под реализацию и рассчитываются сразу после реализации. Даврон кредитуется у нас с 2007 года. Он всегда целенаправленно использует свой займ. Даврон очень благодарен нашей организации за поддержку малого бизнеса населения.
texts.en:
Davron is a young man who was born in 1979. He is married and is the father of 1 child. Davron makes flatbread and his wife sells it at the “Panchshanbe” market. Davron purchases flour from wholesalers in advance in order to provide insurance for himself in case the flour supply stops temporarily. Davron has his own regular customers who take flatbread for resale and pay him right after they sell it. Davron has been our borrower since 2007. He always uses his loans purposefully. Davron is very grateful to our organization for our support of the population’s small businesses.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Flatbread

loans.name: Sheyla Dinorah

texts.es: Doña Sheyla P. mujer trabajadora que desde muy joven inicio su jornada de trabajo, su negocio es la venta de ropa, cosméticos y prenda son siete años en las ventas el cual inicio para tener sus propios ingresos. Tiene 31 años de edad, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, su esposo es jefe del departamento de policía y tiene dos hijos uno de 9 y otro de 1 año. Este crédito lo va invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer remodelación a su cocina, como repellar las paredes, cambiar el pantry. Sus planes a futuro es poder alquilar un cuarto para obtener otros ingresos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sheyla P. is a hard working woman that started to work since she was very young. She has been selling cosmetics and clothing for seven years. She is 31 years old, resides in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the city of Managua ,and started this business to have her own income Her husband is chief of the police department and they have two sons who are 9 and a 1 year old. This loan will be invested in the purchase of building materials to remodel her kitchen, rebuild walls, change the pantry. Her plans for the future are to rent a room to have an extra income.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tu buy building materials

loans.name: Celine

texts.en:
Celine was born in 1948 and is married to Fru Jacob N.. They are blessed with nine children, and they have three grandchildren younger than 15. She lives in Musang, Bamenda, Cameroon.

Celine's husband is old and ill. She has to be vigilant about feeding and cleaning him and giving him his medication on time. This is a serious duty which does not allow her to extend her activities too far from home. Egusi and firewood sales have been her main business activities since she joined GHAPE in October 27, 1998. She peels egusi seeds and sells them both in wholesale and in retail. She is one of the founding beneficiaries in GHAPE. With her previous loans she succeeded in providing her community with egusi and dry firewood.

If she is given this tenth loan, she plans to buy a transportation motorbike and well as stocking up on egusi and firewood. Her son will be providing transportation on the motorbike. She will also re-invest part of the profit into her business for expansion and she will pay school fees for her children. She will also use part of her profit for food, clothing, and paying hospital bills.

About the Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE):

GHAPE is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works toward the empowerment of the poor and provides poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase a transportation motorbike and to buy egusi and firewood for sale

loans.name: Sochida

texts.ru: Сочида Курбонова проживает в Гиссарском районе. Возраст 35 лет. Вдова, имеет 2 детей. Сочида более 5 лет занимается торговлей на центральном рынке. Она в основном торгует сухофруктами. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Sochida K. lives in the Gissar region. She is 35 years old. She is a widow and has two children. Sochida has been doing retail business in the central market for more than five years. She mostly sells dry fruits. She is asking for a loan to increase turnaround.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnaround

loans.name: Lydgin

texts.en: Lydgin B. is from the village of Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old and is married. Lydgin owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Lydgin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en:
Magreth is a member of the Pangani borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 35 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 20,15 years.

Magreth started her own grocery business selling beer,soda 10 years ago,she works 15 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Magreth`s First loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 250,000 Tsh in order to buy more Soda and beer.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Magreth hopes to save money,pay school fees ad expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more beer,soda

loans.name: Kivukui

texts.en: Kivukui M. is a 35-year-old married father of three children. He lives with his family in Shanzu, Mombasa, where he uses his motorbike to operate a transport service. He has been in this service for the last five years. His wife Betty is 28 years old and is a businesswoman in Shanzu. Kivukui is borrowing his first loan from KADET and, with the money, he plans to service his motorbike and to open up a café in the same area of Shanzu where most of his clients are. He hopes to own a fleet of motorbikes in future and to also diversify his business by opening a hotel. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To service his motorbike and to start a café

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
La señora Gumercinda es socia del Banco Comunal “Cuturapi” del centro poblado de Cuturapi del Distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia del Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 45 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene 8 hijos (3 a su cargo), vive en Cuturapi  Barrio Tupac Amaru y tuvo la oportunidad  de estudiar.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 5 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de alfombras.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar alfombras de todo tamaño los trae directamente de Lima y  los cuales los distribuye en Puno y Juliaca.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando en su negocio.

A ella le  gustan  la armonía y la puntualidad de las socias.
texts.en:
Sra. Gumercinda is a member of the Communal Bank “Cuturapi”, which is located in the central village of Cuturapi in Yunguyo District, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 45 years old, married, and has 8 children (3 are still dependents). Gumercinda lives in the Cuturapi neighborhood of Tupac Amaru. She had the opportunity to attend school.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 5 years. Her first loan of 300 soles enabled her to increase her business capital for buying and selling rugs.

Gumercinda is requesting a new loan of 1500 soles so that she can buy rugs of all sizes. She brings them directly from Lima and then sells them in Puno and Juliaca. Her greatest wish is to continue working at her business. She enjoys the group harmony and the punctuality of the Communal Bank members.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rugs

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga tiene 54 años, vive en su casa propia con sus 4 hijos. Desde hace 4 años se viene dedicando a la venta de ropa y hace 6 meses incorporó la venta de calzado, que es lo que más ha vendido en los últimos meses. Para comprar su mercadería, mensualmente viaja a la ciudad capital (Lima), donde obtiene sus artículos al por mayor.
Dominga disfruta de su negocio, ya que esto le permite generar los ingresos económicos que necesita, además las prendas de vestir siempre tienen demanda

Esta es la quinta oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos durantes sus préstamos anteriores y se compromete a seguir siéndolo. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más zapatos al por mayor en su próximo viaje a Lima.
texts.en:
Dominga is 54 years old and lives in her own home with her 4 children. She has been selling clothes for 4 years, but added shoes to her inventory 6 months ago and has been selling more of them in recent months. To acquire her merchandise, Dominga travels on a monthly basis to Lima where she can purchase items in bulk. She enjoys her work and her business enables her to generate the income that she needs because clothing is always in demand.

Dominga is requesting her 5th loan with MFP. She has been very punctual with the payments from her previous loans and promises to continue in the same manner. The money she is requesting will be used to purchase shoes in larger quantities during her next trip to Lima.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes

loans.name: Lidia Lili

texts.es: Lidia Lili es una socia trabajadora y optimista, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 61 años, vende todos los días desde muy temprano de la mañana, tamales y frejol cocinado,  su kiosco funciona en la vereda de su casa.  Ella es madre de un hijo  mayor de edad. Su esposo es mecánico soldador. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “María Montessori” desde hace nueve años, donde siempre se ha caracterizado por su dinamismo y puntualidad. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue utilizado para comprar pollos y luego venderlos, en la actualidad Lidia necesita un crédito de 1600 soles, que será utilizado para comprar pollos y venderlos en éstas fiestas navideñas. La meta de Lidia es tener una fuente de soda. Además agregó que esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos porque gracias a los prestamos, ella pudo construir su casa.
texts.en:
Lidia Lili, 61, has been a hard-working, optimistic, member of the “María Montessori" communal bank for the past 9 years. She has always been known for her dynamism and punctuality. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. Every day, from very early in the morning, she sells tamales and cooked black eye beans. She has her vending stall in her yard. She is the mother of one adult son. Her husband is a welder. Her first, 300 sol loan, was used to buy chickens for resale. Lidia now needs 1,600 soles to buy chickens to sell during the Christmas season. Lidia's goal is to have a soda fountain. She added, also, that she is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past loans granted that allowed her to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Kokobeh Group

texts.en:
Here are Magret F., Aminata C., Salamatu D., Ramatu S. and M’Balu S.. They are small scale entrepreneurs in the township of Magburaka, in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 2,500,000.00 (or SLL 500,000.00 each) to enable them to add more goods to their businesses. In this way, they will be able to make more sales and better profit. Consequently, they can better support their children in terms of feeding, clothing and academic pursuits.

Magret F., who is in the middle, is the leader of this group. She was born in Magburaka town about thirty-seven years ago. Magret is married with two children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending school – one is in senior secondary school III (SSS III) and the other is in Primary IV. Magret has been a businesswoman for fifteen years. She sells oil, flour and rice. She also sells fried food in one of the schools in Magburaka town. She will use this loan to buy gallons of vegetable oil, bags of flour and rice.

loans.use: To buy gallons of oil, bags of flour and rice.

loans.name: Leana Teresa

texts.es: Leana tiene 36 años, por lo que es una mujer muy alegre y a le gusta dedicarse a su negocio. Ella tiene 2 hijos a su cargo en la actualidad por lo que no es fácil mantener el pago del colegio sus hijos y ella se esfuerza por ofrecerles esta oportunidad. Su actividad económica es una variedad de productos, por lo que ella se dedica a ofrecer sus productos en las afueras de un dispensario y esto le proporciona muchos clientes. Ella es un buen ejemplo de mucho trabajo para sus hijos. Por lo que ella sueña que sus hijos finalicen sus estudios para que ella pueda gozar de sus éxitos. El financiamiento es destinado para la compra de gaseosas, pan, galletas, jugos, refrescos naturales entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Leana is 36 years old and a very cheerful woman who enjoys working at her business. She cares for two children, but in these times it is not easy to keep up with paying for their schooling, yet she strives to give them this opportunity. Her economic activity involves many products, which she sells outside of a clinic, and this gets her business a lot of customers. Leana is a good example of working hard for one's children. She dreams that they will finish their studies and that she will be able to enjoy their successes. This loan will be used for the purchase of sodas, bread, crackers, juices, and natural soft drinks, among other products.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es: La señora MARIA MARGARITA P. tiene 39 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES AL ÉXITO II. La socia presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos de los cuales 1 depende económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra en especial de fierro, el cual lleva Lima a vender. Este es su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles que lo utilizará para comprar mayor cantidad de fierro al por mayor para que pueda aumenta su ganancia. Ella sueña con poder enviar fierro a Lima una vez por semana para así generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Margarita P. is 39 years old. She lives in the Trujillo district, Trujillo province, state of La Libertad, in Peru. She belongs to the Mujeres al Exito II communal bank. She completed school through her 5th year of secondary school. She is a single mother with two children, one of whom she supports. Her business is buying and selling scrap metal, especially iron, which she takes to Lima to sell. This is her first loan for 300 soles which she will use to buy larger quantities of iron wholesale so that she can increase her earnings. She dreams of being able to send iron to Lima once weekly in order to be able to generate higher income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of iron scrap

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is fifty years old. She is a widowed mother of five children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. 

Vida sells maize and onions. She buys bags of maize from nearby communities and sells them to food vendors and retailers in her community. She also treks to other towns to sell. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Marlyna

texts.en:
Marlyna B. is from the village of Gitagum, Misamis Oriental. She is 29 years old. Marlyna is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marlyna owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Marlyna has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Marlyna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlyna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Marlyna is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Marlyna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Racheal Waturi

texts.en:
Racheal is 35 years old and is married with three children. Her husband, Stephen, is a businessman and they live in Ruaka, an upcoming center in the outskirts of Nairobi. Racheal has put up her tailoring shop in Ruaka trading center.

Racheal was introduced to KADET by her friends with whom she formed a group. They joined KADET so that they could access loans for their businesses. Racheal has never borrowed from other sources and this is her first loan with KADET. The loan she has applied for she will use to buy more materials for her tailoring business.

Racheal hopes to grow her business so that she can become a supplier of materials on a wholesale basis.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials

loans.name: Emiola

texts.en:
Emiola is a happy, hard working woman. She is always happy when her customers come in to purchase medicines. She has been in this business for a long time. She sells daily from 7am to 7pm. She is itching for expansion in her business. She hopes for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. 

She hopes to own a maternity home in the future. She is 35 years old and is married with 2 children. Her children attend school. To support the household, her husband sells electronics. 
She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Natanael Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA  NATANAEL, EN HONOR AL SANTO PATRON DEL PUEBLO   “SAN BARTOLO” CONOCIDO EN NAHUATL  COMO NATANAEL.

ESTA HUBICADO EN LA COMUNIDAD DE SAN BARTOLO COHUECAN EN EL ESTADO DE PUEBLA EN MEXICO, MUY CERCA DE LOS LÍMITES CON EL ESTADO DE MORELOS. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 12 INTEGRANTES Y ES LA PRIMERA VEZ QUE SOLICITAN UN CREDITO A CREDICOMUN.

EVA S. V. ES LA TESORERA DEL GRUPO.TIENE 31 AÑOS Y SOLO ESTUDIO LA PRIMARIA, ES ALFARERA Y TIENE 3 HIJOS (1 MUJER DE 10 AÑOS Y DOS VARONES DE 16 Y 5 AÑOS. ELLA SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE ALFARERIA DESDE LOS 11 AÑOS Y YA LLEVA 20 AÑOS DEDICANDOSE A LA ALFARERIA, YA QUE ES UNA TRADICION FAMILIAR,  SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA PODER COMPRAR MATERIA PRIMA  QUE UTILIZA, COMO EL BARRO, LEÑA, GRIETA Y COLORANTES.  SU SUEÑO ES QUE SUS HIJOS SEAN PROFESIONISTAS Y QUE TENGAN UNA MEJOR  VIVIENDA, YA QUE  HACE  ALGUNOS AÑOS SU TECHO ERA DE LAMINA DE CARTON Y AHORA ES DE CONCRETO GRACIAS A LAS GANANCIAS DE SU NEGOCIO LA HA MEJORANDO.

EL NOMBRE DE LAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPOS SON:

DULCE MARIA A. G. VENDE PAN
MARIA TOMASA G. G. VENDEN PAN
MARIA TERESA M. V.  SE DEDICA A LA ALFARERIA
CLAUDIA A. D.  SE DEDICA A LA ALFARERIA
FLORENCIA V. P. SE DEDICA A LA ALFARERIA
CARMELA M. R. SE DEDICA A LA ALFARERIA
CRISPINA E. L. SE DEDICA A LA ALFARERIA
JOSEFINA P. O. SE DEDICA A LA ALFARERIA
GUILLERMINA A. A. SE DEDICA A LA ALFARERIA
MARIA ISABEL P. V. SE DEDICA A LA ALFARERIA
MARIA CLAUDIA D. G. SE DEDICA A LA ALFARERIA
texts.en:
This group's name is Natanael, in honor of the patron saint of their town, "San Bartolo," known in Nahuatl as Natanael. The group is located in the community of San Bartolo Cohuecan in the state of Pueblo, Mexico. It is very close to the border with the state of Morelos. The group is made up of 12 members, and this is the first time they are requesting a loan from Credicomun. Eva S. V. is the treasurer of the group. She is 31 years old and has only had an elementary level education. She is a potter and has 3 children, (a 10-year old daughter, a sixteen-year old son and a 5-year old son). She started making her living making pottery when she was 11 years old and has been doing so for 20 years; it is a family tradition. She is requesting the loan to purchase the raw materials she uses, like mud, wood, coloring agents and other supplies. Her dream is that her children become professionals and have a better dwelling, since a few years ago their ceiling was made of sheets of cardboard. It is now made of concrete; thanks to the earnings from her business, they have improved it. The names of the members of the group are: Dulce Maria A. G. sells bread. Maria Tomasa G. G. sells bread. Maria Teresa M. Velazques makes her living making pottery. Claudia A. D. makes her living making pottery. Florencia V. P. makes her living making pottery. Carmela M. R. makes her living making pottery. Crispina Espana L. makes her living making pottery. Josefina P. O. makes her living making pottery. Guillermina A. A. makes her living making pottery. Maria Isabel P. Vazques makies her living making pottery. Maria Claudia D. G. makes her living making pottery.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials like mud, wood, dyes and other supplies.

loans.name: Thamara

texts.en:
Thamara is a 38-year-old married lady living in Kekanadura, Matara area, with her husband and three daughters. Her husband is an army soldier and her children are still studying.

Thamara has a cinnamon garden in which she grows cinnamon to supplement the family's income to help pay daily expenses. She started her business four years ago. Her husband helps her when he is free during his vacation time. Thamara is hardworking and aims to do everything related to the business with strong dedication.

Thamara has asked for a 40,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka. She plans to buy new cinnamon plants and expand her cinnamon garden.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy more cinnamon plants

loans.name: Laura

texts.en: Laura is a 42 year-old woman who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with her husband and their four children. Laura has a grocery store selling candies, canned food, beverages, chips, biscuits etc. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to expand and diversify her merchandise according to her customers' needs. This is her third loan cycle and she has always paid on time. Laura decided to start her business because she wanted to supplement her husband’s income, and also because she likes trading. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. She plans to keep on improving and expanding her store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene K. N. is forty-two years old. She is married and they have three children for whom they hope to provide quality education. They also want to teach them how to run a business so that they can learn about self-employment, especially with the current situation of job scarcity in Kenya. 

Her business is located near a garage in a busy area in Thika. She has a hotel in which she serves her customers rice, chapati, githeri (a mixture of maize and beans) and other types of local meals. Her business is known by the name Zebra Hotel, although it is actually a restaurant. Mostly she serves the mechanics working at the garage in the area. She says the business is very profitable but the major challenge she has is that the place does not have proper sanitation. 

She is using her 20,000 KES loan to buy foodstuffs to make meals for her customers, hence serving more people and therefore getting a better income. She is innovative, patient and hardworking.

loans.use: Flour, beans, rice.

loans.name: Ta-Ram Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Ta-Ram” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 800,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Masiray K.. Masiray is 35-year-old and she was born in Lunsar, a small town in northern Sierra Leone. She is married with two children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary schools.  For ten years now, Masiray has been selling market food: palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), Maggie (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, onions, etc. With this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, Maggie, salt, onions, etc.

loans.name: Yuliya

texts.en:
Yuliya is married with an 18-year-old daughter. Yuliya lives in Energodar and sells seeds, agricultural chemicals and other farming products in the central market of her home town. She owns a big vending location and is an experienced vendor who offers a reasonable pricing policy to her customers. She has learned many tricks of her trade in the past eight years.

Currently, Yuliya has already invested 80,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her turnover amounts to 30,000 Grivnyas. Net profit is about 8,000 Grivnyas a month.

Yuliya is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise, like fertilizers and seeds, for the upcoming farming season. She can quickly respond to different new trends in her business which, in addition to high demand on these types of product, has benefited her venture.

This client has big potential and is full of business ideas and projects. Yuliya is hoping to generate sufficient income to re-invest it in further expansion of the range of items she offers for sale, e.g. irrigation units and sprayers.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies for her business

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en:
Sourn S., 28, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples.

S. weaves Cambodian traditional silk for an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of about USD 1 per day to help cover the family expenses.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more raw silk to produce silk products to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy raw silk to produce more silk products to sell

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina M., from the village of New Tambo, Katipunan, is 31 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Avelina owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Avelina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to invest in expanding the business, she is requesting a new loan, her seventh, of 10,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her store. Avelina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline W. G. is twenty-nine years old. She is married and has two children, aged nine years old and three and a half years old. 

Pauline hawks clothes at the Kihunguru area in Thika town. Thika is the region in Kenya known for production of pineapples. She sells clothes like shirts, trousers, and pullovers to the local people. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is the high prices for clothes, which makes the resale price higher. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

Pauline is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more shirts, jackets, trousers and pullovers to expand her business. In the future, she hopes to have a very well-established business. She describes herself as hardworking and innovative.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es: Freddy tiene 37 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijas en una casa alquilada. Desde hace 12 años brinda el servicio de transporte con su movilidad que es su principal herramienta de trabajo. Desde entonces trabaja todos los días recorriendo los diferentes puntos de la ciudad y con la experiencia de los años que tiene sabe como trabajar de manera eficiente logrando así obtener las ganancias  que requiere  para el sustento económico de su familia. Sin embargo debe afrontar el alza del combustible en algunas temporadas, afectándole mucho en su economía. Ahora su mayor anhelo es adquirir una nueva movilidad de transportes pero a gas, para que le resulte más económico. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de repuestos y el pago del mantenimiento mecánico de su carro.
texts.en:
Freddy is 37 years old. He lives with his wife and his 3 daughters in a rented house. For the past 12 years, he has provided transportation services with his own vehicle, which is his principal working tool. During that time, he has worked every day traveling through different parts of the city. With years of experience, he knows how to work efficiently, and thus he can obtain the profits he needs to support his family economically. However, he has been faced with a rise in fuel prices in some seasons, which seriously affects his budget. Currently, his greatest desire is to acquire a new vehicle, but one that runs on gas, which will be more economical. This is his second loan with MFP, and he is very happy to know that he has a source of financial support, because he has always shown himself to be responsible with his payments. He is also happy to be part of his communal bank, because all of its members are responsible people with a strong sense of solidarity. He is grateful to everyone who will help make this loan possible. It will be very useful to him in the progress of his business. With the funds he is requseting, he will invest in buying spare parts and paying for mechanical maintenance for his car.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying spare parts and providing mechanical maintenance for his car

loans.name: Mrs. Sivorn Yong Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan includes 15 people who live in Prey Mul village, Takeo province. Mrs. Sivorn Y. is the village bank president. She was born in 1980 and selected by the other members who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their businesses in this current year. She and her husband, Mr. Chhieng Lorn Hout, are farmers who own a two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. They also grow mushrooms and her husband is also a fisherman. Her problem is that her field has infertile soil and it is time to plow. So to improve rice production, Mrs. Sivorn Y. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and hire a plow machine to plow her field. She is a mother of four children. One of  the children is enrolled in the local school and the others are too small to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire a machine to plow

loans.name: Alben

texts.en:
Alben R. is from the village of Sampagar, Damulog, Bukidnon. He is 27 years old. Alben is separated from spouse and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Alben owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of vegetables in the local community. Alben has been engaged in his business for over 1 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Alben joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alben is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional pvegetables to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Alben from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sonia Magaly

texts.es:
Sonia de 30 años,  es vendedora de productos Yambal (empresa de cosméticos que vende productos a un bajo costo para mujeres emprendedoras),vive en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral.

Ella es madre soltera y para poder mantener a su hijo tubo que buscar un medio de dinero así que una de sus amigas la inscribió como vendedora Yambal a domicilio por catalogo. Poco a poco a tenido ingresos para solventar los gastos de su hijo. Vende perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, etc. 

Para seguir con su negocio ella quiere comprar perfumes, cremas y otra parte dirigida a un nuevo negocio la venta de camarones. En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa ya que ahora es una parte de caña.
texts.en:
Sonia, age 30, sells Yambal (a cosmetic company that sells products at a low cost to entrepreneurial women) products. She lives in a periurban area called Perimetral. She is a single mother, and in order to support her child she had to look for a way to earn money. One of her friends signed her up as a salesperson for Yambal. She sells at home through catalogs. Little by little she got income to cover her child’s expenses. She sells perfumes, creams, and deodorants, etc. In order to continue in her business she wants to buy perfumes and creams. The other part of the loan will be for a new business selling shrimp. In the future she wants to improve the construction of her house because part of it is made of cane.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Perfumes and creams

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “MUJERES UNIDAS ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de  San Sebastián, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Francisca;   ella tiene 40 años de edad, es casado; y tiene 4 hijos,  La socia se dedica a la atención de su panificadora que tiene en su propia casa, ella trabaja elaborando panes desde hace 7 años, La socia tiene una panadería en su casa con su esposo y juntos se dedican a la realización de panes, pasteles y a recibir diferentes platos para la cocción.  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir íntegramente en su panadería y comprar los insumos (harina, levadura, manteca, azúcar).

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member, Sra. Francisca, belongs to the MUJERES UNIDAS community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

Sra. Francisca, 40, is married and has 4 children. She has operated a bakery business from her house for 7 years.  She operates the business with her husband and together they make breads, pastries and other baked goods.  Sra. Francisca is applying for this loan so that she can invest in her business.  She will use the loan to buy supplies for the business (flour, yeast, butter, sugar).

Sra. Francisca is grateful that this important means of borrowing is available to her and others and she is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: Supplies for bakery business.

loans.name: Kokui

texts.fr: Kokoui est une femme au foyer avec 3 enfants. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de boissons locales appelées « SODABI »,  elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays dans la ville de Tabligbo pour gagner plus de profits sur ces ventes.  Elle a une ancienneté de 8 ans dans ce commerce. Actuellement son stock est baisse raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 35 bidons de  SODABI. Ainsi elle pourra de nouveau satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en: Kokoui is a housewife who has three children. She has an income-generating activity selling local alcholic drinks called "Sodabi". She gets her supplies inland in the town of Tabligbo in order to make more money from her sales. She has eight years' experience in this business. Her stock is currently low and for this reason she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 35 drums of Sodabi. She will thus be able to satisfy customer demand again.

loans.use: Purchase of local alcoholic drinks

loans.name: Gavino Marcelino

texts.es: El señor Gavino Marcelino C. V.,  es un hombre mayor de edad de 50 años habita en el conocido Barrio Laureles Norte, lugar de alta delincuencia, él es un hombre soltero sin hijos, que se dedica a la costura y comercializa productos de la Avon, desde hace mas de 25 años se dedica a la costura, y ha sido el sustento económico de su vida, y fue un amigo quien le enseño a ganarse la vida con esta actividad, en el año es normal que las ventas de los productos  de la Avon tiendan a subir y bajar, pero él quiere aprovechar las ventas de diciembre y ofertar sus productos de la Avon, así mismo comprar materia prima para realzar las ofertas de trabajo que se le presenten en esta temporada que se acerca navideña, esta inversión le permitirá mejores condiciones económicas que puede a futuro realizar una remodelaciones a la infraestructura de su hogar, y mejorar las condiciones socio económicas con las que sobrevive.
texts.en: Gavino Marcelino C. V. is over 50 years old and lives in the Barrio Laureles Norte, a run-down area.  He is a single man without children.  He makes his living by sewing and by selling Avon products.  He has been making his living as a tailor for more than 25 years, after a friend taught him the trade.  Over the course of a year, sales of Avon products normally rise and fall, but he wants to take advantage of the December sales to offer more Avon products.  He also wants to buy raw materials for the tailoring orders he has for the Christmas season.  This loan will allow him to improve his economic conditions, and in the future, he hopes to renovate his house and reapir its infrastructure and thus raise his socioeconomic level.

loans.use: To buy Avon products and fabric for sewing orders

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a married man with seven children. Through farming, he is able to provide for his family. He has been farming for twenty years and has managed to employ one person. He appreciates Faulu Kenya for financially supporting him in improving his business and his standard of living. He has requested 50,000 Kes to buy seeds, fertilizers and farming equipment.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and farming equipment

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida lives in Vehari, which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan. It is famous for its agricultural industry. She lives there with her family in a three-room brick house in the area named 39-WB. She came here after her marriage.

Her husband’s name is S. A., and he is rickshaw driver. He owns his rickshaw and provides transport services to the passengers. Khalida lives in a combined family system where her brother-in-law also lives with them in the same house. He is also a rickshaw driver.

She has given birth to two children. Both are below three years of age and have not started going to school yet. Khalida herself is a housewife. She prefers to stay at home; she carries out her responsibilities as a housewife and takes care of her children well. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to repair his rickshaw, because his rickshaw is having problems and can't run for long enough. With the fully repaired rickshaw, he will continue to give his best transport services to the passengers and increase his monthly income.

Khalida is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

Note: In the photo, the woman with a raised hand is Khalida.

loans.use: To repair her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie E. is from the village of Campo 4, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 57 years old. Rosemarie is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 9450 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosemarie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Rosemarie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

location.town: Campo 4, Ramon MAgsaysay Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Victor; el tiene 32 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de videos turísticos, el vende en forma independiente, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijo, el socio quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de videos turísticos. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar videos turísticos al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Victor belongs to the "BUENA ESPERANZA" (Good Hope) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Victor is 32 years old, married and has 3 children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his business selling tourist videos.  He sells his products independently.  Victor works from 8.00am to 6.00pm and, through his business, he gets his children ahead in life.  He would like to improve his business selling tourist videos.

Victor is requesting this loan to buy tourist videos wholesale.  He is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy tourist videos wholesale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes L. is from the village of Promiseland, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 54 years old. Agnes is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Agnes owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods and toothpaste in the local community. Agnes has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Agnes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agnes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Agnes is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like junk foods and canned goods. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Agnes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like junk foods and canned goods

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen G. is from Maybato North, San Jose, Antique, Philippines. She is married to Andres G., who is a fisherman, and they have six dependents. Carmen is a woman who has never lost her hope of getting out of poverty and, in many ways, her poverty makes her stronger. Carmen and her husband earn their living by fishing. Their income helps them provide for their basic needs and Carmen has learned how to save their small income for the future. 

Carmen has been an active member of ASHI for almost 14 years. During her time as a member, she has experienced repayment difficulties but she has never given up and has always faced her problems. For Carmen, money is important, and she has proven that she can be trusted with a bigger loan. 

As of now, Carmen is an ASHI member who has received one of the larger branch loans. She has fully repaid her previous loan and is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase a pump boat for her fishing business. Purchasing this boat will greatly help her family increase their income and meet their basic needs. In the future, Carmen wishes that her children will finish their education and that her family will have a comfortable house and savings for the future.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 22 años de edad y pronto va ser papá pues su pareja está embarazada, él nació en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Perú. 

Jesús trabaja en una empresa privada desde hace un año, él y su pareja tienen un pequeño negocio que consiste en la preparación de panes “Chuta”. En esta oportunidad Jesús requiere el préstamo para invertir en el negocio de elaboración y venta panes pues su pareja Melissa desea comprar harina, azúcar y otras cosas más. 

Jesús pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Jesús is 22 years old and will soon be a dad, since his partner is expecting.  He was born in the city of Oropesa in Cusco province, Peru.

For the last year, Jesús has worked at a private company--he and his partner have a small business making "Chuta" breads.  Now Jesús needs the loan to invest in the business of making and selling breads, since his partner Melissa wants to buy flour, sugar, and other items.  

Jesús belongs to the "Ricchariy Puririsun" communal bank of Asociación Arariwa, and he is grateful for the opportunity offered through this medium.  He promises to pay back the loan on schedule.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar and other items

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To improve and expand her business by purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael L. is from the village of Poblacion, Mambajao, Camiguin. He is 26 years old. Michael is married and has 3 school-aged children. He owns & operates a habal-habal or motorela (motorcycle transport) services to the local community. Michael has been engaged in his business for over 9 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2011, Michael joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business. Michael is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Michael from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is twenty-eight year old single mother living in a rented house in Fort Portal Uganda. After divorcing her husband, she realized that the only way to bring up her child is to have her own business, so she set up a shop. She sold her goats to raise the initial capital. 

One of her ongoing business challenges is bad debts. Beatrice needs the loan facility to buy sugar, salt, and soap to sell. Her desire is to set up a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Kuvvatali

texts.ru: Хамидов Кувватали проживает в районе Фархор. Возраст, 41 год. Женат. Имеет 6 детей. Вместе со всей семьей занимается растениеводством. Он арендуют земельный участок, где выращивает овощи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 20 лет. Кредит берет для покупки семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Kuvvatali KH. lives in Farkhor.  He is 41 years old, married, and has six children. He and his family work in agriculture.  He rents a plot of land where he grows vegetables.  He has been doing this work for twenty years. He is taking out a loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Tajikan

texts.en:
Tajikan D. is 52, widowed and has three children. She worked as an economist for a long time and was known as a very responsible and accurate person. In 1993, in order to find an additional means of subsistence for her children, she started her business in sales. With the initial capital of 10,000 KGS she managed to develop her business. She earned a monthly profit of 100,000 KGS from selling women’s clothes at the local market. Her loyal customers were attracted by her attentive attitude and cheerfulness.

But in June 2010, when violent clashes caused by the deposed political regime broke out in the Osh city, Tajikan lost her business. Her shop was robbed and looted.

However, Tajikan isn't giving up. She is ready to resume her lost business and continues to work. For this very reason, Tajikan is applying for a loan of 135,000 KGS, which she needs to restart her business. She plans to purchase more women’s clothing to resell at the local market.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas. These services lead to increased employment and help to meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing to resell.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMANECER ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Janeth; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ganados y también se dedica a la venta de productos secos como cebada,papa,trigo,cebada y maíz, ella vende en el mercado de Anta y los ganados en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta, su esposo también trabaja en el negocio de transporte haciendo servicio urbano hacia el distrito de Huarocondo y por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados y venta de productos secos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para los ganados y para comprar productos secos al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Janeth, 29, is a member of the “Amanecer Anteña” communal bank located in Anta District which belongs to Anta Province, Cusco Department.

She has a spouse and two children.  She alternates her daily chores with livestock sales and also sells dry goods like barley, potatoes, wheat and corn.  She sells in the Anta market and the livestock is sold at various markets in Anta district.  Her husband works in transportation providing urban transport in Huarocondo District.  She supports her children through these businesses.

She wants to enlarge the livestock sales business and the dry goods sales business.  She is asking for a loan to buy animal feed and to buy dry goods at wholesale.  She is happy with the loan and commits to repay.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed and to buy dry goods at wholesale.

loans.name: Lucrecia Petronila

texts.es:
Lucrecia es socia del Banco Comunal “Uniòn Arco Deustua” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos.  Estudió educación secundaria. 
Con su préstamo  anterior, que fue por S/. 300.00 nuevos soles,  la señora invirtió en su negocio de venta de abarrotes, en la actualidad se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir y frutas.  Es socia del Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 5 años.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, comprará  artefactos como: televisor, licuadoras, planchas y prendas de vestir como casacas y colchas, etc.
La señora cuenta que sus productos los compra en Desaguadero y  los vende en la ciudad de Cusco.  En el negocio le ayuda su esposo quién se ayuda dando servicio de taxi (transportista).
Su sueño es abrir una tienda de artefactos y así mejorar sus ingresos.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad de los pagos, la unión y la puntualidad.
En la foto se encuentra junto a su hija.
texts.en:
Lucrecia, 28, is a member of the “Uniòn Arco Deustua” communal bank located in Puno District, Puno Province and Department.  She has a spouse and two children.  She went to secondary school.

Her previous loan, which was for 300 new soles, was invested in her grocery business.  Currently, she sells clothing and fruit.  She’s been a member of the Manuela Ramos Movement for five years.

She will use this new, 1500 new sol, loan to buy appliances like, television sets, blenders and irons and clothing like, jackets and bedspreads, etc.

She relates that she makes her purchases in Desaguadero and her sales are in Cusco.  Her husband helps her with the work and provides for himself working as a taxi driver.  Her dream is to open an appliance store to improve her income.

What she likes about the communal bank is the punctuality of payments, the unity and the punctuality.
She appears in the photo with her daughter.

loans.use: to buy appliances like television sets, blenders and irons and clothing like jackets and bedspreads, etc.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна находится в счастливом браке. Ее мужа зовут Владимир. Она имеет свой бизнес - продает женское белье и купальники. Татьяна занимается этим бизнесом уже 12 лет и имеет большой опыт.
 
Торговая точка Татьяны находится на входе в центральный рынок, благодаря чему у нее постоянный поток клиентов. Татьяна - хороший работник и старается всегда помочь покупателям.  Она старается развивать свой бизнес и увеличивать доход, выезжая  на другие большие рынки.
 
Татьяна просит  предоставить ей кредит на сумму 10000 гривен для увеличения ассортимента - закупки 100 шт. купальников и женского белья,  а соответственно для увеличения  дохода семьи.
texts.en:
Tatiana is happily married. Her husband's name is Vladimir. She has her own business.  She sells women's underwear and swimsuits.  Tatiana has been doing this work for twelve years and has a great deal of experience.

Tatiana's shop is located at the entrance of the main market, and therefore she has a constant stream of customers.  Tatiana is a good worker and tries to always help her customers.  She tries to expand her business and increase her income, by traveling to other large markets.
 
Tatiana is asking for a loan for 10,000 hryvnia to increase her goods for sale.  She would like to buy 100 swimsuits and women's underwear, and thereby increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy new goods  for resale to increase her family's income.

loans.name: Helen Group

texts.en: Helen is married with two children. Helen is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. Helen is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase pigs. Helen has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. Helen is the leader of a 2 person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Glena

texts.en:
Glena is 35 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanbga del Sur. She is married and a mother of four grown children.

Glena has a small market at home to make a living. She sells basic food items, which is the secondary income for her family. She has been engaged in this type of business for over 10 years. She earns a total monthly average of PHP 5,000 from this activity. Glena requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase additional stocks to sell. 

Glena has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Glena hopes to expand her business and gain more profit.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Mme Salimata est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 39ans et le moins âgé a 29ans. Personne ne va a l’école et elle a 06 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des pagnes traditionnels et des couvertures depuis 03ans. Mme s’approvisionne à Safané(Dédougou) et à Bobo Dioulasso toutes deux, des villes du Burkina.Ses clients sont les fonctionnaires des diférents services.
 
Elle veut s’acheter 15 pagnes traditionnels s et une dizaine de couvertures.

Mme utilise ses bénéfices pour les travaux de sa maison au fur et à mesure. Elle ambitionne agrandir son commerce et s’occuper de sa maison.
texts.en:
Salimata is married and the mother of 7 children. The oldest is 39 years old, and the youngest is 29. None attend school, and she has 6 persons to support. 

She's been selling traditional pagnes (colorful African cloth) and blankets for three years. She gets her supplies in Safané (Dédougou) and in Bobo Dioulasso, both cities in Burkina. Her customers are public servants from various offices.

She wants to buy 15 traditional pages and about ten blankets. As they come in, she will use her profits for work that her house needs. She ambitions to expand her business and take care of her house.

loans.use: to buy 15 traditional pagnes (colorful African cloth) and about 10 blankets

loans.name: Mirgazy

texts.ru:
Миргазы родился в селе Джекен (Чуйская область, Кыргызская Республика). Женат и воспитывает трех дочерей, старшей  из которых 17 лет.
Миргазы родился в простой семье фермера. Он был самым старшим из братьев, и поэтому большую часть времени посвящал домашним хлопотам, помогал отцу по уходу за скотом. По окончании 9 классов, Миргазы поступил в Пищевой техникум в городе Карабалта (Чуйская область, Кыргызская Республика), по специальности технолог зерновых производств.
Окончив техникум, в 1996 году его призвали в армию, где отслужил полтора года. Отслужив, Миргазы приехал в родное село и  устроился на работу в колхоз слесарем. Проработал он  в колхозе не долго - из-за низкой зарплаты он уволился и устроился на работу в отдел охраны в городе Карабалта. В  2003 году Миргазы женился и год спустя у них родилась дочь. Первое время они с женой снимали квартиру. В 2005 году, накопив немного денег, Миргазы покупает дом в г. Карабалта, в котором в этом же году у него появляется на свет еще одна девочка.  А в 2010 году семья  пополняется третьей дочерью.   
В связи с тем, что зарплаты Миргазы не хватало для оплаты всех расходов семьи, он решил заняться бизнесом – разведением и перепродажей скота. Используя свой стартовый капитал  в сумме в 3,000 сом (KGS), он успешно развил свой бизнес и на сегодняшний день имеет ежемесячный  доход в сумме 6,000 сом (KGS). В 2009 году, Миргазы получил кредит в компании  «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» на покупку коровы и бычков. После своевременного погашения кредита у него осталась дойная корова.  В целях дальнейшего развития бизнеса, Миргазы обратился за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) для покупки бычков. 
 В планах Миргазы  - последующее увеличение поголовья скота, а его мечта - выучить дочек в университете и  купить новый дом.
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Mirgazy was born in the village of Jeken (in the Chuy region of Kyrgyzstan). He is married and has three daughters, the eldest of which is 17 years old. Mirgazy born into a simple farmer's family. He was the eldest of the brothers, and so most of his time was devoted to household chores, helping his father care for the cattle. At the end of the ninth grade, Mirgazy entered the College of Food in Karabalta (in the Chuy region of Kyrgyzstan), studying  grain production. 

After graduating from college in 1996, he was drafted into the army, where he served for a year and a half. After serving, Mirgazy came to his village and went to work as a farm mechanic. His work on the farm did not last long.  Because of low wages, he resigned and took a job for the city Karabalta. In 2003 he married Mirgazy and a year later had a daughter. 

At first, he and his wife rented an apartment. In 2005, having saved some money they bought a house in Karabalta, where in that year they had another daughter.  In 2010,  they had a third daughter. Due to the fact that his salary was not enough to pay for all the family's expenses, Mirgazy he decided to go into business: breeding and selling cattle. Using a start-up capital in the amount of 3,000 soms (KGS), he successfully developed his business and now has a monthly income of 6.000 som (KGS). In 2009, Mirgazy received a loan in the company Bai Tushum & Partners to buy cows and bulls. After the timely repayment of his first loan he has kept a milk cow. In order to further develop his business, Mirgazy has applied for a loan in the amount of 70,000 Som (KGS) to buy cattle. 

Mirgazy plans to increase his livestock.  His dream is to put his daughters through the university and buy a new home.

ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners provides loans through Kiva for socially vulnerable population regions. ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners is one of the leading micro financing organizations in Kyrgyzstan. Bai Tushum & Partners is a reliable financial partner which makes an impact in development of the economy in the Republic of Kyrgyzstan, provides affordable micro lending services in the rural towns and cities, helps to create jobs and is responsible for the interests of their clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Reema

texts.en: Reema is 51 years old and lives in Bani Kenanah, Jordan with her husband and four children. In 1990, she opened a grocery store with a small amount of capital and has worked hard to expand it and get the necessary licenses. She is applying for a loan for 400 JD to buy more food products to sell to her customers. Her long-term goal is to earn enough money to expand and improve her house and buy her own store so that she no longer needs to pay rent.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rena

texts.en:
Rena is a 21-year-old mother of two. She recently completed the Social Services Day Care Training Course and has been certified to open her day care for this school year. She prepared a place in her home for the child care but needed to develop an outside play area for the children and infants. In Rena's area, there are no other home-based day care centers and one is sorely needed.

Rena needed this loan to create a sandbox play area and to purchase toys, play sets, shelves, cots and other supplies. Rena wants to establish her day care and keep it running professionally while creating a loving environment for the children.

loans.use: to create a sandbox play area, purchase toys, play sets, shelves, and cots.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 33 años de edad, ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos.  
 
Actualmente, Vilma vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella es cosmetóloga y tiene un pequeño salon de belleza donde realiza cortes, tintes, peinados y otras cosas más. Ya son cinco años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

En esta oportunidad Vilma requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo tintes  champús, acondicionadores y otras cosas más. 

El Banco Comunal “Comuzone I” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Vilma was born in the city of Cusco (Peru).  She is 33 years old, married, and has two children from her marriage.

Vilma currently lives in the city of Cusco and this is where she carries out her business activities.  She is a cosmetologist and owns a small beauty salon where she provides her customers with haircuts, dyes, hairdos, etc.  She has been in this business for five years and it is doing very well.

On this occasion, Vilma needs a loan to buy materials such as hair dyes, shampoo, conditioners, etc.

The 'Comuzone I' community bank meets every month in the city of Cusco (Peru).  Cusco is known as a very touristy and commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi fiesta and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world: Machupicchu.

loans.use: to buy hair dyes, shampoo, conditioners, etc.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Emelyn has a retail shop that sells vegetables like cabbages, carrots & potatoes. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy vegetables to sell.

Emelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Emelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Dioma

texts.fr: Madame DIoma  est une veuve  d’une soixantaine d’années qui vit au Sénégal. Elle a de grands enfants  et elle s’active dans le petit commerce et la vente d’encens et autres produits divers . Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis avril 2005. Elle n’y a  jamais bénéficié de crédit antérieur. Elle prévoit d’effectuer le pèlerinage a la Mecque  cette année. A cet effet elle sollicite un crédit  de 500 000 frs prévu pour compléter son argent destiné a faire face aux dépenses auxquelles elle est confronté. Ce financement pourra contribuer a améliorer le statut social de l’emprunteur.
texts.en:
Dioma is a 60-year-old widow who lives in Senegal.  She has grandchildren and she has a small business selling incense and other miscellaneous products.  She has been a member of one of U-MICEC's offices since April 2005.  She has not received any previous loans.

Dioma plans to make a pilgrimage to Mecca this year.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 500,000 francs to put together with some money she already has to cover the expenses that she faces.  This loan could contribute towards improving the social status of the borrower.

loans.use: to cover expenses related to her trip to the Holy Place

loans.name: Zenah

texts.en:
Zenah has been a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya for the past 20 years and also works as a teacher. She currently produces maize and poultry for the local market. She is married and has seven children who are all adults except the last one who is still in school. 

Zenah has made a request for a loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to purchase more poultry and boost her poultry business. This is her second loan from Juhudi Kilimo. She is optimistic about poultry farming and says it will help her provide for the basic needs of the family and make life much better. 

She sees stiff competition for the poultry business as a challenge but is hopeful she will succeed all the same. She also appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's services to small holder farmers.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Andy

texts.en:
