To make a living, 37-year-old Andy has owned and operated a small corn field in his village. He has been in this business for two years. With this business he is able to support his family: a wife and three children. He does not want his family to experience any difficulties of life.

He is hoping to improve his family's standard of living. As a result, he is seeking a loan in the amount of 25,000 PHP to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and insecticides that will be used on his corn field. He is hoping to grow his crops in order to harvest them during the harvesting season. His net income from the crops will be saved for the education of his children as well as to provide for his family in the future.

loans.use: To purchase corn seeds, fertilizers and insecticides that will be used on his corn field

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 54 year old married woman. She has one son. She lives with her family in H. Chi Minh city. She has been running a general store for the past 5 years. 

Hoa would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of basic products to stock her general store

loans.name: Shirley Oliva

texts.es:
Shirley, es una joven de 27 años, es madre soltera de un niño de 3 años, vive en la comunidad de Mallco Rancho  en la casa de sus padres, pues hasta hace un año atrás vivía con el padre de su hijo, y por problemas de pareja decidió separarse.
 Shirley trabaja  más de 4 años en un Bar, el cargo que ocupa es  BARMAN  , trabaja de noche en horarios 7:00 pm hasta 1:00 am , mientras trabaja al hijo le cuida la hermana mayor .
El destino del crédito es para la construcción (mano de obra fina) de su casa, ya que los padres le heredaron un terreno en donde Shirley con sus ahorros ya empezó a construir.
Entre sus sueños y metas es, terminar de construir su casa para poder ya irse a vivir junto a su hijo, y lo más importante es que en futuro tener su propio Bar ya que a Shirley le gusta dedicarse a esa actividad.
texts.en:
Shirley is a 27 year old young woman.  She is the single mother of a 3 year old child.  She lives in parents’ house in the Mallco Rancho community.  Up until a year ago she lived with the father of her child.  However, they had problems and decided to separate.

She has worked in a bar for over four years.  She works as a bartender.  She works nights from 7:00 p.m. until 1:00 a.m.  Her older sister takes care of Shirley’s child while she is working.

The loan is for (manual labor) to build her house.  Shirley inherited land from her parents, and with her savings she has already started construction.

Among her dreams and goals is finishing construction of her house.  Then she will be able to go and live together with her child.  The most important thing in the future is to have her own bar.  Shirley likes devoting herself to this business activity.

loans.use: to pay for construction of her house.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is taking out a loan to buy feed for his pigs. He lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is aged 48, and is married with four children.

Geofrey started as a poultry farmer and has now diversified into farming pigs. He dreams of building a permanent home and buying land to grow crops.

loans.use: to buy feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
Primavera es el grupo formado por 11 mujeres de la ciudad de Curuguaty, ellas son todas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, quienes vieron una gran oportunidad de progreso en el programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Ellas trabajan mucho día a día para que de esa forma puedan salir adelante.
Una de las miembros es la señora Irma, quien se dedica a la lavandería. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes y por lo mismo le va muy bien en el negocio. Ella desea poder seguir creciendo y es por ello que cada día se empeña para poder aumentar sus ganancias. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de jabones, suavizantes para ropas y demás insumos necesarios para poder utilizar en su lavandería. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Primavera ["Spring"] is a group made up of eleven women from Curuguaty city. They are all friends and neighbours in Curuguaty, who saw the Fundacion Paraguaya's Programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras [Female Entrepreneurs' Programme] as a great opportunity to get ahead. They work a lot day in and day out so that they can get ahead.
One of the group members is Señora Irma, who provides a laundry service. She says that she has many clients, so her business is going very well. She wants to be able to continue expanding, so she works hard every day to increase her income. She is a very hard-working and enterprising woman.
She is requesting this loan for the purchase of laundry detergent and fabric softener, as well as other necessary products for her laundromat. She thanks the Fundacion for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy laundry detergent and fabric softener.

loans.name: Triphine

texts.en:
Triphine is 31 years old. She is married and has one child who is one year old. Her husband works as a primary teacher. 

She sells food and she has been in the business for the period of two years. 

She needs the loan to add more food such as beans, cassava and sorghum in the business. 

She plans to use the profits to make savings and pay school fees for the children as well as providing food for the family. 

In the future, she would like to own a vehicle to help in the business in terms of transportation.

loans.use: To buy more beans, cassava and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Atong

texts.en:
Atong is a 49-year-old married woman with three children. One of her children is in school. She has had a business selling food from her stall in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Atong is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions to sell

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKADI I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BENEKO, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec   SANABA , 1 ere assise de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de OUELESSEBOUGOU, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Mahume Group

texts.fr: MAHUME est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de A. Rose (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 49 ans. A. Rose n'a pas fréquenté l'école. A. Rose est mariée à un pompiste du nom de Robert. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par A. Rose et son mari. Pour ce faire, A. Rose vend de la nourriture dans sa région depuis quatorze ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. A. Rose s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, A. Rose sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe MAHUME, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du riz et de l'huile végétale.

loans.name: Fulomene

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the fifteen members of the women’s association Gninkando, located in the village of Mlomp in the Casamance region of southern Senegal. Represented by Fuloméne S., the group submitted the following business description:

“The Gninkando association is a group of women of the village of Djicomol in the ecovillage of Mlomp. The village has a population of over 10,000, which is why an agricultural enterprise is a good way to help the women take advantage of what their environment has to offer. The purpose of our group is to strengthen solidarity between our members, to promote emancipation and to work for the development of the land within the areas of their target business activities. The business activities proposed by the group are:

• Agriculture: This consists of gardening, where the investment needs are: inputs (seeds, fertilizer, phytosanitary products), and equipment (watering cans, rakes, hoes, wheelbarrows, pitchforks, etc.)

• Commerce: This is our group’s main business activity; using local produce grown by our group, the members market their products throughout the region, especially in the surrounding villages. Furthermore, the women use their fruits and vegetables to make jams, preserves and juices.”

Original French:

« Contexte du Projet: Le groupement Gninkando est un groupement de femmes du village de Djicomol dans l’éco village de Mlomp. Sa population compte plus de 10 000habitants et c’est pourquoi un projet d’agriculture viendra au point pour aider les femmes à exploiter les potentiels de leur milieu

Objectifs du Prêt : l’objectif visé par le groupement est :

- de tisser des viens de solidarité entre ses membres, de promouvoir l’émancipation et d’œuvrer pour le développement du terroir dans les domaines de leur activités cible.

Activités : Les activités que se propose le groupement sont :

- L’agriculture : elle est basée sur le maraîchage ou les besoins sont : les intrants (semences engrais, produits phytosanitaire), et le petit matériel (arrosoirs, râteaux, pèles, houes, brouettes fourches etc.…)

- Le commerce : Il est le principal activité du groupement ; de par les produits locaux produits par le groupement ; les membres du groupement assure la commercialisation de leurs produits au niveau régional, surtout dans les village environnants. En outre, les femmes se donnent à la transformation des fruits et légumes. »

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and equipment for gardening; transportation of produce to market

loans.name: Masnah

texts.en: Masnah is a 32 year old mother of three children. She runs her business by selling household goods such as soaps, kerosene and various fried snacks at a small shop in front of her house. Her husband, Masdupi, sells cemetery goods such as flowers, rose water, etc. He comes home every 10 days and usually earns $15/10 days.

loans.use: Capital

loans.name: Esperanza Romana

texts.en:
Esperanza is 40 years old and is married with seven children. She runs a clothing store out of her house. She travels to San Cristobal every 15 days to buy new products. Due to the long distance (two hours by truck) it is difficult for her to maintain a supply. She therefore takes orders from people in her community and once she has accumulated several of them she makes the trip to buy the ordered items. She will use the loan to increase her stock and thus not have to travel so frequently. She belongs to the Santa Lucia 4 group.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

ESPERANZA TIENE 40 AÑOS,CASADA, SIETE HIJOS. TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ROPA EN SU CASA, VIAJA A SAN CRISTOBAL CADA QUINCE DIAS A COMPRAR NUEVOS PRODUCTOS, YA QUE POR LA LEJANIA (DOS HORAS EN CAMION) TIENE PROBLEMAS PARA ABASTECERSE, ES POR ESO QUE RECIBE PEDIDOS DE LA GENTE DE SU COMUNIDAD Y UNA VEZ QUE RECAUDA VARIOS VIAJA A COMPRAR LO SOLICITADO. CON EL CREDITO AUMENTARA SU STOCK Y ASI NO VIAJARA TAN SEGUIDO. PERTENECE AL GRUPO SANTA LUCIA 4.

loans.use: Merchant

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
Mr. Juan Lopez Velazquez is 34 years old and married with 3 children. All three children are in school. His wife is named Silvia Soledad and she works at the largest beauty salon in the neighborhood, doing all kinds of hairstyles and extensions. All of them live together in a small house in the city of Luque.

Juan is an auto mechanic and relies on the income from a garage that he operates from his house. Other members of Juan’s family, nephews, as well as his own children, help him with his work. Juan gets up at 6:30 every morning to open the business that has grown over the 3 years since he opened it. He opens the shop at 7:00 in the morning and works non-stop to 8:00 in the evening. For customers, he depends largely on neighbors and friends.

Juan is asking for a loan so that he can replace and repair his work tools, most of which are broken or very worn; in this way, he can speed up his work and improve the quality of service he provides.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

El Señor Juan L. V. tiene 34 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos. Los tres están estudiando. Su señora se llama Silvia Soledad y trabaja en la peluquería más grande del área, ella hace todo tipo de peinados y extensiones. Viven todos juntos en una pequeña casa en la ciudad de Luque.

El Señor es un mecánico automotriz y cuenta con su taller propio en su casa. Trabaja con la ayuda de otros familiares tales como sobrinos al igual que sus hijos que le ayudan con sus tareas. El señor se despierta a eso de las 6.30 cada mañana para abrir el negocio que ha ido creciendo en los últimos 3 años desde su apertura. Abre el local a las 7 am y trabaja de corrido hasta las 8 pm. Cuenta con una clientela formada compuesta mayormente por vecinos y amigos.

Juan está solicitando el crédito para poder renovar sus herramientas del taller, pues la mayoría están muy gastadas y rotas; de esta forma podrá agilizar sus trabajos y mejorar aún más la calidad de estos.

loans.use: Repair and replace work tools for auto repair shop.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel is a responsible and hard-working man. He's originally from Tampico [in the northeastern Mexican state of] Tamaulipas. He's married and has three daughters. He used to work in an auto repair shop but his salary was very low. In order to pull his family up, he decided 20 years ago to start his own business selling fast food. The good service that he offered helped him to grow the business and he now has three food carts. He also started selling natural products when he saw how they helped his sick wife and they've been well received by his customers.

To keep growing, Daniel now needs a US$650 loan that he will use to buy merchandise and to acquire basic materials to increase his production. He promises to repay the amount in 6 months. Daniel very much appreciates the change that you're giving him to improve and grow his business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Daniel es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, es originario de la localidad de Tampico, Tamaulipas, está casado y tiene tres hijas, anteriormente él trabajaba en un taller mecánico pero su salario era muy bajo y para poder sacar adelante a su familia decidió comenzar su propio negocio con la venta de comidas rápidas hace 20 años, afortunadamente el buen servicio que ofrece le ha ayudado a hacer crecer su negocio y ahora ya cuenta con tres carritos. También ha iniciado con las ventas de productos naturales, porque ha observado buenos resultados en la enfermedad de su esposa y tiene muy buena aceptación de sus clientes.

Para continuar creciendo, ahora Daniel necesita un préstamo de $ 650 dólares, que empleará en la compra de mercancía, así como para adquirir insumos e incrementar su producción, él que se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Daniel agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Buy basic materials for food business.

loans.name: Leonor Jeque

texts.pt:
Leonor is single, but lives with a man who has 4 children. Her husband is not employed. She makes her living with small jobs. Leonor entered the program in 2001. She's a very enterprising woman. With her earnings, she was able to expand the stand where she sells products and also help her husband with home expenses and school expenses for their children. She is able to ensure that her family members receive a balanced diet.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Leonor e solteira mas vive com um homem com quem tem 4 filhos. O marido de Leonor nao esta empregado. Vive de pequenos negocios.Leonor entrou para o programa em 2001. E uma mulher muito empreendedora. Ela vende roupa.Com os rendimentos conseguiu ampliar a sua barraca onde tambem vende produtos de primeira necessidade e ainda ajuda o marido nas despesas da casa e nas despesas da escola dos seus filhos. Ela consegue assegurar uma dieta equilibrada para os membros de sua familia.

loans.use: Leonor wants to use the money to buy more clothing to sell  but also to buy products to fill up her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more raw materials like cloth to make more products during this holiday season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz is 23 years old and sells fruit with a walking cart on the road, Epifanio Rios Avenue. Her family is made up of her husband, young child and live in Beatriz's mothers house. After some time of vending, her husband got a job as a taxi driver. They both have significant experience with their respective areas because they have done the same for many years. The fruit business is of good competence because they usually have enough supply to meet the demand and have no problem selling what they have. Also, she offers good deals to her clients by offering good quality fruit. Currently, the cost of a box of apples is BS 140, a box of grapes - BS 120, a box of peaces- BS 140, a bunch of bananas - BS 20.; also she buys apple custard and a percentage of the money earned is used to pay off her car debt. Presently, her credit history is very good. She has always been below the average level of loan delinquency.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

Beatriz tiene 23 años de edad y se dedia a la comercialización ambulante de fruta en carretilla y vende sobre la avenida Epifanio Ríos. Su familia está compuesta por ella su esposo y su hijito, actualmente viven en la casa de la mamá de Beatriz. Después de un tiempo de vender en carretilla ahora agarró un puesto, su esposo trabaja como moto-taxista. Ambos tienen bastante experiencia en sus respectivos rubros ya que se desempeñan en los mismos desde hace varios años atrás. La competencia en el rubro de comercialización de fruta es medio, como se trata de un producto de primera necesidad y de bastante demanda generalmente no tiene problema en vender lo que ofrece, además que ofrece un trato muy bueno a sus clientes además de ofrecer calidad en las frutas que vende. La presente solicitud es para la compra de una caja de manzana que cuesta alrededor de Bs. 180.-, una caja de uva que cuesta Bs. 120.-, la caja de durazno que está a Bs. 140.-, el racimo de plátanos que está a Bs. 20.-, también comprará chirimoya que está en su época y por otra parte un porcentaje del dinero utilizará para el pago de una cuota que debe por la compra de un vehículo. La presente solicitud es la tercera de Beatriz y su historial crediticio es muy bueno. Siempre mantuvo un promedio bajo de mora.

loans.use: To buy capital and pay off debt.

loans.name: Gilmer

texts.es:
Gilmer is 24-years-old, and he is a young parent with many objectives, therefore, he works hard daily. He is a driver and in his spare time he takes care of his small farm. To continue to advance in his career Gilmer bought a taxi, which has been key to support him and his family while his crop harvest. With time his vehicle has deteriorated, that is why he is requesting a loan, since sometimes he returns home with the grief of not to having been able to go to work due to the problems he has had with his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

Gilmer de 24 años de edad, es un joven padre con muchos objetivos por eso se esfuerza a diario. Él se dedica al transporte de pasajeros(chofer) y en sus ratos libres se dedica al cuidado y mantenimiento de su chacra, para desarrollar su primera actividad ha comprado hace mucho un mototaxi, con esta herramienta ha sostenido su hogar durante el tiempo de espera para obtener los productos que ha sembrado.Los desperfectos que ha venido sufriendo su herramienta de trabajo lo conducen a solicitar un préstamo ya que a menudo tiene que regresar a casa con la pena de no haber podido ir a trabajar por los problemas de su vehículo.

loans.use: To buy parts to repair vehicle

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: Mrs. Sang L., age 53, has seven children and lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. Kong Ven, 40, is a logger and earns about $5 a day. One of their children is married and lives away from home, and another works as a waitress in a restaurant in Siem Reap, where she earns around $100 a month. Their five other children are all students. This couple has applied for a loan to buy a plot of farmland, on which they will grow a variety of vegetables. By doing this, they will increase their income and provide better support to their family.

loans.use: To buy land on which to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es:
Segundina is a hard-working person and over many years, this has allowed her to earn enough income to support her four children. She is devoted to the raising of animals, especially cows which she buys and sells in her local market. In this manner, she obtains the income that she needs. Her wish is to improve the food for her cows and bulls by cultivating more forage for which she is requesting a loan. .

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Segundina, es una persona muy empeñosa y durante muchos años esto le ha permitido obtener ingresos suficientes para sostener a sus 4 hijos. Se dedica a la crianza de animales ye en especial de vacas ya que las compra y las vende en la feria de su localidad y de esa manera consigue las ganancias que necesita, su deseo es mejorar la alimentación de sus vacas y toros, para este fin cultivará más forraje y es por ello que solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: Planting of forage to feed her animals.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina, with her small but indispensable business of selling prickly pears and the beautifully woven gloves and stockings, continues to improve the life of her loved 12 year old daughter, Cristina, who has turned into the main force behind her impulses to get ahead in this hard world. Every day of the week, she takes her small wagon of prickly pears to her place of business where she offers her delicious fruit for sale. The wish of this enchanting woman is to be able to provide an advanced education for her only daughter; she is willing to put in all her efforts to achieve this goal. Your support translates into tremendous help for Mrs. Guillermina.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Guillermina con su pequeño pero indispensable negocio de venta de tunas y tejido de hermosos y cómodos guantes y calcetines viene sacando adelante a su querida hija Cristina de 12 años de edad, quien se convirtió en el principal motor que la impulsa a progresar en este duro mundo.Todos los días de la semana saca su pequeña carretita de tunas para dirigirse al puestito de su negocio y ofrecer sus deliciosas y frescas frutas. El deseo de esta encantadora dama es brindarle sus estudios superiores a su única hija, para ello está dispuesta a poner todo su empeño en sus actividades.Vuestro aporte significa una indispensable ayuda para Doña Guillermina.

loans.use: Improve her small place of business.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. Chan T. is a 52 year old mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the remaining three attend school. She is a subsistence farmer in Trapaing Skun Village in Kampong Speu Province. Her husband, Mr. Mi Seng, collects palm juice to process into sugar. Mrs. Chan T.’s plantation now faces a problem because she does not have enough animals to plow her rice field. Thus, Mrs. Chan T. has decided to request a loan to buy a cow to add to her old one for use as draft animals. Last year, one of her children suffered from typhoid and Mrs. Chan T. spent $100 in medical expenses for the cure. Mrs. Chan T. has insufficient money to buy a cow to plow her field. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to add to her old one for use as draft animals.

loans.name: Happyness

texts.en:
Happyness is 27 years. She is married with two children aged five and two. She became a banana seller in 2005. Every day she works from 9am to 6pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Happyness now hopes for a loan to buy more bananas for her business to increase sales.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for her business to increase sales.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
Lucrecia is 49 years old, single, she lives in her parent’s hom with her 20-year old son Ramiro who is studying at the university. She was born in Juliaca, and with the support of her parents she opened an auto parts store. The work is difficult and Lucrecia had to learn everything associated with auto repair. Now, with 19 years of experience, she has become an expert. What she most enjoys about her job is that she is the manager and her own boss. She works on behalf of her son Ramiro, who as her only child is her sole focus, and she wants to see him become a professional and have a beautiful family. With the money from the loan Lucrecia wants to buy some parts that her customers have asked for and until now she has not been able to acquire them. In the future she wants her business to grow in earnings in order to have a bigger locale.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Lucrecia tiene 49 años, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres con su hijo Ramiro de 20 años, el cual cursa estudios superiores. Es natural de la ciudad de Juliaca, con el apoyo de sus padres puso una tienda de repuestos para motor de autos. El trabajo es difícil y Lucrecia tuvo que aprender todo lo relacionado con la mecánica de autos, ahora, ya con 19 años de experiencia se ha convertido en toda una experta, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que ella lo administra y es su propia jefa. Trabaja a favor de su hijo Ramiro, quien al ser su único hijo es su adoración, quiere verlo profesional y que conforme una linda familia. Con el dinero del préstamo Lucrecia quiere comprar algunos repuestos que le solicitaron y que hasta ahora no había podido conseguir.En el futuro quiere que su negocio incremente sus ganancias para tener un local más grande.

loans.use: Buy auto parts that her customers have asked for

loans.name: Valelia

texts.en: Valelia H., 32, is married with 3 children. She has many years of experience in the vegetable business. She sells to the village and general public 4 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD). SPBD loans are Valelia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her earnings will be used to improve business and help out with the family. Her husband helps out with the business.

loans.use: To improve business status and also help to improve her home

loans.name: Mrs. Seng Theim Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Seng T. is the leader of a loan group of four who all live in Tumnob Leu village in Kampong Cham province. She is a grocer in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her inventory. Mrs. Seng T. is a 51-year-old widow with three children, one of whom is a construction worker while the others are enrolled in the local school. 

One of the members in this group loan has an end-of-term loan, so this member is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods for her inventory

loans.name: Gulzaran Nawab Hussain Group

texts.en:
Gulzaran baji is a wife of N. H. and lives in a city named Borewala in Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 35 years. She is the mother of seven children: five sons and two daughters. Her first three sons are involved in their father’s wood selling business. Her husband has been selling wood for the past 20 years. Her younger son has a food selling business and the youngest son is in 3rd Standard. Her daughters are also enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Gulzaran baji herself has a clothes sewing business. She has been sewing clothes for the past 10 years. She shares her income with her husband so that he is easily able to meet the household expenses. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more wood to expand her family business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shamim akhtar baji and Ghulam Ayesha baji and Parveen baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Maqboolan baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell. Allah Rakhi baji wants a loan to buy thread to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wood to resell.

loans.name: Sochea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sochea P. is 30 years old and she now lives in Preak Ta Oung Ti Pie village in Kandal province. She is a cake seller in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Bo Punlork, is an ice cream seller, also in the local village. He now wants to expand his business to other villages in order to increase his income. Thus, Mrs. Sochea P. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a cart and ice-cream box for her husband's business.

She hopes to provide a better life for her family and improve their living conditions with this loan. She has three children, two of whom are attending the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is also shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase a cart and ice-cream box for her husband's business.

loans.name: José Guadalupe

texts.es:
Don José quiere tener a su familia bien protegida, desde que le dieron la casa no ha podido realizarle grandes mejoras, en esta ocasión se acercó con nosotros para poder elaborar la barda perimetral.
Es operador de un tracto camión y por lo regular siempre sale fuera de la ciudad, el tener resguardada su casa le dará mayor tranquilidad y confianza.
En nombre de su familia él agradece su contribución para realizar el proyecto.
texts.en:
José would like to provide security for his family. Since being given his house, he has not been able to make any home improvements. He is coming to us now so he can build a wall around the perimeter. He drives a tractor-trailer and is usually out of town, so he would feel more confident and at-peace with his house protected. On behalf of his family, José expresses his appreciation for your contribution so he can complete this project.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a perimeter wall.

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en:
Vugar A. rents a little store where he sells foodstuffs. He buys his goods in another city. He goes for goods every week. His family consists of a wife and two children who help him at the store. His products are popular in his town for being cheap and fresh. That’s why he has many regular clients. This store is the main financial source in his family, and additional income comes from Vugar`s car, which he uses as a taxi to take local people to other villages.

He wants to take a loan of $1200 for purchasing more goods and to have more profits. And with bigger profits he plans to pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase more food items to sell at his store

loans.name: Ada

texts.en: Ada is 28 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Asaba, Delta state, Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks. She hopes to expand her business. She needs the loan amount of N70, 000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders and she will work hard to put her loan to good use.

loans.use: To purchase provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Elfego

texts.es: El señor Elfego S.  tiene ya más de un año con su negocio de ventas de tacos en un lugar muy bien ubicado. Él desea tener más variedad de comidas para ofrecerles a sus clientes que tiene muy buena demanda y también quiere acondicionar un nuevo puesto pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para esta inversión, portal motivo nos está solicitando un préstamo, planea pagarlo con las ganancias de su nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Elfego S. has had his taco selling business, situated in a very good location, for over a year now. He would like to offer his customers a bigger variety of foods, as they are in high demand. He also wants to set up and open a new stand, but currently he doesn’t have the necessary money to invest in this. For this reason he is requesting this loan, and plans on paying it off with the earnings from his new business.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise purchase for his business

loans.name: Mame Sophie

texts.fr: Mame Sophie C. est une femme mariée de 53 ans qui a en charge 05 neveux et nièces. Elle s’active dans la vente de crème et de glace, bon marché en cette période de chaleur. Cette activité qu’elle mène, en plus de la vente de tissus teint « Thioup » qu’elle fait aussi, lui permet de nourrir les enfants dont elle a la charge.
texts.en:
Mame Sophie C. is 53, married, and has five nephews and nieces to support. She is active in selling cream and ice-cream, a good activity in this period of heat. This business she handles together with the sale of dyed "thioup" cloth, allows her to meet the food needs of her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To produce and sell cream and ice

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a responsible mother and a supportive wife to her husband. She helps her husband in maintaining their poultry business. She is 46 years old and they are living in Alibago in Enrile, Cagayan. Their 14 year old daughter, Marcely, is now in her third year of high school.

The couple works hard in order to provide for the needs of their daughter, especially her education. Lilia sells their raised broilers (chickens) in the market when they weigh a kilo. She wants to increase her income by improving her business and she can do this by obtaining a loan of PHP 5,000 that will serve as her capital. With this amount, they can have a better chance to develop her enterprise.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 53 years old and married with two children. His children are currently working.

To support his household, Emmanuel has been selling soft drinks in the neighborhood to his loyal customers on a retail and wholesale basis. He says selling soft drinks is very lucrative and therefore he wants to expand his inventory to enable him to make a good income for his family’s needs.

Emmanuel is a member of the group called “Blessing”. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral and assist one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks in bulk

loans.name: Makhmud

texts.ru: Махмуду 30 лет. Женат и отец 2-х детей. У него высшее образование. Махмуд занимается откормом и продажей скота, а его жена занимается переработкой и продажей молока. Махмуд кредитуется пол года. Когда он пришел в первый раз брать кредит, у него было малое количество скота. Сейчас у Махмуда немного увеличилось количество мелко рогатого скота. У его жены только одна дойная корова. Махмуд планирует купить для своей жены еще одну дойную корову с теленком, и он благодарен нашим кредиторам за помощь в осуществлении его планов.
texts.en:
Makhmud is thirty years old. He is married and the father of two children. He has a higher education. Makhmud works fattening and selling livestock. His wife works processing and selling milk. Makhmud has been taking out loans for half a year. When he came to take out a loan for the first time, he had few animals. Now, Makhmud has increased the number of animals in his flock. His wife has only one milk cow. Makhmud plans to buy one more milk cow and calf for his wife, and it is grateful to our lenders for help in bringing his plans to fruition.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fattening and selling livestock

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Huệ Nguyễn Thị (227080539) is a 46-year-old female living in the town of Gia Lộc. She is married and has two school-aged children.

Huệ owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,200,000 VND a month.

In 2008, Huệ joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase pig-feed and other supplies.

Huệ is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be her 2nd from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Davlat

texts.en:
G. Davlat is 28 years old. Together with his wife he has three children. Davlat is an experienced bread baker. He has been doing this business for more than 4 years. He is baking the traditional bread, “lepeshka,” at home. His wife helps him with his business.

Having many customers, Davlat is selling the majority of his products just from his home. He is also running a stand in the central local market for selling ”lepeshka”. Now Davlat requests 5000 Somoni in order to purchase flour wholesale, as required for his business. Davlat is grateful for all supporting him and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing flour  wholesale for  “lepeshka”

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene E. is from the village of Dabong-dabong, Valencia, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old, is separated from her spouse, and has three school-aged children. Arlene owns and operates a service-based business, providing beauty services like manicure and pedicure to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In July 2009, Arlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand a cafe

loans.name: Khady Seck

texts.fr: khady seck D. est membre de la caisse de yoff depuis mars 2003.elle s'active dans le domaine du commerce et gere une mercerie non loin de la caisse depuis plus de cinq ans.elle sollicite un credit de cent mille(100 000)frs afin de renforcer son stock de marchandise.l'evolution croissante de ses benefice pourra lui permettre d'augmenter son capital de roulement.
texts.en:
Khady Seck D. has been a member of the Yoff bank since March 2003. She is active is the domain of commerce, and she has been managing a sewing supplies store, not far from the bank, for over five years. She’s requesting a loan of 100,000 francs in order to bolster her stock of merchandise. The growing progression of her profits will enable her to increase her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Joseph Kahato

texts.en:
Joseph is 52 years old and married with six children. He specializes in charcoal buying and resale. He lives with his family in Dagoretti, Nairobi, which is also where his charcoal business is based. He has been in the business for about one year and his profit has been rising steadily in this period.

Joseph does not have a previous credit history with any other MFI and was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by a friend. This will be his first loan. He wants to use the money to buy charcoal to add to his current stock. In the futture Joseph hopes to have a bigger charcoal wholesale store.

About KADET
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of microentrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. You can obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more charcoal stock for resale

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La señora Irma socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” del centro poblado de Pusuyo del Distrito de Ilave, Provincia de el Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene 04 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Pusuyo, estudio educación secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 2 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado ovino.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 600.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino, para engorde y luego comercializarlos en la feria de la zona.

Su mayor deseo es aumentar su capital para poner una granja de aves de corral.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones donde comparte con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
Irma is a member of the Gregoria Apaza Communal Bank in the Pusuyo community center in the Ilave district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 40, married, and has four children. She lives in the Pusuyo community. She has a high school education. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for almost two years. Her initial loan was for 300 PEN, which allowed her to increase the capital in her business of buying and selling sheep. She currently needs a new loan for 600 PEN, which will allow her to buy sheep to fatten. Later she will sell them at the regional fair. Her biggest wish is to increase her capital to be able to establish a poultry farm. She likes the meetings where she shares with her colleagues.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila M. is 30 years old and living a simple life with her family in Villa Concepcion, Cauayan City, which is a rural area. She is married to Mr. Daniel M., who works as a farmer. They have been married for almost five years and are blessed with two healthy children: Jordan, a 4-year-old preschooler, and Junella Joy, who is only 1 year old.

Mila has been a fruits and vegetable vendor for almost four months. She sells bananas and some root crops in their village, where she earns a weekly net income of 600 Philippine pesos. With her desire to have additional capital for her vending business to provide for her family's needs, she applied for a loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos from ASKI through Kiva lenders. She hopes that Kiva lenders will grant her loan immediately for her to maintain the business.

loans.use: Additional capital for fruits and vegetables vending

loans.name: Humbertina De Jesus

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Paz se formo en la ciudad de Cuenca,  ésta es una ciudad muy rica por su cultura y tradiciones como los días de los santos inocentes, el pase del niño viajero, entre otras, costumbres que atraen al turista nacional y extranjero. Sus integrantes  son un grupo de personas que se unieron para buscar mejoras sociales y económicas logrando consolidar una gran amistad, respeto  y ayuda mutua para salir adelante con sus familias.

La señora  Humbertina Muñoz es una socia activa del banco  comunal La Paz, ella vive en el barrio las Peñas por el sector de Miraflores con su hija de 20 años que es la única soltera de siete hermanos, Humbertina tiene 64 años de edad está  divorciada desde hace cuatro años por que su esposo la abandono. Fruto del esfuerzo de toda una vida logró construir su casa propia.

Humbertina se dedica a la crianza de pollos lleva cuatro años trabajando en este negocio asegura que le va muy bien, sus pollos los vende en pie y pelados  entregando en las tiendas de su localidad o los vende  en los mercados de la ciudad.

Nuestra socia  lleva tres años trabajando con los  prestamos de la fundación todo este tiempo ha invertido en su negocio y  con el  nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR, le entregue lo va a invertir en la compra de mas pollos, comida y vitaminas para su crianza e incrementar su criadero, así como para la compra de  algunos utensilios para su hogar.

El  sueño de Humbertina  es  ver a sus hijos gozar de una situación tranquila en su vida matrimonial y  económica.
texts.en:
The communal bank La Paz formed in Cuenca, a city very rich in culture and traditions, such as Los Dias de Los Santos Inocentes and El Pase del Nino Viajero (religious holidays around Christmas time), among others. These are customs that attract national and foreign tourists. The members of the bank are a group of people that united in order to seek social and economic improvements, thereby managing to strengthen a great friendship, respect, and mutual help in order for them and their families to get ahead. Mrs. Humbertina Muñoz is an active partner of La Paz. She lives in the neighborhood Las Peñas, in the sector of Miraflores, with her 20-year-old daughter, who is the only single one of seven siblings. Humbertina is 64 years old and has been divorced for four years, since her husband left her. Through her life-long efforts, she managed to build her own house. Humbertina makes a living raising chickens. She has been working in this business for four years and she assures that it is going very well for her. She sells her chickens plucked, delivering them to the stores in her town, or selling them in the city's markets. Our partner has been working with loans from this foundation for three years, all this time investing in her business. With the new credit that FUNDACION ESPOIR provides her, she will invest in the purchase of more chickens, food and vitamins for raising them, and will expand her farm, as well as purchase a few utensils for her home. Humbertina's dream is to see her children enjoy a laid-back situation in their married life, as well as economically.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chickens, food and vitamins for raising them, and utensils for her home

loans.name: Sabanoh United Group

texts.en:
Hawa K., Marie C., Gbassay K., Kadiatu K., and Marie S. chose the name Sabanoh United for their newly-formed loan group. These borrowers are seeking a loan in the amount of 2,500,000 SLL ($650) via SMT and Kiva lenders to expand their businesses, increase their incomes, and improve their standards of living.

Hawa (pictured on the left) is the group’s leader, and she is a 53-year-old mother of nine children. Three of her children are on their own, while four of her children attend primary and secondary schools. For 31 years now, Hawa has been selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil) to earn a living, and she hopes that her share of the group’s loan will allow her to expand this operation and increase her income.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional palm oil

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea se dedica una pulpería desde hace mucho tiempo a esta actividad económica, como es la compra y venta de ropa por lo que le gusta mucho su actividad económica pues disfruta mucho de comunicarse con sus clientes y además le gusta viajar a comprar los productos necesarios que sus clientes le solicitan. Con el apoyo de su esposo se siente muy apoyada ya que tiene que ir al mercado en busca de sus productos. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan, galletas entre otras cosas. Su deseo es mantener esta actividad económica que es la fuente ingresos necesarios para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Andrea has worked in a general store for a long time. What she likes about her business is the buying and selling of clothes. She enjoys talking with her customers, and also traveling to buy the necessary products that her customers want. With her husband’s support, she feels very comfortable since she has to go to the market to find the merchandise. She is asking for this loan for capital for her work. It will be used to buy candy, natural drinks, bread, cookies, etc. Her wish is to keep this business going so that she has the income to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Akua

texts.fr: Cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente des denrées alimentaires dans le quartier d’Agoè Cacavéli à Lomé. Elle a débuté ce commerce depuis 2003 à Lomé et cette activité lui permet d’aider financièrement son mari dans l’éducation de leurs 02 enfants. Elle vend des tomates naturelles, des gombos, des piments, du riz, de l’arachide et divers autres produits. En ce moment elle voudrait avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 03 paniers de tomates, 01 panier de gombos, 01 panier de piment, 02 sacs de riz, 01 sac d’arachide et divers autres produits.
texts.en:
This woman generates her income through the sale of food staples in the Agoè Cacavéli quarter of Lomé. She entered this business in 2003 in Lomé, and it enables her to give her husband financial support for the education of their two children. She sells natural tomatoes, okra, chilli peppers, rice, peanuts and various other products. She is currently seeking a loan from WAGES in order to buy three baskets of tomatoes, a basket of okra, another of chilli peppers, two sacks of rice, one sack of peanuts and various other products.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of tomatoes, okra, chilli peppers, rice, peanuts and various other products

loans.name: Modesta Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Yolanda es casada, tiene 47 y 4 hijos, Yolanda vende zapatos y zapatillas, sus ventas los realiza a pedido en diferentes lugares y son al crédito su cobranza los realiza diariamente, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Yolanda necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatos.
Yolanda sueña que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una tienda de zapatos.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Triumph Communal Bank. Yolanda is married, 47 years old and has 4 children.Yolanda sells shoes and slippers. She takes credit orders for her sales in different places and collects payments daily. She acquires her products in the city of Lima. Yolanda needs a loan of 1600 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of shoes. Yolanda hopes that her children will become professionals and that she will have a shoe store someday.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Repair vehicle used to transport passengers

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 28 years old, married to Edith Auma, and they have a one-year-old child. He has been in the vehicle repair business since 2001.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the cash to buy fiberglass and special glue for vehicle repair.

His future dream is to open a new, bigger workshop so that he can serve more clients.

loans.use: To buy fiberglass and glue for use in his business

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 32 year old, single lady who operates a wholesale shop where she sells polythene papers and sweets. Her business has been running for five years and she has employed one person. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya her business has been growing because she has increased her stock. She has requested a loan of KES 50,000 to buy polythene papers and sweets. She hopes to open a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock of polythene and sweets

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: Maria Eugenia cuenta con 33 años de edad y su esposo con 51 años de edad respectivamente, ambos son casados y cuentan con 3 hijos que estudian en el nivel de primaria y secundaria, la vivienda que actualmente habitan es propia. Maria Eugenia se dedica bastante a su negocio principal que es la venta de comidas contando con pensionados seguros en una hacienda ganadera, donde su esposo trabaja como encargado del mismo percibiendo un sueldo mensual además de contar con dos moto taxis que le generan renta diaria. Ambos cuentan con más de 6 años en sus respectivos rubros. Estas actividades que desarrollan, dentro de su entorno no tiene competencia, porque su clientela es segura. Maria Eugenia destino el crédito para compra de una moto, misma que le permitirá contar con otros ingresos. Maria Eugenia  y su esposo cuentan con 4 operaciones en nuestra institución  con buen comportamiento de pagos y no tienen deudas en otras instituciones ni con terceros.
texts.en:
Maria Eugenia is 33 years old. Her husband is 51. They are married and have three children who are in primary and secondary school. They own the house where they live. Maria Eugenia sells food for a living and relies on her husband's stable monthly salary, which he earns working as a ranch manager. Additionally, the couple owns two mototaxis they use to generate daily income. They have more than six years of experience in their respective fields. They have no competition in their businesses because they have a steady customer base. Maria Eugenia designated the loan for the purchase of a motorbike, which will allow her to supplement her income. Maria Eugenia and her husband have four operations with our institution and a good repayment history. They have no debts with other institutions or third parties.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a motorbike

loans.name: Wilson's Group

texts.en: Wilson T. is from Barangay Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 49 years old and is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Wilson is married and has three school-aged children. He owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over nine years and earns approximately 45,000 PHP during harvest season, which is every five months. In 2009, Wilson joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Wilson is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be his second from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Elvis

texts.en:
Elvis T., 35, and his wife Irene have three children. He makes sure that he provides well so that the family can have a better life. He manages a mini grocery and also sells school supplies.

Elvis has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. He regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays his weekly dues consistently. Because of his good repayment performance with his previous loans, he was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  He uses the money he borrows to expand and improve his businesses.

Now, with your help, he would like to apply for a Php 40,000 loan. This will be used as added capital for his expanding business by buying products needed to replenish and sustain his inventory. He dreams that his business will continue to grow so that he can provide for his children’s education until they finish their degrees. 


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying products needed to replenish and sustain his inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more Garri (cassava flakes) to sell

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El Sr. Felix V. L. tiene 30 años, es soltero, vive en zona Londo, comunidad de Sativañes que se encuentra en la provincia de Capinota, del departamento de Cochabamba.

El Sr. Felix tiene problemas de en sus extremidades inferiores, razón por la cual no puede desempeñar sus labores con normalidad, por suerte cuenta con el apoyo de su familia y en particular de su madre, quien le ayuda con el cuidado del ganado vacuno, el a pesar de su impedimento no se ha rendido se da modos para trabajar pero la vida en la granja es difícil pues no puede trasladarse de un lugar a otro sin ayuda, el Sr. Felix es un ejemplo de persona luchadora, no se siente derrotado con su impedimento, se desplaza de un lugar a otro, el ordeña muchas veces a las vacas solo, y madre le ayuda con la comercialización, pues se lo lleva al pueblo para vender. El Sr. Felix quedo con este problema a raíz de un accidente de tránsito cuando tenía 9 años, se lesiono la columna vertebral, y después de varios diagnósticos, los doctores no pudieron darle una solución oportuna. Ahora si bien el S. Felix no se desplaza con normalidad se ha dado modos para poder realizar todas sus actividades.

El Sr. Felix se ha solicitado el Crédito para poder comprar, una cabeza de ganado vacuno y alimento balanceado, el a pesar de su discapacidad, tienen la visión de poder triunfar en la vida como ganadero, y ha demostrado que hasta el momento lo ha estado haciendo muy bien, siempre con el apoyo de su familia, y de sus padres, que aunque son personas de la tercera edad siempre están con él.
texts.en:
Felix V. L., 30, lives in Londo, Sativañes which is located in Capinota province, Cochabamba department. Felix has problems with his lower extremities so he can’t do his chores normally; fortunately, his family, especially his mother, helps him care for his cattle. Despite his disabilities he hasn’t given up and finds ways to work even though farming is very difficult for him because he can’t get from one place to another without assistance. Felix is a fighter, he doesn’t let himself be defeated by his handicap; he moves from place to place, often milks the cows by himself. His mother helps with the sales because the milk has to be taken to another town to be sold. Felix has been in this condition since a traffic accident at the age of 9; he hurt his spinal column and, after many diagnoses, doctors were unable to provide him with a timely solution. However, notwithstanding Felix’s not being able to get around normally, he has found ways to perform all his activities. Felix has asked for funds to buy a head of cattle and nutritionally balanced animal feed. Despite his disability, he sees himself being able to succeed in life as a cattleman and, to date has shown that indeed he can; always with help from his parents who, although they are now senior citizens, are always by his side.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle and nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Kounta

texts.fr: Monsieur Kounta N. est un gérant de boulangerie à Guediawaye. Il  a une activité très diversifiées. Il est  commerçant  et en même  temps  technicien en construction métallique. Il est âgé de 30ans et habite dans le quartier de Wakhinane.Il  est sociétaire  de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis 4 ans et a déjà bénéficié  de 4 prêts  antérieurs. Monsieur N. est propriétaire d’une place au marche ou il commercialise des denrées  alimentaires comme les pommes de terre, les oignons et différents condiments utilises par les femmes dans la préparation  des repas quotidiens.  Ainsi il est très souvent seconde par sa mère et son frère  dans la gestion de son commerce surtout pendant les moments de fête  ou les produits sont très sollicites. Par conséquent  il emprunte 500 000 frs destines a l’achat de denrées  pour mieux renforcer son stock.  Ce financement lui permettra de maintenir le bon fonctionnement  de ses activités commerciales et de mieux gérer l’épanouissement  financier de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Kounta N. manages a bakery in Guediawaye. He has a very diverse business. He is the shopkeeper and metal constructor technician at the same time. He is 30 years old and lives in the Wakhinane quarter. He has been a member of Baye Laye bank for four years and has already received four previous loans. Mr. N. is the owner of a stall at the market where he trades foodstuff like potatoes, onions, and different condiments used by women for preparing everyday meals. He is also often second-in-command to his mother and brother in the management of his business, especially during holidays when his products are in demand. Thus, he is borrowing 500,000 frs for the purchase of foodstuff to increase his stock. These finances will allows him to ensure his business runs well and to better manage his family's development.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of working capital

loans.name: Ul

texts.en:
Ul C., 20, is married and resides with her husband and a young child in Takeo Province, Cambodia – an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. C. sells sugar cane juice and has an income of $3 US per day. Her husband is a blacksmith, earning about $6 US per day to help cover the family's expenses. 

C. is requesting a loan of $1,200 US to purchase more equipment to expand the blacksmith business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. C.'s mother appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy more equipment to expand a blacksmith business

loans.name: Panha

texts.en:
Mrs. Panha O. is 37 years old, and her husband, Mr. Sophak Thor, is 38 years old. They were married in 2003 and have two sons. One of their sons attends school, and the other son is still young. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Panha has just started a business selling food in her village this year. In the past, she was a garment factory worker. Her husband is a driver; he drives for a private school in Phnom Penh. Panha and her husband do not have their own house, and they stay with their parents.

Therefore, Panha is applying for a loan in the mount of 1,000 USD to add to her own money in order to build a house.

loans.use: To add to her own money in order to build a house

loans.name: Terere Ole

texts.en:
Terere Ole M. is 43 years old. He is a married to Noorayiani M. and the father of three children. Terere is a farmer. He has farmed his own piece of land for the last fifteen years.

He learned about KADET through a friend who is already a registered member. This will be his first loan. He he is planning to spend ten thousand on harrowing, twenty thousand on seeds, and ten thousand on planting five acres of wheat. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Terere dream is do large-scale farming and attain financial independence. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: To harrow his field, buy seeds, and plant wheat

loans.name: Guillermina Del Carmen

texts.es: El señor C. N. reside en el Municipio de Catarina, labora en la alcaldía de la misma localidad como adminisionista  en el Mirador, con el salario que gana mantiene a su familia, el ahorita solicita un crédito con CEPRODEL para solventas unos gastos personales que le salieron y no quiere mandar su imagen  ya que es una persona muy responsable.
texts.en:
Mr. C. N. lives in the Catarina municipality. He works for the city as an admission clerk at El Mirador. With his salary he supports his family. He is now requesting a loan with CEPRODEL to pay for some personal expenses that came up. He does not want to send his picture. He is a very responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato C. is from the village of Lubid, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 41 years old, married, and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, he provides waste management services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating tricycle transport services. He is just starting this business and already earned $100.

In 2008, Renato joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to repair an existing engine. 

Renato is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be his 2nd loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Rosejean

texts.en:
This is Rosejean B., 33, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Zacarias B., a driver, and is the mother of a youngster of high school age. By the grace of God, Rosejean has managed to support her child’s schooling and is working hard to be able to send her child all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Rosejean; she, herself, has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.

With her husband, Rosejean operates a fleet of jeepneys (small buses) and tricycles. Together, they manage finances, find drivers for the jeepneys and tricycle, collect money and basically heed every concern of their drivers about the vehicles. Zacarias also drives one of the jeepneys.

To help her continue operations of her business, Rosejean is requesting a Php 16,000 loan. She will use the loan to manage repair needs of the vehicles and legal follow-ups like licenses and registrations. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Rosejean dreams of being able to give her child a good and high-quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets every week with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To manage the repair needs of her vehicles and pay licenses and registrations

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es: La Sra. Dionicia  es cliente de nuestra institución 12 años se dedica a la venta de comida en el mercado de la Zona donde vive, la Sra. Dionicia es la única vendedora de comida del mencionado  mercado, ocupa como tres puestos de venta tiene una muy buena venta  razón por la cual atiende con la ayuda de una de sus hijas, descanso 4 años y retorna ahora nuevamente, su esposo es chofer asalariado y por las noches trabaja  como portero del mismo  mercado, la Sra. Dionicia necesita proveerse de abarrotes por quintales por el incremento de los mismos y una parte utilizara para la construcción de su vivienda, razón por la cual  solicita este financiamiento kiva.
texts.en:
Ms. Dionicia has been a client of Emprender for 12 years. She sells food in the market near where she lives. Ms. Dionicia is the only food vendor in the aforementioned market. She occupies three stands and makes very good sales, so her daughters help her tend the business. She took a break for four years and now she is returning again. Her husband is a salaried driver and at night he works as a doorman at the same market. Ms. Dionicia is requesting this Kiva loan because she needs to buy groceries in bulk to increase her sales. She will also use part of the loan for construction on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy groceries in bulk, and to buy doors for construction on her house

loans.name: Jenny Beatriz

texts.es:
Jenny de 25 años, tiene una tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso y caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y  ecología en disolución. 

Su esposo emigro a España para tener mas oportunidades laborables cuando el consiguió trabajo le envío dinero a Jenny para que tenga su propio negocio, con el capital de trabajo compro víveres para tener una pequeña tienda. Poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido aumentar su tienda con víveres y pollos. Trabaja de lunes a domingo en su tienda. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, pollos y azúcar para su negocio. En el futuro quiere comprar un terreno para construir una casa para la mama.
texts.en:
Jenny is 25 years old and has a store in the front part of her house. She lives in an area outside the central city called Paraíso, which is characterized by dirt paths and a deteriorating ecology. 

Her husband emigrated to Spain to have more work opportunities. When he obtained work, he sent money to Jenny so that she could have her own business. With this working capital, she bought groceries in order to establish a small store. Little by little, with much effort, she was able to expand her store to include produce and chickens. She works in her store from Monday through Sunday. 

With the loan, she wants to buy rice, chickens and sugar for her business. In the future, she would like to buy a piece of land to construct a home for her mother.

loans.use: Buying rice, chickens and sugar

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr: Cette femme est âgée de 35 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce d’articles de mercerie. Elle a une ancienneté de 2 ans dans ce commerce et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. Actuellement elle sollicite de WAGES son troisième crédit pour accroître son stock et pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de fin d’année. Le crédit sollicité va lui servir à acheter 2 rouleaux de satin, 2 rouleaux de  ozanga et divers autres articles de mercerie.
texts.en: This woman is 35 years old, married and the mother of two. She makes a living by selling dry goods. She has been in this business for two years, stocking up at the big market of Lomé. Her customer base is very diverse. She is seeking a third loan from WAGES in order to increase her stock and better respond to the customer demand at the end of the year. This loan will be used to purchase two rolls of satin, two roles of [organza?] cloth and various small items.

loans.use: Purchasing dry goods

loans.name: Annabella

texts.en:
Annabella B. is from the village of Poblacion 3, Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Annabella is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Annabella owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products such as canned goods, some food for snacks, noodles, eggs, salt, sugar and other daily use products in the local community. Annabella has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Annabella joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annabella has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Annabella is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Annabella from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.
