*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah M. lives in the Kyebando Nsooba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 3 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members.   

Sarah has a business selling second-hand clothes.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.   Sarah sells her products door-to-door, by means of retail.      

Sarah has requested a loan of 400000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand clothes.   She also generates additional income through room rentals.

The main business challenges for   Sarah   include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and start importing clothes. 

Sarah lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes to resell

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Um P., 59, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known as the most populated city in the country. P. is a housewife and her three children are all employed at the factories, earning an income of about USD 3 each per day to help cover the family expenses. P. has to spend USD 47 on food, USD 10 on electricity and water, and USD 10 on other necessary expenses every month. P. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for the family use. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family use

location.town: Mean Chey District, Phnom Penh City

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco Báez de 71 años de edad, vive con su esposa Daysi Calero en la Colonia el Serrano, donde tiene su finca con buenas condiciones técnicas para el desarrollo de su inventario ganadero, realiza actividades pecuarias, agricolas y sobre todo Ganadera, a pesar de ser una persona de la tercera edad se dedica con esmero y sabe cuidar y manejar su inventario y sus bienes; este señor cuenta con Liderezgo en la Zona por ser bien querido y ademas tiene una hija (Concepcion B. Calero) la cual es profesional, labora para Finca Nicaragua como asesor de credito, por tanto en conjunto coolaboran con los gastos Familiares y de esta manera ha venido creciendo en su invetario; Don Francisco ha obtenido creditos de parte de nuestra Institucion los cuales ha cancelado en tiempo y forma y a la vez agradece estos Financiamiento por que le han servido de mucho en su vida.  

Solicita desimo crédito, a la institución de AFODENIC mediente Kiva  para compra de ternero desarrollo.  

Y Sueña con ser una que su Hija tenga su propia familia y gocen de buena Salud.
texts.en:
Francisco Báez is 71 and lives with his wife Daysi Calero in the Colonia el Serrano, where he has a farm that is ripe for the technical development of his inventory of cattle, pigs, and crops.  Although he is a senior citizen, he works hard and knows how to care for and manage his livestock and goods. He is a Leader of the Zone because he is so well-liked.  He also has a daughter, Concepcion B. Calero, who is a professional who works for Finca Nicaragua as a credit assessor.  They all cooperate and share the family expenses, and in this way have been able to build up the farm's inventory.  Don Francisco has obtained previous credits from microfinance partner AFODENIC, which he has paid off promptly and which have helped him greatly.

This is his tenth credit with AFODENIC through Kiva.   He will use it to buy development land.  He hopes his daughter will have her own family one day and that they will all enjoy good health.

loans.use: Compra de Terneros de Desarrollo

loans.name: Deolita

texts.en:
Deolita V. is from the town of Surallah. She is 40 years-old and unmarried.  To make a living, Deolita owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Deolita also raises some chickens. 

Deolita joined Kiva partner CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Deolita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Deolita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed and medicine. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase feed and medicine.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa L. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 50 years old. Rosa is married. To make a living, Rosa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rosa currently earns approximately 4500 PHP from farming.

Rosa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosa has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rosa is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a married woman who lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a furniture making business. Her husband, Edgar M., 40 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living. They have 5 children aged between 4 and 17 years old.

Delia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2010 because she hoped for something better for her family. With the help of her past 2 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon and her own efforts, Delia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 3rd loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to fund her business operations in order to save up for her children's education. Delia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to fund business operations

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites M. is from the village of Jampason, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 44 years old. Marites is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, toothpaste and beverages in the local community. Marites has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marites joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Marites is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like beverages and snack foods. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marites from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like beverages and snack foods

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao C., age 54, is a local farmer who lives in the province of Kompong Tom, a good territory for farming. He is a married man who is devoted to his three married children – two of whom are working in a variety of occupations to earn their daily income. 

Mao C. owns a big farm that he inherited from his grandmother. He grows various crops on it. He is able to plant the crops at least twice a year. 

Dry weather is expected in the beginning of this year, and it may affect Mao C.’s business. He faces a difficult season if he is not able to irrigate his crops.   Sok Pom is taking out this loan to purchase a machine to pump water for his crops. He hopes to use the remainder of funds to grow a soy bean crop. 

Mao C. and his wife are pictured on the photo.

loans.use: To purchase water pump and grows a soy bean crop

loans.name: Khem

texts.en: Khem T., 50, has been earning a daily profit by selling fish. She always sells the fish that her husband gives her or that she buys from her wholesale suppliers. The family typically generates a revenue of US $8 each day, and they have been in their business for nearly ten years. Her husband is 50 years old and is a fisherman who works along a local river. Some of the family’s fishing equipment has cracked, affecting their ability to fish effectively and frequently. Therefore, Khem T. has decided to seek a loan to buy new fishing equipment to replace the old broken gear.

loans.use: to buy new fishing equipment to replace the old broken equipment

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.ar: محمود في عمر 36 سنة متزوج وله ولدان يعمل سائق تاكسي له في هذا العمل 10 سنوات يحب العمل بجد ونشاط يريد ان يؤمن العيش الكريم لعائلته يريد ان يزيد من مدخوله وان يطور العمل له زبائن من محيطه واقاربه يعاني من بعض المصاعب في العمل وخاصة المصاعب المادية حيث يسعى بان يكون عمله دائما في تجدد ولكن الصعوبة المادية تقف عائق في وجهه يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى صيانة السيارة + شراء بطارية
texts.en: Mahmood is 36 years old and married with two children. He works as a taxi driver and has for the past ten years. He likes to work hard. He would like to secure a good life for his family, and therefore he wants to increase his income by developing his business. He has customers from his community and from among his relatives. He struggles with certain difficulties, in particular, material difficulties, which hinder his repeated efforts to develop his business. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he wishes to have maintenance work done on his taxi as well as to buy a new car battery.

loans.use: to buy a new car battery for and maintain his taxi.

loans.name: Mary  Moige

texts.en:
Mary Moige O. is 41 years old and married to a man named Keneddy. They have five children. 

For six years, Mary has been managing a posho mill as a primary business. She also runs a dairy and keeps poultry. She earns a monthly income of 15,500 Kenyan shillings (KES).     


Mary learned about KADET LTD through a friend, and she is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan amount to buy poultry feed as well as cereals to grind into flour to sell.

Mary intends to use the anticipated profit to save and plow back into the business. In the future, she plans to grow her business and be able to give her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy cereals like maize to grind into flour to sell, and also to buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa works hard to support her family. Ninfa is married and has a business buying and selling ready to wear clothing in the Philippines.

Ninfa requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock like pants, t-shirts, shorts, etc to sell.

Ninfa has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Ninfa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Erotida

texts.es:
Erotida es una mujer D. 56 años D. edad, que resiD. junto a su esposo en el caserío Guaraguaos Alto ubicado en el distrito D. TambogranD. – Piura. La clienta vive en la parte rural D. este distrito y cuenta con servicio D. luz.

La actividad que desarrolla Erotida es la venta D. productos domésticos (como arroz, agua, leche, azúcar, golosinas) desD. una  bodega instalada en su propio domicilio, Erotida,  atienD. permanentemente a  las personas D. su comunidad, quienes ya se han establecido como sus clientes fijos.

Además D. esto,  desD. hace 3 años Erotida se dedica a la crianza D. aves D. corral (patos, pavos, gallinas) y también cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona.

Su esposo trabaja como inspector D. transportes para la Municipalidad D. TambogranD. y con las ganancias obtenidas D. estas tres actividades sostienen el hogar.

Erotida solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo D. 1000 nuevos soles que repartirá entre la compra D. mercadería para su bodega (arroz  y azúcar) y la compra D. alimento balanceado para las aves que cría.

La familia D. Erotida cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales, laborales y crediticias.
texts.en:
Erotida is a 56-year-old woman who lives with her husband in the village of Guaraguaos Alto, which is located in the District of TambogranD.-Piura. She resides in the rural section of this district and receives electricity service.

Erotida has a store in her home where she sells household products such as rice, water, milk, sugar, and candy. She regularly attends to the people of her community since they have already become established customers.

In addition to this business, Erotida raises poultry (ducks, turkeys, and chickens) and also has established customers in the area for these products.

Her husband works as a vehicle inspector for the city of TambogranD.. With the earnings generated from these three activities, Erotida and her husband are able to maintain their household.

She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN. She will diviD. the loan between acquiring merchandise for her store (such as rice and sugar) and purchasing balanced feed for the birds that she raises. Erotida and her family have good personal, work-related, and credit references.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store and feed for her animals.

loans.name: Edita María

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Marianita de Jesús.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Edita, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos ya todos mayores de edad, una de sus hijas vive en su casa con el esposo y tres hijos pequeños. Su marido se dedica a la albañilería.

Ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de comidas rápidas, vende los deliciosos  corviches y empanadas de verde, también elabora deliciosos helados  de varios sabores. Trabaja todos los días, en la  mañana se dedica a elaborar todos sus productos y  luego en las tardes instala su negocio en las afueras de sus casa, allí ella todas las tardes vende sus productos hasta las  19h00  o hasta que se termine lo que preparo. Realiza esta actividad por más de 10 años y nos cuenta que le va muy bien ya que con esto ella le ayuda a su esposo en la dura tarea de mantener el hogar.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar cuatro sillas y una mesa para darles más comodidades a sus clientes, además de materiales tales como maní, plátano y especias para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el  Banco Comunal hace 4 ciclos y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe del banco. 

Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
The beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez is known for its beaches, its rich cuisine, and the warmth of its people. It is in this place that the members of the Communal Bank “Marianita de Jesús” meet every fifteen days.

This is Sra. Edita. She is 57 years old, married, and has five adult children. One of her daughters lives at her house along with her husband and their three young children. Edita’s husband works as a bricklayer.

She has a business selling fast food, such as delicious “ceviches” (marinated seafood cocktails) and vegetable empanadas. Edita also prepares tasty ice cream in different flavors. She works every day. In the morning, she prepares all types of foods and then conducts her business in the afternoons away from her home. She sells her products until 7pm or when she runs out what she has prepared. Edita has been in business for more than 10 years and says that she has done very well. As a result, she has been able to help her husband with the difficult task of maintaining their home.

This loan will be used to purchase four chairs and a table so that her customers will be more comfortable. In addition, she will buy supplies such as peanuts, plantains, and spices used in preparing her dishes. Edita has been with the Communal Bank for four loan cycles and enjoys the benefits she has received.

Her dreams are to continue working and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: to purchase four chairs, a table, peanuts, plantains, and spices.

loans.name: Fuerza Del Mañana (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Fuerza del Mañana está formado por 8 mujeres y un hombre, son personas muy trabajadoras que laboran en diferentes actividades con un fin común, que es mejorar la economía de sus hogares y un mejor futuro a sus familias. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, se caracteriza por su belleza colonial y natural, tiene una gran variedad en su gastronomía la misma que cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente es calida y amable.

Para la Señora. Marcia este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue  invitada por su vecina. Tiene 25 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad y en la actualidad está en el octavo mes de embarazo de su tercer hijo, su hijo mayor estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora prestando sus servios en una empresa privada, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Marcia hace 5 meses ha iniciado al negocio de venta de cosméticos Yanbal se dedica a la venta de domingo a domingo sin horarios ya que también cuida de sus hijos que aun son pequeños.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más productos de Yanbal como  perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.

La foto pequeña adjunta es de una de las socias que por motivos de trabajo no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The “Fuerza del Mañana” (Tomorrow’s Strength) communal bank is composed of 8 women and 1 man.  They are very hard working people who are in a variety of activities with a common purpose which is to improve the economy of their homes and provide a better future for their families.  They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca.  This city is the country’s third most important.  It is notable for its colonial and natural beauty.  It has a varied cuisine which excites the taste buds of both locals and foreigners alike.  Its people are warm and kind.

This is the first loan Marcia has had in the communal bank which she was invited to join by her neighbor.  She’s 25 years old, married and has two children who are 6 and 2 years of age.  She is currently 8 months pregnant with her third child.  Her oldest son goes to a little local school in the city.  Her husband’s a driver and works for a private firm.  They do not have a house of their own; they are renters.

Marcia started selling Yanbal brand cosmetics five months ago.  She sells Sunday to Sunday without a fixed schedule since she also cares for her children who are still little.

She is going to use the money from her loan to buy more Yanbal products like perfumes, creams, cosmetics and costume jewelry.  Her dream is to have a house of her own.

The small inserted photo is of one of the members who because of work wasn’t able to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy Yanbal products.

loans.name: Riziki Mupya Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nankafu, représentante du groupe d’affaire « Riziki Mupya »,  est entrepreneur, âgée de 47 ans, mariée, mère de 13 enfants, tous étudient, parmi lequel, il y a des juristes  avocats et des universitaires. Elle est vendeuse de friperie et distributeur agrégée des  cartes des unités de téléphone cellulaire. Son mari est un haut fonctionnaire de la Régie de voies ariennes (RVA). Elle étale ses marchandise  au long de la route, à l’entrée de la douane RD Congo-Rwanda. Il y a 15 ans révolus qu’elle exerce cette activité. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  10 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  2 ballons de friperies.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Riziki Mupya» est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en: Nankafu is a client who represents the Riziki Mupya group. She is a 47 year old businesswoman, married and mother to 13 children all of whom are students and among whom there are solicitors, lawyers, and university students. She is a second hand clothes shopkeeper and accredited distributer of mobile phone cards. Her husband is a high ranking government official of the State Airways Agency (RVA).She lays out her merchandise at the roadside, at the entry to the RD Congo-Rwanda customs post. She has been practicing this activity for fifteen years. However, she has just reached the end of a cycle of 10 loans with the Hekima credit organisation. This new loan will enable her to purchase two balls of second hand clothing. In addition she intends to send her children to school. The client is grateful to Hekima for their actions in favour of poor women who are excluded from classic banking institutions. It should be noted that the Riziki Mupya business group is largely composed of women.

loans.use: to purchase  two balls of second hand clothing.

loans.name: Madeline

texts.en:
Madeline is 21 years old, single, and lives in the small village of Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living, Madeline sells personal care and beauty products. She has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns PHP 6,700 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 at GDMPC to purchase personal care and beauty products to sell.

Madeline has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Madeline hopes to gain more income from her business and have a personal care and beauty products shop.

loans.use: To purchase personal care and beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon, age 41, is married to Ann and blessed with three children between 8 and 15 years old. He does horticulture farming and has been doing it for 10 years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES 200,000.

This is his third loan from KADET LTD and he has a good credit history. He will use the funds to buy pesticides and other chemicals for his flowers. Simon intends to use the anticipated profits to open a shop for his wife and hopes to export the flowers in the future.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and chemicals

loans.name: Kaken

texts.en:
Kaken, 61, is a resident of Tup. She is married to a farmer and together they have six grown children. In the year of 2000, the family sold all the livestock it owned and bought a small shop to rebuild into a grocery store. They stocked the store and step-by-step, the business flourished. The background history of the business is already 11 years old and still it brings a significant income of 20,000 soms a month. The purpose of the loan is to buy more products like sugar, rice and pasta to sell in their grocery store. The family hopes to broaden the assortment of goods and make more profits. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy more products such as sugar, rice and pasta

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is 37 years old and is married. She has 2 children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City.

Dung's husband earns money by sewing shoes. She earns an income to support her family by running a general store at her house. She intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of food to sell such as eggs, milk and confectionery.

She hope her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy food like eggs, milk and confectionery to sell.

loans.name: Diattou

texts.fr: Madame Diattou est une femme mariée de 46 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Elle s’active dans le secteur du commerce de produits alimentaires et divers tels que lait, savon. Elle exerce aussi la vente de petit déjeuner. Elle a faisait partie d’un groupement qui pratiquait le commerce pendant plusieurs années. C’est ainsi que actuellement elle veuille voler de ses propres ailes. C’est surtout l’aspect lucratif de l’activité qu’elle a choisi qui l’intéresse  le plus. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis février 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 fr prévu pour l’achat de produits alimentaires destinés a la vente. Elle veut acheter en gros pour augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire.  L’augmentation de ses bénéfices lui permettra d’améliorer sa situation sociale.
texts.en: Diattou is a 46-year-old married woman living in Senegal.  She works selling food items and other various items such as milk and soap.  She also sells breakfast meals.  For several years, she was part of a group of people working in sales together, and so now she wants to stand on her own two feet.  For her, the best part of this business is the profitable aspect of it.  She has been a member of one of UIMCEC’s savings and credit unions since February, 2011.  She is asking for a loan of 100,000 francs to purchase food items for retail sale.  She wants to buy wholesale in order to increase her profit margin.  Increasing her profits will enable her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase food items for retail sale

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix nació en la provincia de Paruro del departamento del Cusco y tiene 43 años de edad, él es separado y tiene un hijo.  

Actualmente, Felix vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, él es contadora y tiene un estudio contable. Ya son quince años que se dedica a la contabilidad y le va muy bien. 

En esta oportunidad Felix requiere el préstamo para uso personal específicamente para el estudio de su pequeña hija. 

El Banco Comunal “Comuzone I” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Felix was born in Paruro Province in the Department of Cusco. He is 43 years old, separated from his spouse, and has one child.

Felix currently lives in the city of Cusco, which is where he engages in his business activities. He is an accountant and has an accounting practice. Felix has been in the accounting field for 15 years and has done very well. He is taking this opportunity to request a loan for personal use, specifically to pay for his young daughter’s education.

The Communal Bank “Comuzone I” meets every 30 days in the city of Cusco, Peru. This city is known for being a tourist and business area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's education.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Leonila has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Leonila is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Leonila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Nemat

texts.ru:
Nemat yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione posolok Makhmudlu vmeste so svoyey drujelubnoy semyoy. On jenat i imeyet odnogo rebonka. Nemat 28 let.
Uje 3 qoda kak on zanimayetsay skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Etomu biznessu on nauchislya u svoyego otca kotoriy toje zanimalsya skotovodstvom i razvodil korov. SEychas Nemat nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupir korov dlya uvelciheniya kolichestva skota.
texts.en: Nemat is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Makhmudlu village of the Fuzuli region together with his friendly family.  He is married and has one child.  Nemat is 28 years old.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for three years and breeds cattle.  He learned this business from his father, who used to be involved in animal husbandry and bred cattle too.  Nemat currently needs 2000 AZN to buy cows and increase livestock quantity.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a married man blessed with one child. For the last three years, he has been selling animal feed to make a living. He also does tea farming to increase his saving. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy animal feed for resale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save part of his income.

loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a farmer in Murang'a, Central Kenya where he lives with his family of three children between 11 and 6. He sells his produce of tea, milk and fruits to the local market. He is 42 and has been in active farming for over 10 years. 

Joshua has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to help him buy a motorcycle and venture into the transport business. He says the transport business is currently booming with the government's reduced taxes on motorcycles which has motivated him to make the venture. He says it will also help him make cheap deliveries of his farm produce for better farming returns. 

He notes that farming business is facing challenges due to unpredictable rainfalls.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: An's Group

texts.en:
An is 42 years old and is lives in in Phu Man village, Cho Town, with her husband and two children. For the past five years, she has run a general store where she sells things for the people in her village such as cake, candy, cigarettes, sugar, wine, beer and many other goods. An earns a monthly income of 6,000,000 VND.

An is requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND to buy merchandise to sell with the goal of expanding her business and increasing her profit. This will be her first loan with SEDA.

Hue is the other borrower in this group. She is 45 years old and is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en:
Tuya is 49 years old and lives with her husband and three kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. Her husband is a driver and her oldest kid is employed. Her middle kid is a college student and the youngest one is a school student. 

Tuya started a traditional clothes-sewing business in 2000 by sewing at home. Now she has her own workshop and many regular customers. She says, "Now that winter is approaching, I need to buy some warm material in order to run my business." She is a sharp and hardworking woman and says, "I do everything I can in order to get my kids educated."  She is requesting 600,000 MNT to buy materials from Ulaanbaatar (the capital city of Mongolia).

loans.use: To buy material from Ulaanbaatar.

loans.name: Catalina Wanka Group

texts.es: Sonia  D.  41 años D. edad, mujer luchadora por salir adelante frente a los obstáculos  que se les presenta en L. vida .Sonia es una D. las socias que  conforman L. nueva alcancía comunal Catalina Wanka .Sonia actualmente se dedica  a L. venta D. verduras como tomate, zapallo .apio y demás verduras para las preparación D. comidas . Solicita el préstamo para poder  compra  una refrigeradora para que asi pueda tener en buen estado las verduras .Sonia desea para el futuro tener un local  en el mercado modelo, para así obtener más ingresos y darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad D. vida .En L. foto Sonia viste un polo color anaranjado y tiene puesto un gorro color azul.
texts.en:
Sonia, 41, is a woman who is determined to overcome any obstacle life presents her.  Sonia is one of the members of the new, Catalina Wanka, communal bank.  She currently is a merchant selling vegetables like tomatoes, pumpkin, celery and other vegetables used in food preparation.  

She’s asking for a loan to buy a refrigerator so that she can keep her vegetables in good condition.  In the future, Sonia would like to have a model market to earn more income and proviD. a better quality of life for her children.  In the photo, Sonia is wearing an orange shirt and a blue cap.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 33 years old and married with 4 children.

Analyn works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.  She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Analyn has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more items to sell

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracias a la Señora Idalina, quien se informo sobre el programa de mujeres emprendedoras y luego de eso formo a sus amigas y vecinas. Actualmente el grupo se encuentra en el segundo ciclo, integrado por 15 mujeres.
La Sra. Idalina se dedica a la venta ambulante de todo tipo de productos, como ser sabanas, frazadas, sobrecamas y demás. Cuenta que vive en pareja hace varios años y con sus hijos que también la ayudan bastante. Comenta que todo lo que hace es por ayudar a su marido y a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas, frazadas, sobrecamas y demás, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que le da.
texts.en:
This committee was started thanks to Señora Idalina, who found out about the program for enterprising women and later formed the group with her friends and neighbors. At present the group is in its second cycle and has 15 women.

Idalina works as a street vendor of all types of products, such as sheets, blankets, bedspreads and more. She says she has lived with her spouse for several years and also with her children who help her a lot. She remarks that everything she has done is to help her husband and family.
 
She is asking for the loan to buy sheets, blankets, bedspreads and more to increase her stock and provide for her customers. She is thankful to the foundation for the opportunity it has given her.

loans.use: to buy sheets, blankets, bedspreads and more.

loans.name: Ulker

texts.en:
Ulker lives in Sabirabad, Azerbaijan. She is 43 years old, married, and a lovely mother of two daughters and one son. 

All her children are adults and help her in farming. They earn a living by breeding cattle and have a small cowshed. Ulker buys young bulls and then raises and sells them at the market. Her husband helps her in selling dairy. Ulker requested this loan in amount of 1,000 AZN for the purchase of two cows. She wants to buy a dairy cow and sell milk.

loans.use: to purchase two cows

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is 25 years old and married with two children. He owns a produce business, which he has been operating for three years. He started as a crop farmer and saved to start his current business. He has a challenge of high transport costs while transporting goods from the farmers to the market. His family goal is to educate his children and he hopes to expand his business to new neighboring markets. Benjamin needs the loan facility to purchase rice to sell.

loans.use: to purchase rice to sell.

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Pech, fifty, is married, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband runs a business buying fish to re-sell. He earns about USD 5 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Pech is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the money she saves on transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Jane, a mother of 5. She hails from Eldoret, which is a rural town in Kenya that is popular for maize farming. Jane has been farming for the last 19 years. She grows cash crops and raises dairy cows and chickens. She makes money selling milk, eggs, and maize.

Jane finds farming to be very fulfilling! Her favorite part of this lifestyle is waking up every day and heading out to the fields to check up on her animals, birds, and crops.

However, she faces certain challenges, such as raising capital for business expansion. Jane is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase more poultry. Jane is seeking to increase poultry sales to meet the demand and to increase her income. The extra income from the expansion will enable her to fulfill the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Balabeyim Baylar Giz

texts.en:
Balabeyim is an old internally displaced person (IDP) who is the mother of one child. Her family\'s living condition is not very good. The family income is rather limited.

Since 2000, Balabeyim has supported her family by working as a cook in her small business. Actually, she is very communicative person who loves people and accepts them as they are. In her view, cooking is some kind of art which reflects the feelings and mood of a cook. She likes international cousine but national dishes such as dolma, plov, khingal are her favorite ones.

Now, she needs a loan of $600 to further develop her business, to buy new kitchen appliances, to increse her incomes via diversifying the menu and attracting more clients.

loans.use: To buy kitchen appliances

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Getting a loan of $700 will help Sister Doris to buy more cereals and grains to sell. Sister Doris is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and has been taught about the TEACH Lending program. she is also very good at keeping records of her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Mrs Lan is 50 years old. Her husband died of tuberculosis 4 years ago. Mrs Lan doesn’t have any land for cultivation because she sold their all land to pay medical treatment for her husband. Linh, her first son stopped going to school. He works as a daily laborer and plants vegetable around house and then sells it at small market to help his mother supports for 5 his brothers and sisters who are going to school. Mrs Lan is weak so selling vegetable is thus important to increase income about $1.5/person/month. Average income is $8.5/person/month. Now, she asks to borrow a loan of $75 for her planting and selling vegetable.

loans.use: selling vegetable

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio is a very hard-working and responsible man. He's married, and to move his family ahead he started his own business eight years ago, selling groceries in his new neighborhood and taking advantage of the scarcity of shops nearby. He started by selling a small number of products, but now he has an extensive stock and has enlarged the store to take up the whole front of his home. His children have helped out; his family unit has been a key piece in developing and growing his business.

The cost of enlarging his store left him unable to afford to keep his business well stocked, which is why he's requesting a loan of $1,1000 to purchase merchandise. He plans to repay the loan within six months. You can help Antonio at his need and contribute to the growth of his business. He and his family are sincerely grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Antonio es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, es casado y para poder sacar adelante a su familia desde hace ocho años inició su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes aprovechando que viven era una colonia nueva donde no había tiendas cercanas, comenzó vendiendo muy pocos productos pero ahora tiene con un extenso surtido y ha ampliado su negocio en todo el frente de su casa, recibe la ayuda de sus hijos y la unión familiar ha sido pieza clave en el desarrollo y crecimiento de esta tienda.

El gasto que realizó en la ampliación de su negocio lo descapitalizó para poder surtir bien su negocio por lo que ahora está solicitando un préstamo de $ 1,100 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Ayuda a Antonio en este momento en que más lo necesita, contribuye al crecimiento de su negocio, él y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sifaga

texts.en: Sifaga is a happy and a friendly woman of thirty-six years of age.  She is married with five children; two of them are attending school and three are at home.  Sifaga has a shop where she offers her services to the people of her village.  It is one of four shops with in her area and there is tough competition.  Sifaga will use her loan to buy stock so that she can provide a good service to meet her customers' needs.  Her husband and the kids help out sometimes but most of time it is her part to play.  Sifaga has a strong heart and believes that she can do better because she’s being supported by her loan from S.P.B.D.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura has been immersed in her cleaning business for 14 years. She is the mother of five children, three of which are school-age students and two of which attend college. She lives with her husband who is an employee of the Regional Hospital of Pucallpa. Laura began with the fabrication of disinfectants and liquid air fresheners, her husband and son doing the mixing in the afternoons after work. Due to the sales and general acceptance of the goods the production grew into a small family business.

To fulfill the needs of this growth Laura must stock up on mixing supplies which she purchases in the capital city. Her business is becoming more stable now that she has various contracts with business and institutions. The loan that she needs is $200, which will be repaid in six months. This value will enable her to increase production.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Laura esta inmersa en el negocio D. la limpieza desD. hace 14 años, ella es madre D. cinco hijos, tres D. las cuales están en el colegio y los otros dos en la universidad, vive con su esposo que trabaja como empleado en el Hospital Regional D. Pucallpa; comenzó con la fabricación D. desinfectantes y ambientadores líquidos, encargándose D. la elaboración su esposo y su hijo por las tardes; debido a las ventas y aceptación que empezó a obtener sus productos fueron aumentando el nivel D. producción D. la microempresa familiar.Frente a esta necesidad D. crecimiento D. la empresa Laura tiene que abastecerse D. insumos para su elaboración comprándolos en la capital ya que sumado a la venta que realiza en su casa tiene varios contratos con empresas e instituciones convirtiéndose en una venta ya segura.El préstamo que necesita es D. 200 dólares, para poder aumentar su producción con un compromiso D. devolución del crédito en seis meses.

loans.use: Purchase of mixing supplies for the production of cleaning products.

loans.name: Louise Njambi

texts.en:
Louise Njambi Ndung’u is 39 years old. She is married with four children. Louise lives in South C Estate, Nairobi, where she operates a small shop. Apart from her family, Louise takes care of an aged parent who lives in the rural area of Kikuyu town. On a sad note, Louise’s brother and his wife passed away last year and left behind three children, whom Louise is now taking care of. The children are aged 15, 12, and 8. Because of this big responsibility, Louise has to work twice as hard so that her dependents have enough for their upkeep.

Louise opened her shop in 1980 after saving about US $147, and her husband gave her an additional $75 to help her with the initial capital. She has since repaid the loan from her husband. The business has been doing well, but the price of commodities has increased, and Louise would also like to add stock so that she can provide her customers a greater variety of goods.

Louise is therefore requesting a loan of US $800. With this loan, Louise will be able to purchase flour (maize and wheat), rice, sugar, snacks, sodas, detergents, cooking oil, and more. This will boost her income, since more customers will be flocking to her shop. The repayment period for this loan is 10 months. She thanks Kiva lenders in advance.

loans.use: To purchase assorted stock for a general store, including maize and wheat flour, rice, sugar, snacks, sodas, detergents, and cooking oil

loans.name: Sabri

texts.en: Sabri A. is a 39-year-old man who sells dairy products to the neighbors and local bazaar traders. He has 7 years of experience in this business. He is married and has three children. Sabri is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) and the income he makes is not enough to purchase meat for his family. He is determined to improve his family's situation and purchase additional two milk cows to expand his business to meet the growing needs of his children. He would like a loan of $1200 to purchase two cows.

loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Oisha

texts.en:
Oisha F. is 54 years old, and she has two children.

Oisha sells peas and various spices and seasoning used for cooking the traditional meals. For instance, one of the spices is called “zira” and is very popular in Tajikistan. It is usually added when cooking “plov”, oriental dumplings, and marinating meat for kebab. Oisha has been in this business for 10 years already. All of these goods are in constant demand by the population, therefore her business is very successful and generates a stable income.

Oisha has been a client of IMON for several years, and for the entire period of time she has proved to be a reliable client and has a positive credit history. Now, she is requesting 1,000.00 US Dollars for the term of 3 months. Oisha plans to spend the loan on buying peas, haricots, spices, and seasoning for selling. She thanks everyone for their support and promises to be prompt in her loan payments.

loans.use: Purchase peas, haricots, and spices used to cook the traditional European meals, and resell them.

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es:
Mrs. Gisela Marjorie is a tough, independent woman who has recently turned her long-standing soft-drink business into a small, successful bar. She has wanted to provide better security to her many customers, but each of her efforts has not been sufficient to improve the bar’s installations. She is applying for this loan to provide better comfort for her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Gisela Marjorie se dedica a la venta de bebidas heladas desde hace mucho tiempo, es una mujer luchadora en poco tiempo ha construido un pequeño bar muy visitado y ha decidido otorgar seguridad a cada uno de los clientes que la visitan, sin embargo todos y cada uno de sus esfuerzos no han sido suficientes para mejorar sus instalaciones, por esa razón solicita un préstamo a fin de brindar comodidad a sus clientes.

loans.use: Improve the installations of her small bar

loans.name: Theab

texts.en: Mrs.Theab S. is a widow and the mother of four children. One of her children is a motor-taxi driver and all four live on their own. Mrs. Theab S. makes a living by selling porridge from a stand in front of her house. She earns about $1 to $2 a day. Theab S. is a diligent mother who has worked hard to help her children since her husband passed away many years ago. She has to get up very early in the morning to cook her breakfast for her customers. Recently, Mrs. Theab decided that it would be a good idea to purchase some pigs to breed on her piece of land because the leftover food from her food stand makes excellent feed for them. To do this, she needs a loan to help her buy some piglets to breed.

loans.use: to buy pigs to breed

loans.name: Faraja Youth Group

texts.en:
Dancan M. is a young Kenyan father aged 30 with 4 children. He also lives with 1 orphan child of his late sister who perished 2 years ago.

Dancan started his business 3 years ago after accumulating savings from his former work place. He currently operates a small posho mill (cereal grinding mill) but would like to diversify into selling cereals like maize and wheat, along with running the posho mill.

Being the primary bread winner for his family, it would enable him to support both his children and wife, who has a low-paying job. With the little profit that he gets from the business, Dancan still struggles to feed, clothe, and educate his children and to pay his house rent. But with the help of his loan, Dancan will be able to expand his business and increase his monthly sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Saneam Soeur Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province form one group in one Village Bank. Mrs. Saneam S. is the Village Bank President and she is a grocer in the local village.

Her business now has insufficient grocery goods for her customers so Mrs. Saneam S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products. Her husband, Mr. Yorn Ong, is a match maker who introduces the bride and groom to get to know each other in order to wed.

Mrs. Saneam S. has three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while one other is studying at state school. The one remaining is too yoU. to work or study. The people who are in the back of the photo are not in this Village Bank.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products for customers.

loans.name: Legase

texts.en: Legase E., 40, is married with 2 children. She has 1 year of experience in the pancake business. She sells to the village people and schoolchildren 6 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). SPBD loans are Legase’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All will be used to start her project. She is running her pancake project while the husband does all the farming to support the family.

loans.use: to start her pancake business.

loans.name: Soneat

texts.en:
Mrs. Soneat Youn, 29, is a widow with one son and one daughter. Both of her children are in the local school. She lives with her parents on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Soneat has been a silk weaver for seven years - a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Besides her weaving business, she also sells groceries from her home.

Soneat is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Martha Angelina

texts.es:
Martha Angelina S. began her own business 4 years ago selling women’s underwear, today she has a business selling ice cream.

She has worked with FAPE but with small loans, which won’t be enough to start this business and expand her business selling ice cream. She is grateful for the support that has been given to her over the past few years.

She is asking for a bigger loan with a longer repayment schedule because she wants to open a tortilla business, which she considers to be a good business.

Her husband helps her economically, but she knows that today her husband’s income isn’t enough, they have three children, all of whom are in school studying.

Her dream is to have two tortilla businesses and have greater income in order to provide the best education possible for her children so that they may become successful people.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Martha Angelina S., inicio su negocio propio hace 4 años vendiendo ropa interior para mujer, en la actualidad tiene una venta de helados.

Ha trabajado con FAPE pero con pequeños prestamos, que no le alcanza para poner ese negocio, y ampliar su negocio de la venta de helados. Esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que se le ha brindado durante varios años.

Ella solicita un préstamo más grande y con un plazo de pago más largo, porque quiere poner un negocio de venta de tortillas, el cual ella considera que es un buen negocio.

Su esposo de ayuda económicamente, pero ella sabe que hoy en día no es suficiente con el ingreso del esposo, tiene tres hijos y todos están estudiando.

Su sueño es tener dos negocios de venta de tortillas, y tener mejores ingresos para darle la mejor educación posible a sus hijos, y que ellos sean personas de éxito.

loans.use: Buy items for her ice cream business and invest in a tortilla business.

loans.name: Veronika

texts.en: Veronika V., 32, is married with 6 children.  She has many years of experience in the cabbages, cucumbers, pumpkins and beans business. She also runs a small shop to get extra money. She sells to the public and villagers 3 days per week. She has had 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 430 Tala (~179 USD).  SPBD loans are Veronika's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use the loan to buy chemicals and also to buy tools and equipment for home improvement.

loans.use: Purchase Use to buy chemicals and pesticides

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en:
Ashura is a tailor in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar. She has received one prior loan from BRAC Tanzania which she paid back successfully and on time. She is currently able to earn a profit of approximately $125 each month. She is seeking her second loan for a larger amount than her first so that she can buy a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

Ashura is 31 years old, married, and has four children.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Файзов Рустам житель города Вахдат. Возраст 34 года , женат и имеет троих детей. Уже 6 лет работает таксистом.Имеет свой автомобиль и работает по маршруту Душанбе-Вахдат. Хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы сделать ремонт автомобиля. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 18 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rustam F. lives in Vahdat. He is 34 years old, is married and has three children. He has been a taxi driver for 6 years. He has his own car and works the Dushanbe-Vahdat route. Rustam would like to take out a loan in order to repair his car. He will pay back the loan over 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car Repairs

loans.name: Khadejah

texts.en:
Khadejah N. is 38 years old and the mother of eight children. She supports her husband and children by selling groceries, canned goods and soft drinks.

Khadejah is seeking a loan of $1,200 to buy basic groceries such as rice, sugar, detergents, milk and other products to increase her stock, expand her business and satisfy the needs of her customers.

Khadejah is very appreciative of the support she receives, as it will allow her to increase her business.

loans.use: To buy more basic groceries to expand her stock.

loans.name: Tao's Group

texts.en: This is a group loan of five members, and Y. is the leader. Y. is 40 years old and grows vegetable crops to sell. She works at growing crops with her husband and cares for one child. Her business is going well, earning around US$ 3 per day, for all her hard work. For another source of income, Y. needs a loan to purchase piglets to raise. She expects the loan help to increase her family's income. These people all live in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Khat's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four people. Its leader, Mr. K., 39, earns a living by catching fish in and around Beung Tunle Sap Lake, an important place for fishing. He normally earns an average of US$ 3 a day from his fishing and has been doing this since 2000. He is married to Kun, 33, who works with him catching fish, and she also is a good mother to five children and cooks delicious foods.

K. is facing problems because his fishing implements break frequently, so he can't catch as many fish as before; thus, he needs a loan in order to purchase more fishing implements.

The other three borrowers are:

S., 55, a local fisherman who is requesting a loan to buy nets for his fishing business;

C., 36, who catches fish for sale, and is asking for a loan to purchase extra nets for fishing; and

C., 28, a grocery seller who is applying for a loan to buy grocery inventory.

The borrowers live in Chong Khneas Commune in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To purchase more fishing implements

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 46 years old and married with 6 children. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. She is a LAPO client. She needs the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marlene tiene 26 años, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en la casa donde instalaron su negocio. Cocinar no era una de las cosas que le agradara realizar, pero con el tiempo la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar la impulsaron a aprender a preparar variedad de comidas para vender. Luego notó que la demanda de personas era mayor cada día y fue creciendo, con este trabajo no tiene que dejar su hogar, debido a que instaló su pequeño comedor en la puerta de su casa, facilitándoles sus labores como madre y como vendedora. Además pudo percibir que su sazón fue mejorando y que las personas la felicitaban por el exquisito menú, lo cual la motivaba  y la llenaba de satisfacción. Desde entonces su negocio fue tomando nuevas perspectivas y ahora tiene el interés de tener un gran restaurante que acoja a grandes cantidades de personas y que logre ser un restaurante de prestigio. Marleny está en su cuarto préstamo con MFP y espera seguir trabajando así porque tuvo la posibilidad de descubrir sus habilidades y capacidades, no tan solo en su negocio, sino también en su relación con las personas. Marlene  tiene  pensado invertir los 2500 soles que solicita en la ambientación del espacio que tiene para su negocio y comprar algunos utensilios para mejorar la atención de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marleny is 26 years old and lives, along with her husband and her two children, in the house where her business is located. Cooking was not one of the things that she was pleased to do, but for the time being the need to help her spouse with the costs of the household forced her to learn to prepare a variety of foods for sale. Then she saw that the demand for her food grew every day and in this line of work she did not need to leave her home because they installed a small countertop in the doorway of their house, facilitating her work as a mother and as a saleswoman. She could see that her cooking skill was improving and that people welcomed her gourmet menu, which motivated her and gave her satisfaction. Since then her business has given her new perspectives and now she is interested in opening a large restaurant that could hold a large number of people and which would be a restaurant of prestige. Marleny is in her fourth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and hopes to continue working in this way because she has had the opportunity to discover her skills and abilities, not only in her business, but also in her relations with people. Marleny plans to invest the 2500 soles that she is asking for in the decoration of the space that she has for her business and to buy some utensils for improving the interest of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her place of business and to buy utensils

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is 50 years old. She is a married woman and has sons and daughters. Some of them are in senior high school and others are in junior high school. Comfort lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.
She is a trader. She deals in all sorts of vegetables such as cabbage, lettuce, carrots, onions, etc. Comfort procures her vegetables from farms in the nearby communities. She sells on a tabletop in the market square. She says she distributes some of her goods to retailers and restaurant operators. Comfort has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure the vegetables in bulk. She is hoping to improve her standard of living and give her children the support they need to further their education.

loans.use: To procure vegetables

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden, 34 and married to Dennis, has a three-year-old son named John Mark. Eden manages a grocery store located in the peaceful village of Magsaysay, Saguday, Quirino. She has been in this business for four years, and it really helps in providing for the needs of her family. She has an assistant and in this way is able to provide employment to others.

Eden is requesting a loan amount of PHP16,000 as additional business capital to help improve her store and meet the demands of her customers. “To have a successful life, there should be hard work and perseverance”, says Eden.

loans.use: Business Improvement

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Abiba A., 36, is married and the mother of two children, a boy and a girl, both pursuing education in primary school. She lives with her family in their own house at Ejura, a farming community in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Abiba’s husband is a farmer who cultivates food crops and all kinds of vegetables, while she works hard to support his efforts by selling beans and groundnuts in the community market, having done this now for 16 years. She buys her goods from the farmers in the surrounding villages and is now requesting a loan to buy in bulk in order to reduce travelling costs and maximize profit.

Abiba is a member of the community group called Hope trust group, whose members guarantee one another as social collateral to access the loan and support one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs in bulk.

loans.name: Magielyn

texts.en:
According to Magielyn, she has to prioritize for the future of her children. Her husband is Mario V. and together with their children, her family happily lives in Barangay Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She makes a lot of sacrifices to support the studies of their children to give them a better future someday. Despite their financial difficulties in life, they still have the desire to give their children the best education possible.

Furniture making is a popular source of income in the village. Her husband used to work a local business making tables, chairs, cabinets and even sala set. This gave them the idea to open up their own furniture business. Because they lack financial capital to expand their business, Magielyn is seeking the assistance of KIVA lenders.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 for their business. Magielyn hopes to purchase more furniture materials and wood needed for the continuous operation of their business.

loans.use: Business Capital.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina, along with her husband, runs a ferryboat transportation business. Their boat, that is used in transporting passengers to cross the river, needs repair. Since Victorina has already paid back her previous loan, she is again asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 from Kiva lenders to be able pursue their daily ferryboat operation. According to her, the boat is already ruined, has holes, and parts are already old that need to be replaced. She hopes that their business will improve and that they are able to pursue their business and generate more income.
	
Victorina is married to Romeo T., a farmer. Their children are: Isidro, 30 years old, who is presently employed as a security guard; Rubelyn, 29, who is already married; and Nazarene. These three are all college graduates while their youngest is a special child and, because of this, he was not able to go to school. Victorina hopes that somehow, with their very poor livelihood, someday they will overcome the hardships of life.

loans.use: To repair their ferryboat

loans.name: Mirzaman

texts.en:
Mirzaman K. is 53 years old. He is married and the father of 3 children. Mirzaman owns a grocery store and provides for his family with the revenue generated by the grocery store. He is requesting a loan to increase the stock of foodstuffs in his grocery store and also for construction materials. 

Mirzaman is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once and awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children progress by means of their studies, for which he is doing his best. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: purchase more foodstuffs for the store

loans.name: Rahmidin

texts.ru: Мухридинов Рахмидин проживает в районе Шахритуза. Возраст 29 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена колхозница. рахмидин более 6 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Он выращивает рис и продает его. Кредит просит для сбора и повторного посева урожая риса и пшеницы.
texts.en:
Rahmidin M. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 29 years, married and has 3 children. His wife is a farmer. Rahmidin has been involved in agriculture for over 6 years. He grows rice and sells it. He is requesting a loan for harvesting and new sowing of rice and wheat.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Harvesting and new sowing of rice and wheat

loans.name: Lustica

texts.en:
Lustica is a member of the Mtivila North borrower group in Kihesa,Iringa,she is 50 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 5 children.Her children are aged 30,25,20,15,10 years.she also cares for other 3 dependents.

Lustica started her own crop business selling maize 13 years ago,she works 7 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 160,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Lustica first loan from BRAC-Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more maize.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Lustica hopes to save money,pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more crop

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: Marcos tiene 28 años, es soltero y vive con sus padres y su hermana de 19 años. Desde hace 12 años brinda servicios eléctricos, pues estudió este oficio. Sin embargo, como esta actividad no tiene ingresos regulares, se asoció con dos amigos para la apertura de un taller de electricidad, vulcanizadora y una sala de billar desde hace un año, donde cada uno de ellos cumple sus funciones y labores, pero al momento de pagar el alquiler D. local todos colaboran en partes iguales. Marcos se considera un joven muy proactivo, es por eso que también se dedica, en sus ratos libres, a la compra y venta de granos y de animales, esto lo hace desde hace 8 años y le va muy bien. Le gusta su nuevo negocio porque el local de su taller es muy acogedor y se encuentra ubicado en una buena zona para la captación de clientes. Para más adelante Marcos piensa independizarse, pero por ahora seguirá trabajando de la misma manera hasta cumplir su objetivo. Este es su 3er crédito con MFP y está muy satisfecho de su trabajo con su banco comunal porque todos sus compañeros son cumplidos y muy buenas personas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más herramientas para implementar su taller, además de granos y animales para la venta.
texts.en:
Marcos is a 28-year old single man who lives with his parents and 19 year-old sister. For twelve years he has offered electrical services, as he studied to be an electrician. However, since this work does not provide steady income, a year ago, he joined two friends to open an electricity workshop, tire repair shop, and a pool hall. Each man does his own separate work but when paying rent all colloborate in equal amounts. Marcos considers himself a proactive young man and, for the past eight years, has dedicated his free time to the buying and selling of grains and animals. The business is going very well. He likes his new business because the site of the workshop is very inviting and located in a good area for attracting customers. In the future, Marcos hopes to become more independent, but for now he will continue working in the same way to achieve his goals. This is his third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, which is satisfied with his work with their community bank because his partners are considerate and good people. With the money he is requesting he will buy more tools to set up his workshop as well as grains and animals to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying tools for his workshop

loans.name: Amos Ng'ang'a

texts.en: Amos is 32 years old and married with one child. He is a retailer of cakes and bread and his business is situated in Kikuyu town where his customers live. He has been running the business for nine years and it has generated a steady income. Amos has never borrowed from another micro-loan financial institution. This will be his third loan from KADET and he plans to use the loan to increase his stock of cakes and bread. Amos hopes to own his bakery in the future. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To increase his stock of cakes and bread

loans.name: Temukisa

texts.en:
Temukisa A. is a 48 year-old woman living in the town of Leualesi Leauvaa.  She is married and has 7 children adult -aged children.  To make a living, Temukisa owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale.  Temukisa has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately $550 WST a month from these activities.

In 2003, Temukisa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Temukisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of $2750 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase land to raise additional crops.  Temukisa is now requesting a new loan of $2950 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  The loan will be the 7th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Temukisa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Gileziel

texts.en:
Gileziel H. is from Ananawon in Valencia City. She is 35 years old. Gileziel is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gileziel sells seafood, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Gileziel has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Gileziel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gileziel is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Gileziel's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mean

texts.en:
Mean V., 39, is married with seven children. Five of her children are enrolled in a local school. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband (pictured) and children. The family is assisted mainly by her husband who is currently involved in a business of buying fish from the local fisherman and reselling it at a fair profitable price. He is able to earn an income of US $14.50 per day as a primary source of income for his family and to support the three children’s studies. One of her children is employed at a restaurant in the town as a waiter, earning an income of US $2.66 per day to partly cover the household expenses.

Mrs. V. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, V. is asking for a loan of US $700 to purchase more fish to expand her husband’s current business and to generate extra income.

loans.use: To buy fish.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis N. is 39 years old, married to Lucy Muthoni and they have four school-age children. He has been operating a welding workshop where he makes doors and windows from metal. He has been in this business in Naivasha town for the last 15 years. He does the doors and windows to clients' specifications and they are preferred to wooden doors for they offer some security.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. With this loan he plans to buy a new welding gun so that he does not loose business, especially since the demand for the metal doors and windows has gone up with the steady rise of real estate developments.

He has sees himself as a landlord in future by moving into the real estate business and to get there he soon plans to purchase a piece of land for this very purpose. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy a new welding gun

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La socia FORTUNATA es una humilde madre de familia que ya son varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”.    

La socia tiene 53 años de edad. La socia tiene cinco hijos que ya son mayores e independientes. Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la comunidad de Angostura que se encuentra ubicada al sur de la ciudad del Cusco. La socia tiene un taller de carpintería.
