Ella fabrica muebles de madera como escritorios, roperos, camas y sillas y también posee un carro que lo alquila para que de servicio de taxi. Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar y con la ayuda que hace al taller de carpintería, ella laquea los muebles de madera. Ya son  varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que va sacar adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en los materiales para el acabado de los muebles de madera que son importantes para este proceso como son el tiner, la laca, la pintura y muchos más. Ella dice ser una madre ejemplares que desde muy joven tenía que trabajar para llevar un pan a la boca de los hijos y considera que no dejaran de trabajar hasta que no le quede mas fuerzas para trabajar.    

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Fortunata is a humble mother who has been a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Purificada – Angostura” for several years. She is 53 years old and has 5 grown children who are independent.

Fortunata lives in the community of Angostura in San Jerónimo District, which is located south of the city of Cusco. She has a carpentry workshop where she makes wood furniture such as desks, wardrobes, beds, and chairs. In addition, she has a car that she rents out for taxi services. Fortunata divides her time between tending to her household duties and helping run the carpentry shop. She is responsible for applying lacquer to the wood furniture.

Fortunata has been in this business for several years and has done very well because of her efforts. She is a hardworking and enterprising mother who wants to succeed for the sake of her family. This loan will be used to purchase materials that are important to the process of treating the finished furniture pieces such as thinner, lacquer, paint, and other products. Ever since she was young woman, Fortunata has tried to be an exemplary mother by working to feed her children. She never considered quitting and is determined to continue working until she no longer has the strength.

Fortunata is grateful for this opportunity and commits to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase thinners, lacquers, paints, and other supplies

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale, cette femme fait face en ce moment à une hausse de la demande de ses clients,  elle doit par conséquent augmenter son stock, elle sollicite alors de WAGES son tout premier crédit pour acheter 6 sacs de riz, 3 bidons d’huile, 4 sachets d’eau « PURE WATER », 20  boîtes de conserve et divers. Elle a commencé à exercer ce commerce en 2000, elle compte sur son expérience pour rentabiliser ce prêt.
texts.en:
This woman sells food at a general store. Demand from her clients is growing, and as a consequence she has to increase her food supply. She is requesting her first-ever loan from WAGES to buy 6 bags of rice, 3 cans of oil, 4 packets of "PURE WATER", 20 cans of food and miscellaneous other products. She started this business in 2000 and will rely on her experience to pay back the loan.


Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.en:
Mr. Ibrahima D. has been farming cereals and raising livestock for over thirty-five years in Bambey, a rural area about one hundred kilometers from Dakar. Farming has been a family tradition and an important part of the local culture. UIMCEC opened a branch in Bambey in July to serve the rural clientele.

With the loan of 150,000 FCFA, Mr. D. would like to purchase two male goats. After the Tabaski celebration, in which each family must sacrifice a male goat, many vendors are eager to sell off their remaining herd before returning home. Mr. D. will keep the goats until the prices have risen and he can resell them.

With the revenue from this activity, Mr. D. would like to save towards buying land for building a small house which he could rent out. Mr. D. is a widower and has one child, who is now an adult.

loans.use: To purchase two goats

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria J. is from the village of Tumpagon Cagayan de Oro City. She is 53 years old. Maria is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Maria owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells both food & daily use products in the local community. Maria has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Maria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Maria is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Maria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 32 years old and married to Lucy Wangui. They have three children, two of whom are in school and the other is three months old.  Peter owns a motorcycle which he uses to transport people and goods to different places.  This has been his source of income for the last five years within the town of Naivasha.

Peter was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use it to buy a new motorcycle and employ a transport operator, hence increasing his income.

Peter plans to buy a minibus in future to transport people from one place to another.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcyle

loans.name: C 2892 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Clothilde is 32 years old. She is married with four children and she takes care of two dependents.

Clothilde is the president of a group called Tuzamurane. She and her team operate the business of sewing various styles of clothes. This is their third successful year in this business and the hours of their business are from 6 a.m. until late in the evening hours.

Clothilde and her team are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of purchasing more sewing machines plus some other clothing items. With these new purchased machines, she and her team will sew more attractive clothing styles for sale as well as additional sizes.

With this Kiva loan, Clothilde and her team hope to earn more profits in the process. This, in turn will allow each member of the team to take care of his or her family.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing machines and clothing items
